As [they]982-them walked away , [the servant]315-the servant turned round , nodding [her]315-the servant head and smiling , as if to assure [me]0-i that [I]0-i had lost nothing by the forbearance which [I]0-i had exercised . [Margaret]44-margaret neither lingered nor looked back . This last proof of modesty and reserve , so far from discouraging , attracted [me]0-i to [her]44-margaret more powerfully than ever . After a first interview , it was the most becoming virtue [she]44-margaret could have shown . All [my]0-i love for [her]44-margaret before , seemed as nothing compared with [my]0-i love for [her]44-margaret now that [she]44-margaret had left [me]0-i , and left [me]0-i without a parting look .

What course should [I]0-i next pursue ? Could [I]0-i expect that [Margaret]44-margaret , after what [she]44-margaret had said , would go out again at the same hour on the morrow ? No : [she]44-margaret would not so soon abandon the modesty and restraint that [she]44-margaret had shown at [our]984-our first interview . How communicate with [her]44-margaret ? how manage most skilfully to make good the first favourable impression which vanity whispered [I]0-i had already produced ? [I]0-i determined to write to [her]44-margaret .

How different was the writing of that letter , to the writing of those once - treasured pages of [my]0-i romance , which [I]0-i had now abandoned for ever ! How slowly [I]0-i worked ; how cautiously and diffidently [I]0-i built up sentence after sentence , and doubtingly set a stop here , and laboriously rounded off a paragraph there , when [I]0-i toiled in the service of ambition ! Now , when [I]0-i had given [myself]0-i up to the service of love , how rapidly the pen ran over the paper ; how much more freely and smoothly the desires of the heart flowed into words , than the thoughts of the mind ! Composition was an instinct now , an art no longer . [I]0-i could write eloquently , and yet write without pausing for an expression or blotting a word - It was the slow progress up [the hill]985-the hill , in the service of ambition ; it was the swift too swift career down it , in the service of love !

There is no need to describe the contents of [my]0-i letter to [Margaret]44-margaret ; they comprised a mere recapitulation of what [I]0-i had already said to [her]44-margaret . [I]0-i insisted often and strongly on the honourable purpose of [my]0-i suit ; and ended by entreating [her]44-margaret to write an answer , and consent to allow [me]0-i another interview .

The letter was delivered by [the servant]315-the servant . Another present , a little more timely persuasion , and above all , the regard [I]0-i had shown to [my]0-i promise , won [the girl]687-the girl with all [her]687-the girl heart to [my]0-i interests . [She]687-the girl was ready to help [me]0-i in every way , as long as [her]687-the girl interference could be kept a secret from [[her]687-the girl master]988-her master .

[I]0-i waited a day for the reply to [my]0-i letter ; but none came . [The servant]315-the servant could give [me]0-i no explanation of this silence . [[Her]44-margaret young mistress]971-her young mistress had not said one word to [her]44-margaret about [me]0-i , since the morning when [we]991-we had met . Still not discouraged , [I]0-i wrote again . The letter contained some [lover]992-lover 's threats this time , as well as [lover]992-lover 's entreaties ; and it produced its effect - an answer came .

It was very short - rather hurriedly and tremblingly written - and simply said that the difference between [my]0-i rank and [hers]44-margaret made it [her]44-margaret duty to request of [me]0-i , that neither by word nor by letter should [I]0-i ever address [her]44-margaret again .

" Difference in rank , "[44-margaret] - that was the only objection then ! " [Her]44-margaret duty "[44-margaret] - it was not from inclination that [she]44-margaret refused [me]0-i ! [So young a creature]994-so young a creature ; and yet so noble in self - sacrifice , so firm in [her]44-margaret integrity ! [I]0-i resolved to disobey [her]44-margaret injunction , and see [her]44-margaret again . [My]0-i rank ! What was [my]0-i rank ? Something to cast at [Margaret]44-margaret 's feet , for [Margaret]44-margaret to trample on !

Once more [I]0-i sought the aid of [[my]0-i faithful ally]995-my faithful ally , [the servant]315-the servant . After delays which half maddened [me]0-i with impatience , insignificant though they were , [she]995-my faithful ally contrived to fulfil [my]0-i wishes . One afternoon , while [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin was away at business , and while [[his]42-mr. sherwin wife]997-his wife had gone out , [I]0-i succeeded in gaining admission to [the garden]998-the garden at the back of [the house]244-the house , where [Margaret]44-margaret was then occupied in watering some flowers .

[She]44-margaret started as [she]44-margaret saw [me]0-i , and attempted to return to [the house]244-the house . [I]0-i took [her]44-margaret hand to detain [her]44-margaret . [She]44-margaret withdrew it , but neither abruptly nor angrily . [I]0-i seized the opportunity , while [she]44-margaret hesitated whether to persist or not in retiring ; and repeated what [I]0-i had already said to [her]44-margaret at [our]1001-our first interview what is the language of love but a language of repetitions ? . [She]44-margaret answered , as [she]44-margaret had answered [me]0-i in [her]44-margaret letter : the difference in [our]1001-our rank made it [her]44-margaret duty to discourage [me]0-i .

" But if this difference did not exist , "[0-i] [I]0-i said : " if [we]1001-our were both living in the same rank , [Margaret]44-margaret - "[0-i]

[She]44-margaret looked up quickly ; then moved away a step or two , as [I]0-i addressed [her]44-margaret by [her]44-margaret Christian name .

"[44-margaret]

" Suppose this difference in rank , which [you]0-i so cruelly insist on , did not exist , would [you]0-i tell [me]44-margaret not to hope , not to speak then , as coldly as [you]0-i tell [me]44-margaret now ? "[44-margaret]

[I]0-i must not ask [her]44-margaret that - it was no use - the difference in rank did exist .

" Perhaps [I]44-margaret have met [you]44-margaret too late ? - perhaps [you]44-margaret are already - "[44-margaret]

" No ! oh , no ! "[44-margaret] - [she]44-margaret stopped abruptly , as the words passed [her]44-margaret lips . The same lovely blush which [I]0-i had before seen spreading over [her]44-margaret face , rose on it now . [She]44-margaret evidently felt that [she]44-margaret had unguardedly said too much : that [she]44-margaret had given [me]0-i an answer in a case where , according to every established love - law of the female code , [I]0-i had no right to expect one . [Her]44-margaret next words accused [me]0-i - but in very low and broken tones - of having committed an intrusion which [she]44-margaret should hardly have expected from [a gentleman in [my]0-i position]1003-a gentleman in my position .

" [I]0-i will regain [your]44-margaret better opinion , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , eagerly catching at the most favourable interpretation of [her]44-margaret last words , " by seeing [you]44-margaret for the next time , and for all times after , with [[your]44-margaret father]302-your father 's full permission . "[0-i] A smile , which [she]44-margaret vainly strove to repress , stole charmingly to [her]44-margaret lips . [I]0-i attempted to take [her]44-margaret hand a second time ; but [she]44-margaret broke from [me]0-i , and hurried into [the house]244-the house .

What more could [I]0-i desire ? What more could the modesty and timidity of [a young girl]666-a young girl concede to [me]0-i ?

The moment [I]0-i reached [home]176-home , [I]0-i wrote to [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin . The letter was superscribed " Private ; "[42-mr. sherwin] and simply requested an interview with [him]42-mr. sherwin on a subject of importance , at any hour [he]42-mr. sherwin might mention . Unwilling to trust what [I]0-i had written to the post , [I]0-i sent [my]0-i note by [a messenger]1007-a messenger - [not one of [[our]1009-our own servants]1010-our own servants]1008-not one of our own servants , caution forbade that - and instructed [the man]696-the man to wait for an answer : if [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin was out , to wait till [he]42-mr. sherwin came [home]176-home .

After a long delay - long to [me]0-i ; for [my]0-i impatience would fain have turned hours into minutes - [I]0-i received a reply . It was written on gilt - edged letter - paper , in a handwriting vulgarised by innumerable flourishes . [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin presented [his]42-mr. sherwin respectful compliments , and would be happy to have the honour of seeing [me]0-i at [North Villa]11-north villa , if quite convenient , at five o'clock to - morrow afternoon .

[I]0-i folded up the letter carefully : it was almost as precious as a letter from [Margaret]44-margaret [herself]44-margaret . That night [I]0-i passed sleeplessly , revolving in [my]0-i mind every possible course that [I]0-i could take at the interview of the morrow . It would be a difficult and a delicate business . [I]0-i knew nothing of [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin 's character ; yet [I]0-i must trust [him]42-mr. sherwin with a secret which [I]0-i dared not trust to [[my]0-i own father]1013-my own father . Any proposals for paying addresses to [[his]42-mr. sherwin daughter]233-his daughter , coming from one in [my]0-i position , might appear open to suspicion . What could [I]0-i say about marriage ? A public , acknowledged marriage was impossible : a private marriage might be a bold , if not fatal proposal . [I]0-i could come to no other conclusion , reflect as anxiously as [I]0-i might , than that it was best for [me]0-i to speak candidly at all hazards . [I]0-i could be candid enough when it suited [my]0-i purpose !

It was not till the next day , when the time approached for [my]0-i interview with [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin , that [I]0-i thoroughly roused [myself]0-i to face the plain necessities of [my]0-i position . Determined to try what impression appearances could make on [him]42-mr. sherwin , [I]0-i took unusual pains with [my]0-i dress ; and more , [I]0-i applied to a friend whom [I]0-i could rely on as likely to ask no questions - [I]0-i write this in shame and sorrow : [I]0-i tell truth here , where it is hard penance to tell it - [I]0-i applied , [I]0-i say , to [a friend]512-a friend for the loan of one of [[his]512-a friend carriages]1016-his carriages to take [me]0-i to [North Villa]11-north villa ; fearing the risk of borrowing [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's carriage , or [[my]0-i sister]296-my sister 's - knowing the common weakness of rank - worship and wealth - worship in men of [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin 's order , and meanly determining to profit by it to the utmost . [[My]0-i friend]3044-my friend 's carriage was willingly lent [me]0-i . By [my]0-i directions , it took [me]0-i up at the appointed hour , at [a shop where [I]0-i was [a regular customer]1021-a regular customer]1020-a shop where i was a regular customer .

[X.]50-x.

On [my]0-i arrival at [North Villa]11-north villa , [I]0-i was shown into what [I]0-i presumed was [the drawing - room]1022-the drawing - room .

Everything was oppressively new . The brilliantly - varnished door cracked with a report like a pistol when it was opened ; the paper on the walls , with its gaudy pattern of birds , trellis - work , and flowers , in gold , red , and green on a white ground , looked hardly dry yet ; the showy window - curtains of white and sky - blue , and the still showier carpet of red and yellow , seemed as if [they]1023-they had come out of [the shop]790-the shop yesterday ; the round rosewood table was in a painfully high state of polish ; the morocco - bound picture books that lay on it , looked as if they had never been moved or opened since they had been bought ; not one leaf even of the music on the piano was dogs - eared or worn . Never was [a richly furnished room more thoroughly comfortless than this]1025-a richly furnished room more thoroughly comfortless than this - the eye ached at looking round [it]1025-a richly furnished room more thoroughly comfortless than this . There was no repose anywhere . The print of the Queen , hanging lonely on the wall , in [its]1026-its heavy gilt frame , with a large crown at the top , glared on [you]1027-you : the paper , the curtains , the carpet glared on [you]1027-you : the books , the wax - flowers in glass - cases , the chairs in flaring chintz - covers , the china plates on the door , the blue and pink glass vases and cups ranged on the chimney - piece , the over - ornamented chiffoniers with Tonbridge toys and long - necked smelling bottles on [their]1023-they upper shelves - all glared on [you]1027-you . There was no look of shadow , shelter , secrecy , or retirement in any one nook or corner of those four gaudy walls . All surrounding objects seemed startlingly near to the eye ; much nearer than they really were . [The room]263-the room would have given [a nervous man]1029-a nervous man the headache , before [he]1029-a nervous man had been in it a quarter of an hour .

[I]0-i was not kept waiting long . Another violent crack from the new door , announced the entrance of [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin [himself]42-mr. sherwin .

[He]42-mr. sherwin was [a tall , thin man]1030-a tall , thin man : rather round - shouldered ; weak at the knees , and trying to conceal the weakness in the breadth of [his]42-mr. sherwin trowsers . [He]42-mr. sherwin wore a white cravat , and an absurdly high shirt collar . [His]42-mr. sherwin complexion was sallow ; [his]42-mr. sherwin eyes were small , black , bright , and incessantly in motion - indeed , all [his]42-mr. sherwin features were singularly mobile : they were affected by nervous contractions and spasms which were constantly drawing up and down in all directions the brow , the mouth , and the muscles of the cheek . [His]42-mr. sherwin hair had been black , but was now turning to a sort of iron - grey ; it was very dry , wiry , and plentiful , and part of it projected almost horizontally over [his]42-mr. sherwin forehead . [He]42-mr. sherwin had a habit of stretching it in this direction , by irritably combing it out , from time to time , with [his]42-mr. sherwin fingers . [His]42-mr. sherwin lips were thin and colourless , the lines about them being numerous and strongly marked . Had [I]0-i seen [him]42-mr. sherwin under ordinary circumstances , [I]0-i should have set [him]42-mr. sherwin down as [a little - minded man]1031-a little - minded man ; [a small tyrant in [his]42-mr. sherwin own way over [those dependent on [him]42-mr. sherwin]1033-those dependent on him]1032-a small tyrant in his own way over those dependent on him ; [a pompous parasite to those above [him]42-mr. sherwin]1034-a pompous parasite to those above him - [a great stickler for the conventional respectabilities of life]1035-a great stickler for the conventional respectabilities of life , and a great believer in [his]42-mr. sherwin own infallibility . But [he]42-mr. sherwin was [[Margaret]44-margaret 's father]1036-margaret 's father ; and [I]0-i was determined to be pleased with [him]42-mr. sherwin .

[He]42-mr. sherwin made [me]0-i a low and rather a cringing bow - then looked to the window , and seeing [the carriage]877-the carriage waiting for [me]0-i at [his]42-mr. sherwin door , made another bow , and insisted on relieving [me]0-i of [my]0-i hat with [his]42-mr. sherwin own hand . [I]0-i felt some difficulty in opening [my]0-i business to [him]42-mr. sherwin . It was necessary to speak , however , at once - [I]0-i began with an apology .

" Upon [my]1040-he soul this is the most extraordinary proceeding - - ! "[1040-he]

[He]1040-he muttered something unintelligible ; [his]1040-he complexion turned yellower ; [he]1040-he dropped [my]0-i card , which [he]1040-he had by this time crushed into fragments ; and ran [his]1040-he hand rapidly through [his]1040-he hair until [he]1040-he had stretched it out like a penthouse over [his]1040-he forehead - blinking all the time , and regarding [me]0-i with a lowering , sinister expression of countenance . " [I]0-i ought to have been plainer , [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin ; [I]0-i ought perhaps to have told [you]42-mr. sherwin at the outset , in so many words , that [I]0-i came to - "[0-i] [I]0-i was about to say , " to ask [[your]42-mr. sherwin daughter]3131-your daughter 's hand in marriage ; "[0-i] but a thought of [[my]0-i father]147-my father moved darkly over [my]0-i mind at that moment , and the words would not pass [my]0-i lips .

" Well , [Sir]3046-sir ! to what ? "[1040-he]

The tone in which [he]1040-he said this was harsh enough to rouse [me]0-i . It gave [me]0-i back [my]0-i self - possession immediately .

" To ask [your]42-mr. sherwin permission to pay [my]1040-he addresses to [Miss Sherwin]44-margaret - or , to be plainer still , if [you]42-mr. sherwin like , to ask of [you]42-mr. sherwin [her]44-margaret hand in marriage . "[1040-he]

The words were spoken . Even if [I]0-i could have done so , [I]0-i would not have recalled what [I]0-i had just said ; but still , [I]0-i trembled in spite of [myself]0-i as [I]0-i expressed in plain , blunt words what [I]0-i had only rapturously thought over , or delicately hinted at to [Margaret]44-margaret , up to this time .

" God bless [me]42-mr. sherwin ! " But [I]1045-i tell [you]1045-i , [Sir]3046-sir , [I]1045-i ca n't see [my]1045-i way through it at all . Chance ! what chance would there be , after what [you]1045-i have told [me]1045-i ? "[1045-i]

" There might be many chances . In short , [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin , before marriage , it would be impossible to move [him]147-my father - after marriage , when opposition could no longer be of any avail , it would be quite a different thing : [we]3182-us might be sure of producing , sooner or later , the most favourable results . This is why it would be absolutely necessary to keep [our]3182-us union secret at first . "[1045-i]

[I]0-i wondered then - [I]0-i have since wondered more - how it was that [I]0-i contrived to speak thus , so smoothly and so unhesitatingly , when [my]0-i conscience was giving the lie all the while to every word [I]0-i uttered .

With a louder crack than ever , the brand - new drawing - room door was opened to let [me]0-i out . The noise was instantly succeeded by the rustling of a silk dress , and the banging of another door , at the opposite end of [the passage]1048-the passage . Had [anybody]723-anybody been listening ? Where was [Margaret]44-margaret ?

[Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin stood at [the garden]998-the garden - gate to watch [my]0-i departure , and to make [his]42-mr. sherwin farewell bow . Thick as was the atmosphere of illusion in which [I]0-i now lived , [I]0-i shuddered involuntarily as [I]0-i returned [his]42-mr. sherwin parting salute , and thought of [him]42-mr. sherwin as [[my]0-i father - in - law]1051-my father - in - law !

[XI]52-xi .

The nearer [I]0-i approached to [our]1052-our own door , the more reluctance [I]0-i felt to pass the short interval between [my]0-i first and second interview with [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin , at [home]176-home . When [I]0-i entered [the house]244-the house , this reluctance increased to something almost like dread . [I]0-i felt unwilling and unfit to meet the eyes of [[my]0-i nearest and dearest relatives]1055-my nearest and dearest relatives . It was a relief to [me]0-i to hear that [[my]0-i father]147-my father was not at [home]176-home . [[My]0-i sister]296-my sister was in [the house]244-the house : [the servant]315-the servant said [she]315-the servant had just gone into [the library]1061-the library , and inquired whether [he]315-the servant should tell [her]315-the servant that [I]0-i had come in . [I]0-i desired [him]315-the servant not to disturb [her]315-the servant , as it was [my]0-i intention to go out again immediately .

[I]0-i went into [[my]0-i study]609-my study , and wrote a short note there to [Clara]57-clara ; merely telling [her]57-clara that [I]0-i should be absent in [the country]370-the country for two days . [I]0-i had sealed and laid it on the table for [the servant]315-the servant to deliver , and was about to leave [the room]263-the room , when [I]0-i heard [the library]1061-the library door open . [I]0-i instantly drew back , and half - closed [my]0-i own door again . [Clara]57-clara had got the book [she]57-clara wanted , and was taking it up to [[her]57-clara own sitting - room]1067-her own sitting - room . [I]0-i waited till [she]57-clara was out of sight , and then left [the house]244-the house . It was the first time [I]0-i had ever avoided [[my]0-i sister]296-my sister - [[my]0-i sister]296-my sister , who had never in [her]296-my sister life asked a question , or uttered a word that could annoy [me]0-i ; [[my]0-i sister , who had confided all [her]296-my sister own little secrets to [my]0-i keeping , ever since [we]1072-we had been [children]139-children]1071-my sister , who had confided all her own little secrets to my keeping , ever since we had been children . As [I]0-i thought on what [I]0-i had done , [I]0-i felt a sense of humiliation which was almost punishment enough for the meanness of which [I]0-i had been guilty .

[I]0-i went round to [the stables]741-the stables , and had [my]0-i horse saddled immediately . No idea of proceeding in any particular direction occurred to [me]0-i . [I]0-i simply felt resolved to pass [my]0-i two days ' ordeal of suspense away from [home]176-home - far enough away to keep [me]0-i faithful to [my]0-i promise not to see [Margaret]44-margaret . Soon after [I]0-i started , [I]0-i left [my]0-i horse to [his]1076-his own guidance , and gave [myself]0-i up to [my]0-i thoughts and recollections , as one by one they rose within [me]0-i . The animal took the direction which [he]1076-his had been oftenest used to take during [my]0-i residence in [London]10-london - [the northern road]1077-the northern road .

It was not until [I]0-i had ridden half a mile beyond [the suburbs]1078-the suburbs that [I]0-i looked round [me]0-i , and discovered towards [what part of [the country]370-the country [I]0-i was proceeding]1079-what part of the country i was proceeding . [I]0-i drew the rein directly , and turned [my]0-i horse 's head back again , towards [the south]1081-the south . To follow [the favourite road]1082-the favourite road which [I]0-i had so often followed with [Clara]57-clara ; to stop perhaps at [some place where [I]0-i had often stopped with [her]57-clara]1083-some place where i had often stopped with her , was more than [I]0-i had the courage or the insensibility to do at that moment .

[I]0-i rode as far as [Ewell]14-ewell , and stopped there : the darkness had overtaken [me]0-i , and it was useless to tire [my]0-i horse by going on any greater distance . The next morning , [I]0-i was up almost with sunrise ; and passed the greater part of the day in walking about among [villages]1084-villages , [lanes]1085-lanes , and [fields]1086-fields , just as chance led [me]0-i . During the night , many thoughts that [I]0-i had banished for the last week had returned - those thoughts of evil omen under which the mind seems to ache , just as the body aches under a dull , heavy pain , to which [we]1087-we can assign no particular place or cause . Absent from [Margaret]44-margaret , [I]0-i had no resource against the oppression that now overcame [me]0-i . [I]0-i could only endeavour to alleviate it by keeping incessantly in action ; by walking or riding , hour after hour , in the vain attempt to quiet the mind by wearying out the body . Apprehension of the failure of [my]0-i application to [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin had nothing to do with the vague gloom which now darkened [my]0-i thoughts ; [they]1088-they kept too near [home]176-home for that . Besides , what [I]0-i had observed of [[Margaret]44-margaret 's father]1036-margaret 's father , especially during the latter part of [my]0-i interview with [him]1036-margaret 's father , showed [me]0-i plainly enough that [he]1036-margaret 's father was trying to conceal , under exaggerated surprise and assumed hesitation , [his]1036-margaret 's father secret desire to profit at once by [my]0-i offer ; which , whatever conditions might clog it , was infinitely more advantageous in a social point of view , than any [he]1036-margaret 's father could have hoped for . It was not [his]1036-margaret 's father delay in accepting [my]0-i proposals , but the burden of deceit , the fetters of concealment forced on [me]0-i by the proposals themselves , which now hung heavy on [my]0-i heart .

That evening [I]0-i left [Ewell]14-ewell , and rode towards [home]176-home again , as far as [Richmond]6-richmond , where [I]0-i remained for the night and the forepart of the next day . [I]0-i reached [London]10-london in the afternoon ; and got to [North Villa]11-north villa - without going [home]176-home first - about five o'clock .

The oppression was still on [my]0-i spirits . Even the sight of [the house where [Margaret]44-margaret lived]1093-the house where margaret lived failed to invigorate or arouse [me]0-i .

On this occasion , when [I]0-i was shown into [the drawing - room]1022-the drawing - room , both [Mr.]1095-mr. and [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin were awaiting [me]0-i [there]161-there . On the table was the sherry which had been so perseveringly pressed on [me]0-i at the last interview , and by it a new pound cake . [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin was cutting the cake as [I]0-i came in , while [[her]43-mrs. sherwin husband]480-her husband watched the process with critical eyes . [The poor woman]1098-the poor woman 's weak white fingers trembled as [they]1099-they moved the knife under conjugal inspection .

" Most happy to see [you]0-i again - most happy indeed , [[my]42-mr. sherwin dear Sir]3140-my dear sir , "[42-mr. sherwin] said [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin , advancing with hospitable smile and outstretched hand . " Allow [me]42-mr. sherwin to introduce [[my]42-mr. sherwin better half]3228-my better half , [Mrs. S.]53-mrs. s. "[42-mr. sherwin]

[[His]42-mr. sherwin wife]997-his wife rose in a hurry , and curtseyed , leaving the knife sticking in the cake ; upon which [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin , with a stern look at [her]997-his wife , ostentatiously pulled it out , and set it down rather violently on the dish .

[Poor Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin ! [I]0-i had hardly noticed [her]43-mrs. sherwin on the day when [she]43-mrs. sherwin got into the omnibus with [[her]43-mrs. sherwin daughter]1101-her daughter - it was as if [I]0-i now saw [her]43-mrs. sherwin for the first time . There is a natural communicativeness about [women]326-women 's emotions . [A happy woman]1103-a happy woman imperceptibly diffuses [her]1103-a happy woman happiness around [her]1103-a happy woman ; [she]1103-a happy woman has an influence that is something akin to the influence of a sunshiny day . So , again , the melancholy of [a melancholy woman]1104-a melancholy woman is invariably , though silently , infectious ; and [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin was one of this latter order . [Her]43-mrs. sherwin pale , sickly , moist - looking skin ; [her]43-mrs. sherwin large , mild , watery , light - blue eyes ; the restless timidity of [her]43-mrs. sherwin expression ; the mixture of useless hesitation and involuntary rapidity in every one of [her]43-mrs. sherwin actions - all furnished the same significant betrayal of a life of incessant fear and restraint ; of a disposition full of modest generosities and meek sympathies , which had been crushed down past rousing to self - assertion , past ever seeing the light . There , in that mild , wan face of [hers]43-mrs. sherwin - in those painful startings and hurryings when [she]43-mrs. sherwin moved ; in that tremulous , faint utterance when [she]43-mrs. sherwin spoke - there , [I]0-i could see one of those ghastly heart - tragedies laid open before [me]0-i , which are acted and re - acted , scene by scene , and year by year , in [the secret theatre of [home]176-home]1105-the secret theatre of home ; tragedies which are ever shadowed by the slow falling of the black curtain that drops lower and lower every day - that drops , to hide all at last , from the hand of death .

" [We]3229-we have had very beautiful weather lately , [Sir]3046-sir , "[43-mrs. sherwin] said [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin , almost inaudibly ; looking as [she]43-mrs. sherwin spoke , with anxious eyes towards [[her]43-mrs. sherwin husband]480-her husband , to see if [she]43-mrs. sherwin was justified in uttering even those piteously common - place words . " Very beautiful weather to be sure , "[1098-the poor woman] continued [the poor woman]1098-the poor woman , as timidly as if [she]1098-the poor woman had become [a little child]1109-a little child again , and had been ordered to say [her]1098-the poor woman first lesson in [a stranger]842-a stranger 's presence .

" Delightful weather , [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin . "[43-mrs. sherwin]

There was a pause . [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin coughed ; it was evidently a warning matrimonial peal that [he]42-mr. sherwin had often rung before - for [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin started , and looked up at [him]42-mr. sherwin directly .

"[43-mrs. sherwin]

Though [I]0-i wanted nothing , [I]0-i ate and drank something immediately , in common consideration for [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin 's embarrassment .

"[480-her husband]

[Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin prepared , without a word of remonstrance , to leave [the room]263-the room . [I]0-i sincerely felt for [her]43-mrs. sherwin ; but could say nothing . [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin helped [himself]42-mr. sherwin to a second glass of wine , without taking the smallest notice of this .

" [I]0-i hope [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin has not hurt [herself]43-mrs. sherwin ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said . "[0-i]

" Quite fair , [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin . "[0-i]

" Just so . Now , in the first place , [[my]42-mr. sherwin daughter]3132-my daughter is too young to be married yet . [She]3132-my daughter was only seventeen last birthday . "[42-mr. sherwin]

" [You]42-mr. sherwin astonish [me]0-i ! [I]0-i should have imagined [her]3132-my daughter three years older at least . "[0-i]

" [Everybody]361-everybody thinks [her]3132-my daughter older than [she]3132-my daughter is - [everybody]361-everybody , [[my]42-mr. sherwin dear Sir]3140-my dear sir - and [she]3132-my daughter certainly looks it . Well : the upshot of this is , that [I]42-mr. sherwin could not give [my]42-mr. sherwin consent to [Margaret]44-margaret 's marrying , until another year is out - say a year from this time . "[42-mr. sherwin]

A year to wait ! At first , this seemed a long trial to endure , a trial that ought not to be imposed on [me]0-i . But the next moment , the delay appeared in a different light . Would it not be the dearest of privileges to be able to see [Margaret]44-margaret , perhaps every day , perhaps for hours at a time ? Would it not be happiness enough to observe each development of [her]44-margaret character , to watch [her]44-margaret first maiden love for [me]0-i , advancing nearer and nearer towards confidence and maturity the oftener [we]1117-we met ? As [I]0-i thought on this , [I]0-i answered [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin without further hesitation .

" It will be some trial , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " to [my]0-i patience , though none to [my]0-i constancy , none to the strength of [my]0-i affection - [I]0-i will wait the year . "[0-i]

" Well , to be still plainer , this is how the matter stands : If [you]0-i were [a party in [our]3263-our rank of life]3262-a party in our rank of life , coming to court [Margaret]44-margaret with [[your]0-i father]302-your father 's full approval and permission when once [you]0-i had consented to the year 's engagement , everything would be done and settled ; the bargain would have been struck on both sides ; and there would be an end of it . " But the case could not happen - [I]1119-i am astonished [you]0-i can imagine it possible . [I]1119-i have told [you]0-i already , [I]1119-i am of age . "[1119-i]

" Properly urged - very properly , indeed . "[1119-i]

" Gently , [[my]1119-i dear Sir]3140-my dear sir ! gently , gently , gently ! [I]0-i was too astounded , too overwhelmed , to say anything at that moment ; [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin went on :

" This plan of [mine]42-mr. sherwin , [you]42-mr. sherwin see , reconciles everything . If any accident does happen , and [we]3288-we are discovered , why [[your]42-mr. sherwin father]302-your father can do nothing to stop the match , because the match will have been already made . And , at the same time , [I]1121-i secure a year 's delay , for the formation of [her]3132-my daughter constitution , and the finishing of [her]3132-my daughter accomplishments , and so forth . Besides , what an opportunity this gives of sailing as near the wind as [you]42-mr. sherwin choose , in breaking the thing , bit by bit , to [[your]42-mr. sherwin father]302-your father , without fear of consequences , in case [he]302-your father should run rough after all . Upon [my]1121-i honour , [[my]1121-i dear [Sir]3046-sir]3140-my dear sir , [I]1121-i think [I]1121-i deserve some credit for hitting on this plan - it makes everything so right and straight , and suits of course the wishes of [all parties]3293-all parties ! [I]1121-i need hardly say that [you]42-mr. sherwin shall have every facility for seeing [Margaret]44-margaret , under the restrictions - under the restrictions , [you]42-mr. sherwin understand . [People]106-people may talk about [your]42-mr. sherwin visits ; but having got the certificate , and knowing it 's all safe and settled , [I]1121-i sha n't care for that . Well , what do [you]42-mr. sherwin say ? take time to think , if [you]42-mr. sherwin wish it - only remember that [I]1121-i have the most perfect confidence in [your]42-mr. sherwin honour , and that [I]1121-i act from a fatherly feeling for the interests of [[my]1121-i dear girl]3166-my dear girl ! "[1121-i] [He]1121-i stopped , out of breath from the extraordinary volubility of [his]1121-i long harangue .

[Some men more experienced in the world , less mastered by love]1122-some men more experienced in the world , less mastered by love than [I]0-i was , would , in [my]0-i position , have recognised this proposal an unfair trial of self - restraint - perhaps , something like an unfair humiliation as well . Others have detected the selfish motives which suggested it : the mean distrust of [my]0-i honour , integrity , and firmness of purpose which it implied ; and the equally mean anxiety on [Sherwin]44-margaret 's part to clench [his]1121-i profitable bargain at once , for fear it might be repented of . [I]0-i discerned nothing of this . As soon as [I]0-i had recovered from the natural astonishment of the first few moments , [I]0-i only saw in the strange plan proposed to [me]0-i , a certainty of assuring - no matter with what sacrifice , what hazard , or what delay - the ultimate triumph of [my]0-i love . When [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin had ceased speaking , [I]0-i replied at once :

" [I]0-i accept [your]1121-i conditions - [I]0-i accept them with all [my]0-i heart . "[0-i]

[He]1121-i was hardly prepared for so complete and so sudden an acquiescence in [his]1121-i proposal , and looked absolutely startled by it , at first . But soon resuming [his]1121-i self - possession - [his]1121-i wily , " business - like "[1121-i] self - possession - [he]1121-i started up , and shook [me]0-i vehemently by the hand .

" Delighted - most delighted , [[my]1121-i dear [Sir]3046-sir]3140-my dear sir , to find how soon [we]3298-we understand [each other]102-each other , and that [we]3298-we pull together so well . [We]3298-we must have another glass ; hang it , [we]3298-we really must ! a toast , [you]3046-sir know ; a toast [you]3046-sir ca n't help drinking - [[your]3046-sir wife]3287-your wife ! Ha ! ha ! - [I]1121-i had [you]3046-sir there ! - [[my]1121-i dear]3163-my dear , dear [Margaret]44-margaret , God bless [her]44-margaret ! "[1121-i]

" [We]3298-we may consider all difficulties finally settled then , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , anxious to close [my]0-i interview with [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin as speedily as possible .

" Decidedly so . Done , and double done , [I]1121-i may say . There will be a little insurance on [your]3046-sir life , that [I]1121-i shall ask [you]3046-sir to effect for dear [Margaret]44-margaret 's sake ; and perhaps , a memorandum of agreement , engaging to settle a certain proportion of any property [you]3046-sir may become possessed of , on [her]44-margaret and [[her]44-margaret children]3302-her children . [You]3046-sir see [I]1121-i am looking forward to [my]1121-i grandfather days already ! But this can wait for a future occasion - say in a day or two . "[1121-i]

" Then [I]1121-i presume there will be no objection to [my]1121-i seeing [Miss Sherwin]44-margaret now ? "[1121-i]

" None whatever - -at once , if [you]3046-sir like . This way , [[my]42-mr. sherwin dear [Sir]3046-sir]3140-my dear sir ; this way , "[42-mr. sherwin] and [he]42-mr. sherwin led [me]0-i across [the passage]1048-the passage , into [the dining - room]165-the dining - room .

[This apartment]1125-this apartment was furnished with less luxury , but with more bad taste if possible than [the room [we]1127-us had just left]1126-the room we had just left . Near the window sat [Margaret]44-margaret - it was the same window at which [I]0-i had seen [her]44-margaret , on the evening when [I]0-i wandered into [the square]717-the square , after [our]1127-us meeting in [the omnibus]648-the omnibus . The cage with the canary - bird hung in the same place . [I]0-i just noticed - with a momentary surprise - that [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin was sitting far away from [[her]43-mrs. sherwin daughter]1101-her daughter , at the other end of [the room]263-the room ; and then placed [myself]0-i by [Margaret]44-margaret 's side . [She]44-margaret was dressed in pale yellow - a colour which gave new splendour to [her]44-margaret dark complexion and magnificently dark hair . Once more , all [my]0-i doubts , all [my]0-i self - upbraidings vanished , and gave place to the exquisite sense of happiness , the glow of joy and hope and love which seemed to rush over [my]0-i heart , the moment [I]0-i looked at [her]44-margaret .

After staying in [the room]263-the room about five minutes , [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin whispered to [[his]42-mr. sherwin wife]997-his wife , and left [us]1127-us . [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin still kept [her]43-mrs. sherwin place ; but [she]43-mrs. sherwin said nothing , and hardly turned to look round at [us]1127-us more than once or twice . Perhaps [she]43-mrs. sherwin was occupied by [her]43-mrs. sherwin own thoughts ; perhaps , from a motive of delicacy , [she]43-mrs. sherwin abstained even from an appearance of watching [[her]43-mrs. sherwin daughter]1101-her daughter or watching [me]0-i . Whatever feelings influenced [her]43-mrs. sherwin , [I]0-i cared not to speculate on them . It was enough that [I]0-i had the privilege of speaking to [Margaret]44-margaret uninterruptedly ; of declaring [my]0-i love at last , without hesitation and without reserve .

How much [I]0-i had to say to [her]44-margaret , and how short a time seemed to be left [me]0-i that evening to say it in ! How short a time to tell [her]44-margaret all the thoughts of the past which [she]44-margaret had created in [me]0-i ; all the self - sacrifice to which [I]0-i had cheerfully consented for [her]44-margaret sake ; all the anticipations of future happiness which were concentrated in [her]44-margaret , which drew [their]1135-their very breath of life , only from the prospect of [her]44-margaret rewarding love ! [She]44-margaret spoke but little ; yet even that little it was a new delight to hear . [She]44-margaret smiled now ; [she]44-margaret let [me]0-i take [her]44-margaret hand , and made no attempt to withdraw it . The evening had closed in ; the darkness was stealing fast upon [us]1136-we ; the still , dead - still figure of [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin , always in the same place and the same attitude , grew fainter and fainter to the eye , across the distance of [the room]263-the room - but no thought of time , no thought of [home]176-home ever once crossed [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i could have sat at the window with [Margaret]44-margaret the long night through ; without an idea of numbering the hours as [they]1139-they passed .

Ere long , however , [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin entered [the room]263-the room again , and effectually roused [me]0-i by approaching and speaking to [us]1136-we . [I]0-i saw that [I]0-i had stayed long enough , and that [we]1136-we were not to be left together again , that night . So [I]0-i rose and took [my]0-i leave , having first fixed a time for seeing [Margaret]44-margaret on the morrow . [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin accompanied [me]0-i with great ceremony to the outer door . Just as [I]0-i was leaving [him]42-mr. sherwin , [he]42-mr. sherwin touched [me]0-i on the arm , and said in [his]42-mr. sherwin most confidential tones :

" Come an hour earlier , to - morrow ; and [we]1136-we 'll go and get the licence together . No objection to that - eh ? And the marriage , shall [we]1136-we say this day week ? Just as [you]0-i like , [you]0-i know - do n't let [me]42-mr. sherwin seem to dictate . Ah ! no objection to that , either , [I]42-mr. sherwin see , and no objection on [Margaret]44-margaret 's side , [I]42-mr. sherwin 'll warrant ! With respect to consents , in the marrying part of the business , there 's complete mutuality - is n't there ? Good night : God bless [you]0-i ! "[42-mr. sherwin]

[XII]56-xii .

That night [I]0-i went [home]176-home with none of the reluctance or the apprehension which [I]0-i had felt on the last occasion , when [I]0-i approached [our]1142-our own door . The assurance of success contained in the events of the afternoon , gave [me]0-i a trust in [my]0-i own self - possession - a confidence in [my]0-i own capacity to parry all dangerous questions - which [I]0-i had not experienced before . [I]0-i cared not how soon , or for how long a time , [I]0-i might find [myself]0-i in company with [Clara]57-clara or [[my]0-i father]147-my father . It was well for the preservation of [my]0-i secret that [I]0-i was in this frame of mind ; for , on opening [my]0-i study door , [I]0-i was astonished to see both of [them]1144-them in [[my]0-i room]136-my room .

[Clara]57-clara was measuring one of [my]0-i over - crowded book - shelves , with a piece of string ; and was apparently just about to compare the length of it with a vacant space on the wall close by , when [I]0-i came in . Seeing [me]0-i , [she]57-clara stopped ; and looked round significantly at [[my]0-i father]147-my father , who was standing near [her]57-clara , with a file of papers in [his]147-my father hand .

" [You]0-i may well feel surprised , [Basil]46-basil , at this invasion of [[your]0-i territory]3305-your territory , "[147-my father] [he]147-my father said , with peculiar kindness of manner - " [you]0-i must , however , apply there , to [the prime minister of [the household]3307-the household]3306-the prime minister of the household , "[147-my father] pointing to [Clara]57-clara , " for an explanation . [I]147-my father am only the instrument of a domestic conspiracy on [[your]0-i sister]3308-your sister 's part . "[147-my father]

[Clara]57-clara seemed doubtful whether [she]57-clara should speak . It was the first time [I]0-i had ever seen such an expression in [her]57-clara face , when [she]57-clara looked into [mine]0-i .

" [We]3309-we are discovered , [papa]3052-papa , "[57-clara] [she]57-clara said , after a momentary silence , " and [we]3309-we must explain : but [you]3052-papa know [I]57-clara always leave as many explanations as [I]57-clara can to [you]3052-papa . "[57-clara]

" Very well , "[147-my father] said [[my]0-i father]147-my father smiling ; " [my]147-my father task in this instance will be an easy one . [I]147-my father was intercepted , [Basil]46-basil , on [my]147-my father way to [[my]147-my father own room]3311-my own room by [[your]3052-papa sister]3308-your sister , and taken in [here]3265-here to advise about a new set of bookcases for [you]3052-papa , when [I]147-my father ought to have been attending to [my]147-my father own money matters . [Clara]57-clara 's idea was to have had these new bookcases made in secret , and put up as a surprise , some day when [you]3052-papa were not at [home]176-home . However , as [you]3052-papa have caught [her]57-clara in the act of measuring spaces , with all the skill of [an experienced carpenter]3315-an experienced carpenter , and all the impetuosity of [an arbitrary young lady who rules supreme over [everybody]361-everybody]3316-an arbitrary young lady who rules supreme over everybody , further concealment is out of the question . [We]3318-we must make a virtue of necessity , and confess everything . "[147-my father]

[Poor Clara]57-clara ! This was [her]57-clara only return for ten days ' utter neglect - and [she]57-clara had been half afraid to tell [me]0-i of it [herself]57-clara . [I]0-i approached and thanked [her]57-clara ; not very gratefully , [I]0-i am afraid , for [I]0-i felt too confused to speak freely . It seemed like a fatality . The more evil [I]0-i was doing in secret , evil to family ties and family principles , the more good was unconsciously returned to [me]0-i by [[my]0-i family]197-my family , through [[my]0-i sister]296-my sister 's hands .

" [I]147-my father made no objection , of course , to the bookcase plan , "[147-my father] continued [[my]0-i father]147-my father . " More room is really wanted for the volumes on volumes that [you]0-i have collected about [you]0-i ; but [I]147-my father certainly suggested a little delay in the execution of the project . The bookcases will , at all events , not be required here for five months to come . This day week [we]1151-we return to [the country]370-the country . "[147-my father]

[I]0-i could not repress a start of astonishment and dismay . Here was a difficulty which [I]0-i ought to have provided for ; but which [I]0-i had most unaccountably never once thought of , although it was now the period of the year at which on all former occasions [we]1151-we had been accustomed to leave [London]10-london . This day week too ! The very day fixed by [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin for [my]0-i marriage !

" [I]0-i am afraid , [Sir]3046-sir , [I]0-i shall not be able to go with [you]3046-sir and [Clara]57-clara so soon as [you]3046-sir propose . It was [my]0-i wish to remain in [London]10-london some time longer . "[0-i] [I]0-i said this in a low voice , without venturing to look at [[my]0-i sister]296-my sister . But [I]0-i could not help hearing [her]296-my sister exclamation as [I]0-i spoke , and the tone in which [she]296-my sister uttered it .

[[My]0-i father]147-my father moved nearer to [me]0-i a step or two , and looked in [my]0-i face intently , with the firm , penetrating expression which peculiarly characterized [him]147-my father .

" This seems an extraordinary resolution , "[147-my father] [he]147-my father said , [his]147-my father tones and manner altering ominously while [he]147-my father spoke . " [I]147-my father thought [your]0-i sudden absence for the last two days rather odd ; but this plan of remaining in [London]10-london by [yourself]0-i is really incomprehensible . What can [you]0-i have to do ? "[147-my father]

An excuse - no ! not an excuse ; let [me]0-i call things by [their]1154-their right names in these pages - a lie was rising to [my]0-i lips ; but [[my]0-i father]147-my father checked the utterance of it . [He]147-my father detected [my]0-i embarrassment immediately , anxiously as [I]0-i strove to conceal it .

" Stop , "[147-my father] [he]147-my father said coldly , while the red flush which meant so much when it rose on [his]147-my father cheek , began to appear there for the first time . " Stop ! If [you]0-i must make excuses , [Basil]46-basil , [I]147-my father must ask no questions . [You]0-i have a secret which [you]0-i wish to keep from [me]147-my father ; and [I]147-my father beg [you]0-i will keep it . [I]147-my father have never been accustomed to treat [[my]147-my father sons]3321-my sons as [I]147-my father would not treat [any other gentlemen with whom [I]147-my father may happen to be associated]3322-any other gentlemen with whom i may happen to be associated . If [they]3321-my sons have private affairs , [I]147-my father can not interfere with those affairs .
