" [I]147-my father do not suspect - [I]147-my father feel but too sure , that [you]46-basil , [[my]147-my father second son]3636-my second son , from whom [I]147-my father had expected far better things , have imitated in secret - [I]147-my father am afraid , outstripped - the worst vices of [[your]46-basil elder brother]3637-your elder brother . "[147-my father]

" [[My]2059-i brother]154-my brother ! - [[my]2059-i brother]154-my brother 's faults [mine]2059-i ! [Ralph]39-ralph ! "[2059-i]

" Yes , [Ralph]39-ralph . It is [my]147-my father last hope that [you]39-ralph will now imitate [Ralph]39-ralph 's candour . Take example from that best part of [him]2059-i , as [you]39-ralph have already taken example from the worst . "[147-my father]

[My]0-i heart grew faint and cold as [he]2059-i spoke . [Ralph]39-ralph 's example ! [Ralph]39-ralph 's vices ! - vices of the reckless hour , or the idle day ! - vices whose stain , in [the world]158-the world 's eye , was not a stain for life ! - convenient , reclaimable vices , that [men]518-men were mercifully unwilling to associate with grinning infamy and irreparable disgrace ! How far - how fearfully far , [[my]0-i father]147-my father was from the remotest suspicion of what had really happened ! [I]0-i tried to answer [his]2059-i last words , but the apprehension of the life - long humiliation and grief which [my]0-i confession might inflict on [him]2059-i - absolutely incapable , as [he]2059-i appeared to be , of foreboding even the least degrading part of it - kept [me]0-i speechless . When [he]2059-i resumed , after a momentary silence , [his]2059-i tones were stern , [his]2059-i looks searching - pitilessly searching , and bent full upon [my]0-i face .

" [A person]1427-a person has been calling , named [Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin , "[2059-i] [he]2059-i said , " and inquiring about [you]0-i every day . What intimate connection between [you]0-i authorises [this perfect stranger to [me]2059-i]3641-this perfect stranger to me to come to [the house]244-the house as frequently as [he]2059-i does , and to make [his]2059-i inquiries with a familiarity of tone and manner which has struck [every one of [the servants who have , on different occasions]3644-the servants who have , on different occasions , opened the door to [him]2059-i]3643-every one of the servants who have , on different occasions , opened the door to him ? Who is this [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin ? "[2059-i]

" It is not with [him]2059-i , [Sir]3046-sir , that [I]2059-i can well begin . [I]2059-i must go back - "[2059-i]

" [You]0-i must go back farther , [I]2059-i am afraid , than [you]0-i will be able to return . [You]0-i must go back to the time when [you]0-i had nothing to conceal from [me]2059-i , and when [you]0-i could speak to [me]2059-i with the frankness and directness of [a gentleman]3111-a gentleman . "[2059-i]

" Pray be patient with [me]2059-i , [Sir]3046-sir ; give [me]2059-i a few minutes to collect [myself]2059-i . [I]2059-i have much need for a little self - possession before [I]2059-i tell [you]0-i all . "[2059-i]

" All ? [your]0-i tones mean more than [your]0-i words - they are candid , at least ! Have [I]2059-i feared the worst , and yet not feared as [I]2059-i ought ? [Basil]46-basil ! - do [you]46-basil hear [me]2059-i , [Basil]46-basil ? [You]46-basil are trembling very strangely ; [you]46-basil are growing pale ! "[2059-i]

" [I]2063-i shall be better directly , [Sir]3046-sir . [I]2063-i am afraid [I]2063-i am not quite so strong yet as [I]2063-i thought [myself]2063-i . [Father]71-father ! [I]2063-i am heart - broken and spirit - broken : be patient and kind to [me]2063-i , or [I]2063-i can not speak to [you]2063-i . "[2063-i]

[I]0-i thought [I]0-i saw [his]2063-i eyes moisten . [He]2063-i shaded them a moment with [his]2063-i hand , and sighed again - the same long , trembling sigh that [I]0-i had heard before . [I]0-i tried to rise from [my]0-i chair , and throw [myself]0-i on [my]0-i knees at [his]2063-i feet . [He]2063-i mistook the action , and caught [me]0-i by the arm , believing that [I]0-i was fainting .

" No more to - night , [Basil]46-basil , "[2063-i] [he]2063-i said , hurriedly , but very gently ; " no more on this subject till to - morrow . "[2063-i]

" [I]2063-i can speak now , [Sir]3046-sir ; it is better to speak at once . "[2063-i]

" No : [you]46-basil are too much agitated ; [you]46-basil are weaker than [I]2063-i thought . To - morrow , in the morning , when [you]46-basil are stronger after a night 's rest . No ! [I]2063-i will hear nothing more . Go to bed now ; [I]2063-i will tell [[your]46-basil sister]3308-your sister not to disturb [you]46-basil to - night . To - morrow , [you]46-basil shall speak to [me]2063-i ; and speak in [your]46-basil own way , without interruption . Good - night , [Basil]46-basil , good - night . "[2063-i]

Without waiting to shake hands with [me]0-i , [he]2063-i hastened to the door , as if anxious to hide from [my]0-i observation the grief and apprehension which had evidently overcome [him]2063-i . But , just at the moment when [he]2063-i was leaving [the room]263-the room , [he]2063-i hesitated , turned round , looked sorrowfully at [me]0-i for an instant , and then , retracing [his]2063-i steps , gave [me]0-i [his]2063-i hand , pressed [mine]0-i for a moment in silence , and left [me]0-i .

After the morrow was over , would [he]2063-i ever give [me]0-i that hand again ?

III .

The morning which was to decide all between [[my]0-i father]147-my father and [me]0-i , the morning on whose event hung the future of [my]0-i home life , was the brightest and loveliest that [my]0-i eyes ever looked on . A cloudless sky , a soft air , sunshine so joyous and dazzling that the commonest objects looked beautiful in its light , seemed to be mocking at [me]0-i for [my]0-i heavy heart , as [I]0-i stood at [my]0-i window , and thought of the hard duty to be fulfilled , on the harder judgment that might be pronounced , before the dawning of another day .

During the night , [I]0-i had arranged no plan on which to conduct the terrible disclosure which [I]0-i was now bound to make - the greatness of the emergency deprived [me]0-i of all power of preparing [myself]0-i for it . [I]0-i thought on [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's character , on the inbred principles of honour which ruled [him]147-my father with the stern influence of a fanaticism : [I]0-i thought on [his]147-my father pride of caste , so unobtrusive , so rarely hinted at in words , and yet so firmly rooted in [his]147-my father nature , so intricately entwined with every one of [his]147-my father emotions , [his]147-my father aspirations , [his]147-my father simplest feelings and ideas : [I]0-i thought on [his]147-my father almost feminine delicacy in shrinking from the barest mention of impurities which [other men]3437-other men could carelessly discuss , or could laugh over as good material for an after - dinner jest . [I]0-i thought over all this , and when [I]0-i remembered that it was to such [a man]3101-a man that [I]0-i must confess the infamous marriage which [I]0-i had contracted in secret , all hope from [his]147-my father fatherly affection deserted [me]0-i ; all idea of appealing to [his]147-my father chivalrous generosity became a delusion in which it was madness to put a moment 's trust .

The faculties of observation are generally sharpened , in proportion as the faculties of reflection are dulled , under the influence of an absorbing suspense . While [I]0-i now waited alone in [[my]0-i room]136-my room , the most ordinary sounds and events in [the house]244-the house , which [I]0-i never remembered noticing before , absolutely enthralled [me]0-i . It seemed as if the noise of a footstep , the echo of a voice , the shutting or opening of doors down [stairs]1197-stairs , must , on this momentous day , presage some mysterious calamity , some strange discovery , some secret project formed against [me]0-i , [I]0-i knew not how , or by whom . Two or three times [I]0-i found [myself]0-i listening intently on the staircase , with what object [I]0-i could hardly tell . It was always , however , on those occasions , that a dread , significant quiet appeared to have fallen suddenly on [the house]244-the house . [Clara]57-clara never came to [me]0-i , no message arrived from [[my]0-i father]147-my father ; the door - bell seemed strangely silent , [the servants]745-the servants strangely neglectful of [their]745-the servants duties above stairs . [I]0-i caught [myself]0-i returning to [[my]0-i own room]3311-my own room softly , as if [I]0-i expected that some hidden catastrophe might break forth , if sound of [my]0-i footsteps were heard .

Would [[my]0-i father]147-my father seek [me]0-i again in [[my]0-i own room]3311-my own room , or would [he]147-my father send for [me]0-i down [stairs]1197-stairs ? It was not long before the doubt was decided . [One of [the servants]745-the servants]1162-one of the servants knocked at [my]0-i door - [the servant whose special duty it had been to wait on [me]0-i in [my]0-i illness]2081-the servant whose special duty it had been to wait on me in my illness . [I]0-i longed to take [the man]696-the man 's hand , and implore [his]696-the man sympathy and encouragement while [he]696-the man addressed [me]0-i .

" [[My]315-the servant master]3047-my master , [Sir]3046-sir , desires [me]315-the servant to say that , if [you]0-i feel well enough , [he]3047-my master wishes to see [you]0-i in [[his]3047-my master own room]3653-his own room . "[315-the servant]

[I]0-i rose , and immediately followed [the servant]315-the servant . On [our]2084-our way , [we]2084-our passed the door of [[Clara]57-clara 's private sitting - room]2085-clara 's private sitting - room - it opened , and [[my]0-i sister]296-my sister came out and laid [her]296-my sister hand on [my]0-i arm . [She]57-clara smiled as [I]0-i looked at [her]57-clara ; but the tears stood thick in [her]57-clara eyes , and [her]57-clara face was deadly pale .

" Think of what [I]57-clara said last night , [Basil]46-basil , "[57-clara] [she]57-clara whispered , " and , if hard words are spoken to [you]46-basil , think of [me]57-clara . All that [[our]3654-our mother]3655-our mother would have done for [you]46-basil , if [she]3655-our mother had been still among [us]3654-our , [I]57-clara will do . Remember that , and keep heart and hope to the very last . "[57-clara]

[She]57-clara hastily returned to [[her]57-clara room]1432-her room , and [I]0-i went on down [stairs]1197-stairs . In [the hall]1423-the hall , [the servant]315-the servant was waiting for [me]0-i , with a letter in [his]315-the servant hand .

" This was left for [you]46-basil , [Sir]3046-sir , a little while ago . [The messenger who brought it]3657-the messenger who brought it said [he]3657-the messenger who brought it was not to wait for an answer . "[315-the servant]

It was no time for reading letters - the interview with [[my]0-i father]147-my father was too close at hand . [I]0-i hastily put the letter into [my]0-i pocket , barely noticing , as [I]0-i did so , that the handwriting on the address was very irregular , and quite unknown to [me]0-i .

[I]0-i went at once into [[[my]0-i father]147-my father 's room]2093-my father 's room .

[He]147-my father was sitting at [his]147-my father table , cutting the leaves of some new books that lay on it . Pointing to a chair placed opposite to [him]147-my father , [he]147-my father briefly inquired after [my]0-i health ; and then added , in a lower tone -

" Take any time [you]0-i like , [Basil]46-basil , to compose and collect [yourself]0-i . This morning [my]147-my father time is [yours]0-i . "[147-my father]

[He]147-my father turned a little away from [me]0-i , and went on cutting the leaves of the books placed before [him]147-my father . Still utterly incapable of preparing [myself]0-i in any way for the disclosure expected from [me]0-i ; without thought or hope , or feeling of any kind , except a vague sense of thankfulness for the reprieve granted [me]0-i before [I]0-i was called on to speak - [I]0-i mechanically looked round and round [the room]263-the room , as if [I]0-i expected to see the sentence to be pronounced against [me]0-i , already written on the walls , or grimly foreshadowed in the faces of the old family portraits which hung above the fireplace .

What [man]191-man has ever felt that all [his]191-man thinking powers were absorbed , even by the most poignant mental misery that could occupy them ? In moments of imminent danger , the mind can still travel of its own accord over the past , in spite of the present - in moments of bitter affliction , it can still recur to every - day trifles , in spite of [ourselves]2096-we . While [I]0-i now sat silent in [[[my]0-i father]147-my father 's room]2093-my father 's room , long - forgotten associations of childhood connected with different parts of it , began to rise on [my]0-i memory in the strangest and most startling independence of any influence or control , which [my]0-i present agitation and suspense might be supposed to exercise over [them]2099-them . The remembrances that should have been the last to be awakened at this time of heavy trial , were the very remembrances which now moved within [me]0-i .

With burdened heart and aching eyes [I]0-i looked over the walls around [me]0-i . There , in that corner , was the red cloth door which led to [the library]1061-the library . As [children]139-children , how often [Ralph]39-ralph and [I]0-i had peeped curiously through that very door , to see what [[my]0-i father]147-my father was about in [[his]147-my father study]592-his study , to wonder why [he]147-my father had so many letters to write , and so many books to read . How frightened [we]2096-we both were , when [he]147-my father discovered [us]2096-we one day , and reproved [us]2096-we severely ! How happy the moment afterwards , when [we]2096-we had begged [him]147-my father to pardon [us]2096-we , and were sent back to [the library]1061-the library again with a great picture - book to look at , as a token that [we]2096-we were both forgiven ! Then , again , there was the high , old - fashioned , mahogany press before the window , with the same large illustrated folio about Jewish antiquities lying on it , which , years and years ago , [Clara]57-clara and [I]0-i were sometimes allowed to look at , as a special treat , on Sunday afternoons ; and which [we]2096-we always examined and re - examined with never - ending delight - standing together on two chairs to reach up to the thick , yellow - looking leaves , and turn them over with [our]2096-we own hands . And there , in the recess between two bookcases , still stood the ancient desk - table , with [its]2105-its rows of little inlaid drawers ; and on the bracket above [it]2105-its the old French clock , which had once belonged to [[my]0-i mother]148-my mother , and which always chimed the hours so sweetly and merrily . It was at that table that [Ralph]39-ralph and [I]0-i always bade [[my]0-i father]147-my father farewell , when [we]2096-we were going back to [school]344-school after the holidays , and were receiving [our]2096-we allowance of pocket - money , given to [us]2096-we out of one of the tiny inlaid drawers , just before [we]2096-we started . Near that spot , too , [Clara]57-clara - then [a little rosy child]2109-a little rosy child - used to wait gravely and anxiously , with [[her]57-clara doll]2110-her doll in [her]57-clara arms , to say good - bye for the last time , and to bid [us]2096-we come back soon , and then never go away again . [I]0-i turned , and looked abruptly towards the window ; for such memories as [the room]263-the room suggested were more than [I]0-i could bear .

Outside , in [the dreary strip of garden]2112-the dreary strip of garden , the few stunted , dusky trees were now rustling as pleasantly in the air , as if the breeze that stirred them came serenely over [an open meadow]2113-an open meadow , or swept freshly under their branches from the rippling surface of [a brook]2114-a brook . Distant , but yet well within hearing , the mighty murmur from [a large thoroughfare]2115-a large thoroughfare - the great mid - day voice of [London]10-london - swelled grandly and joyously on the ear . While , nearer still , in [a street]2116-a street that ran past the side of [the house]244-the house , the notes of an organ rang out shrill and fast ; the instrument was playing its liveliest waltz tune - a tune which [I]0-i had danced to in [the ball - room]2118-the ball - room over and over again . What mocking memories within , what mocking sounds without , to herald and accompany such a confession as [I]0-i had now to make !

Minute after minute glided on , inexorably fast ; and yet [I]0-i never broke silence . [My]0-i eyes turned anxiously and slowly on [[my]0-i father]147-my father .

[He]147-my father was still looking away from [me]0-i , still cutting the leaves of the books before [him]147-my father . Even in that trifling action , the strong emotions which [he]147-my father was trying to conceal , were plainly and terribly betrayed . [His]147-my father hand , usually so steady and careful , trembled perceptibly ; and the paper - knife tore through the leaves faster and faster - cutting them awry , rending them one from another , so as to spoil the appearance of every page . [I]0-i believe [he]147-my father felt that [I]0-i was looking at [him]147-my father ; for [he]147-my father suddenly discontinued [his]147-my father employment , turned round towards [me]0-i , and spoke -

" [I]147-my father have resolved to give [you]0-i [your]0-i own time , "[147-my father] [he]147-my father said , " and from that resolve [I]147-my father have no wish to depart - [I]147-my father only ask [you]0-i to remember that every minute of delay adds to the suffering and suspense which [I]147-my father am enduring on [your]0-i account . "[147-my father] [He]147-my father opened the books before [him]147-my father again , adding in lower and colder tones , as [he]147-my father did so - " In [your]0-i place , [Ralph]39-ralph would have spoken before this . "[147-my father]

[Ralph]39-ralph , and [Ralph]39-ralph 's example quoted to [me]0-i again ! - [I]0-i could remain silent no longer .

" [[My]0-i brother]154-my brother 's faults towards [you]147-my father , and towards [[his]154-my brother family]218-his family , are not such faults as [mine]0-i , [Sir]3046-sir , "[0-i] [I]0-i began . " [I]0-i have not imitated [his]154-my brother vices ; [I]0-i have acted as [he]154-my brother would not have acted . And yet , the result of [my]0-i error will appear far more humiliating , and even disgraceful , in [your]147-my father eyes , than the results of any errors of [Ralph]39-ralph 's . "[0-i]

As [I]0-i pronounced the word " disgraceful , "[0-i] [he]2120-you suddenly looked [me]0-i full in the face . [His]2120-you eyes lightened up sternly , and the warning red spot rose on [his]2120-you pale cheeks .

" What do [you]0-i mean by ' disgraceful ? ' "[2120-you] [he]2120-you asked abruptly ; " what do [you]0-i mean by associating such a word as disgrace with [your]0-i conduct - with the conduct of [a son of mine]3661-a son of mine ? "[2120-you]

" [I]0-i must reply to [your]2120-you question indirectly , [Sir]3046-sir , "[0-i] [I]0-i continued . " [You]2120-you asked [me]0-i last night who [the Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin was who has called [here]3265-here so often - "[0-i]

" And this morning [I]2120-you ask it again . [I]2120-you have other questions to put to [you]2120-you , besides - [you]2120-you called constantly on [a woman]325-a woman 's name in [your]2120-you delirium . But [I]2120-you will repeat last night 's question first - who is [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin ? "[2120-you]

" [He]42-mr. sherwin lives - "[0-i]

" [I]2120-you do n't ask where [he]42-mr. sherwin lives . Who is [he]42-mr. sherwin ? What is [he]42-mr. sherwin ? "[2120-you]

" [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin is [a linen - draper]783-a linen - draper - "[0-i]

" [You]2120-you owe [him]42-mr. sherwin money ? - [you]2120-you have borrowed money of [him]42-mr. sherwin ? Why did [you]2120-you not tell [me]2120-you this before ? [You]2120-you have degraded [[my]2120-you house]3400-my house by letting [a man]3101-a man call at the door - [I]2120-you know it ! - in the character of [a dun]3668-a dun . [He]3101-a man has inquired about [you]2120-you as [[his]3101-a man ' friend]3669-his ' friend , ' - [the servants]745-the servants told [me]2120-you of it . [This money - lending tradesman]3671-this money - lending tradesman , [[your]2120-you ' friend]3672-your ' friend ! ' If [I]2120-you had heard that [the poorest labourer on [[my]2120-you land]3674-my land]3673-the poorest labourer on my land called [you]2120-you ' [friend]1706-friend , ' [I]2120-you should have held [you]2120-you honoured by the attachment and gratitude of [an honest man]3676-an honest man . When [I]2120-you hear that name given to [you]2120-you by [a tradesman]762-a tradesman and [money - lender]3678-money - lender , [I]2120-you hold [you]2120-you contaminated by connection with [a cheat]3679-a cheat . [You]2120-you were right , [Sir]3046-sir ! - this is disgrace ; how much do [you]2120-you owe ? Where are [your]2120-you dishonoured acceptances ? Where have [you]2120-you used [my]2120-you name and [my]2120-you credit ? Tell [me]2120-you at once - [I]2120-you insist on it ! "[2120-you]

[He]2121-he spoke rapidly and contemptuously , and rising from [his]2121-he chair as [he]2121-he ended , walked impatiently up and down [the room]263-the room .

" [I]2121-he owe no money to [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin , [Sir]3046-sir - no money to [any one]1410-any one . "[2121-he]

[He]2121-he stopped suddenly :

" No money to [any one]1410-any one ? "[2121-he] [he]2121-he repeated very slowly , and in very altered tones . " [You]3046-sir spoke of disgrace just now . There is a worse disgrace then that [you]3046-sir have hidden from [me]2121-he , than debts dishonourably contracted ? "[2121-he]

At this moment , a step passed across [the hall]1423-the hall . [He]2121-he instantly turned round , and locked the door on that side of [the room]263-the room - then continued :

" Speak ! and speak honestly if [you]3046-sir can . How have [you]3046-sir been deceiving [me]2121-he ? [A woman]325-a woman 's name escaped [you]3046-sir constantly , when [your]3046-sir delirium was at its worst . [You]3046-sir used some very strange expressions about [her]325-a woman , which it was impossible altogether to comprehend ; but [you]3046-sir said enough to show that [her]325-a woman character was one of the most abandoned ; that [her]325-a woman licentiousness - it is too revolting to speak of [her]325-a woman - [I]2121-he return to [you]3046-sir . [I]2121-he insist on knowing how far [your]3046-sir vices have compromised [you]3046-sir with [that vicious woman]3685-that vicious woman . "[2121-he]

" [She]325-a woman has wronged [me]0-i - cruelly , horribly , wronged [me]0-i - "[0-i] [I]0-i could say no more . [My]0-i head drooped on [my]0-i breast ; [my]0-i shame overpowered [me]0-i .

" Who is [she]325-a woman ? [You]3046-sir called [her]325-a woman [Margaret]44-margaret , in [your]3046-sir illness - who is [she]325-a woman ? "[0-i]

" [She]325-a woman is [[Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin 's daughter]3410-mr. sherwin 's daughter - "[2125-he] The words that [I]0-i would fain have spoken next , seemed to suffocate [me]0-i . [I]0-i was silent again .

[I]0-i heard [him]2125-he mutter to [himself]2125-he :

" [[That man]212-that man 's daughter]3688-that man 's daughter ! - a worse bait than the bait of money ! "[2125-he]

[He]2125-he bent forward , and looked at [me]0-i searchingly . A frightful paleness flew over [his]2125-he face in an instant .

" [Basil]46-basil ! "[2125-he] [he]2125-he cried , " in [God]37-god 's name , answer [me]2125-he at once ! What is [[Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin 's daughter]3410-mr. sherwin 's daughter to [you]0-i ? "[2125-he]

" [She]3410-mr. sherwin 's daughter is [[my]0-i wife]864-my wife ! "[0-i]

[I]0-i heard no answer - not a word , not even a sigh . [My]0-i eyes were blinded with tears , [my]0-i face was bent down ; [I]0-i saw nothing at first . When [I]0-i raised [my]0-i head , and dashed away the blinding tears , and looked up , the blood chilled at [my]0-i heart .

[[My]0-i father]147-my father was leaning against one of the bookcases , with [his]147-my father hands clasped over [his]147-my father breast . [His]147-my father head was drawn back ; [his]147-my father white lips moved , but no sound came from them . Over [his]147-my father upturned face there had passed a ghastly change , as indescribable in its awfulness as the change of death .

[I]0-i ran horror - stricken to [his]147-my father side , and attempted to take [his]147-my father hand . [He]147-my father started instantly into an erect position , and thrust [me]0-i from [him]147-my father furiously , without uttering a word . At that fearful moment , in that fearful silence , the sounds out of doors penetrated with harrowing distinctness and merriment into [the room]263-the room . The pleasant rustling of the trees mingled musically with the softened , monotonous rolling of [carriages]2128-carriages in [the distant street]2129-the distant street , while the organ - tune , now changed to the lively measure of a song , rang out clear and cheerful above both , and poured into [the room]263-the room as lightly and happily as the very sunshine itself .

For a few minutes [we]2131-us stood apart , and neither of [us]2131-us moved or spoke . [I]0-i saw [him]147-my father take out [his]147-my father handkerchief , and pass it over [his]147-my father face , breathing heavily and thickly , and leaning against the bookcase once more . When [he]147-my father withdrew the handkerchief and looked at [me]0-i again , [I]0-i knew that the sharp pang of agony had passed away , that the last hard struggle between [his]147-my father parental affection and [[his]147-my father family]218-his family pride was over , and that the great gulph which was hence - forth to separate [father]477-father and [son]478-son , had now opened between [us]2131-us for ever .

[He]147-my father pointed peremptorily to [me]0-i to go back to [my]0-i former place , but did not return to [his]147-my father own chair . As [I]0-i obeyed , [I]0-i saw [him]147-my father unlock the door of the bookcase against which [he]147-my father had been leaning , and place [his]147-my father hand on one of the books inside . Without withdrawing it from its place , without turning or looking towards [me]0-i , [he]147-my father asked if [I]0-i had anything more to say to [him]147-my father .

The chilling calmness of [his]147-my father tones , the question itself , and the time at which [he]147-my father put it , the unnatural repression of a single word of rebuke , of passion , or of sorrow , after such a confession as [I]0-i had just made , struck [me]0-i speechless . [He]147-my father turned a little away from the bookcase - still keeping [his]147-my father hand on the book inside - and repeated the question . [His]147-my father eyes , when they met [mine]0-i , had a pining , weary look , as if they had been long condemned to rest on woeful and revolting objects ; [his]147-my father expression had lost its natural refinement , its gentleness of repose , and had assumed a hard , lowering calmness , under which [his]147-my father whole countenance appeared to have shrunk and changed - years of old age seemed to have fallen on it , since [I]0-i had spoken the last fatal words !

" Have [you]147-my father anything more to say to [me]0-i ? "[0-i]

On the repetition of that terrible question , [I]0-i sank down in the chair at [my]0-i side , and hid [my]0-i face in [my]0-i hands . Unconscious how [I]0-i spoke , or why [I]0-i spoke ; with no hope in [myself]0-i , or in [him]147-my father ; with no motive but to invite and bear the whole penalty of [my]0-i disgrace , [I]0-i now disclosed the miserable story of [my]0-i marriage , and of all that followed it . [I]0-i remember nothing of the words [I]0-i used - -nothing of what [I]0-i urged in [my]0-i own defence . The sense of bewilderment and oppression grew heavier and heavier on [my]0-i brain ; [I]0-i spoke more and more rapidly , confusedly , unconsciously , until [I]0-i was again silenced and recalled to [myself]0-i by the sound of [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's voice . [I]0-i believe [I]0-i had arrived at the last , worst part of [my]0-i confession , when [he]147-my father interrupted [me]0-i .

" Spare [me]147-my father any more details , "[147-my father] [he]147-my father said , bitterly , " [you]0-i have humiliated [me]147-my father sufficiently - [you]0-i have spoken enough . "[147-my father]

[He]147-my father removed the book on which [his]147-my father hand had hitherto rested from the case behind [him]147-my father , and advanced with it to the table - paused for a moment , pale and silent - then slowly opened it at the first page , and resumed [his]147-my father chair .

[I]0-i recognised the book instantly . It was a biographical history of [[his]147-my father family]218-his family , from the time of [[his]147-my father earliest ancestors]2137-his earliest ancestors down to the date of the births of [[his]147-my father own children]2138-his own children . The thick quarto pages were beautifully illuminated in the manner of the ancient manuscripts ; and the narrative , in written characters , had been produced under [his]147-my father own inspection . This book had cost [him]147-my father years of research and perseverance . The births and deaths , the marriages and possessions , the battle achievements and private feuds of [the old Norman barons from whom [he]147-my father traced [his]147-my father descent]2139-the old norman barons from whom he traced his descent , were all enrolled in regular order on every leaf - headed , sometimes merely by representations of [the Knight]2140-the knight 's favourite weapon ; sometimes by copies of [the Baron]2141-the baron 's effigy on [his]2141-the baron tombstone in [a foreign land]2142-a foreign land . As the history advanced to later dates , beautiful miniature portraits were inlaid at the top of each leaf ; and the illuminations were so managed as to symbolize the remarkable merits or the peculiar tastes of the subject of each biography . Thus , the page devoted to [[my]0-i mother]148-my mother was surrounded by [her]148-my mother favourite violets , clustering thickest round the last melancholy lines of writing which told the story of [her]148-my mother death .

Slowly and in silence , [[my]0-i father]147-my father turned over the leaves of the book which , next to the Bible , [I]0-i believe [he]147-my father most reverenced in [the world]158-the world , until [he]147-my father came to the last - written page but one - the page which [I]0-i knew , from its position , to be occupied by [my]0-i name . At the top , a miniature portrait of [me]0-i , when [a child]226-a child , was let into the leaf . Under it , was the record of [my]0-i birth and names , of [the School and College at which [I]0-i had been taught]2147-the school and college at which i had been taught , and of the profession that [I]0-i had adopted . Below , a large blank space was left for the entry of future particulars . On this page [[my]0-i father]147-my father now looked , still not uttering a word , still with the same ghastly calmness on [his]147-my father face . The organ - notes sounded no more ; but the trees rustled as pleasantly , and the roar of [the distant carriages]2149-the distant carriages swelled as joyously as ever on the ear . [Some children]2150-some children had come out to play in [the garden of [a neighbouring house]2152-a neighbouring house]2151-the garden of a neighbouring house . As [their]2150-some children voices reached [us]2153-us , so fresh , and clear , and happy - but another modulation of the thanksgiving song to [God]37-god which the trees were singing in the summer air - [I]0-i saw [[my]0-i father]147-my father , while [he]147-my father still looked on the page before [him]147-my father , clasp [his]147-my father trembling hands over [my]0-i portrait so as to hide it from sight .

Then [he]147-my father spoke ; but without looking up , and more as if [he]147-my father were speaking to [himself]147-my father than to [me]0-i . [His]147-my father voice , at other times clear and gentle in its tones , was now so hard and harsh in its forced calmness and deliberation of utterance , that it sounded like [a stranger]842-a stranger 's .

" [I]147-my father came here , this morning , "[147-my father] [he]147-my father began , " prepared to hear of faults and misfortunes which should pain [me]147-my father to the heart ; which [I]147-my father might never , perhaps , be able to forget , however willing and even predetermined to forgive . But [I]147-my father did not come prepared to hear , that unutterable disgrace had been cast on [me]147-my father and [mine]147-my father , by [[my]147-my father own child]3691-my own child . [I]147-my father have no words of rebuke or of condemnation for this : the reproach and the punishment have fallen already where the guilt was - and not there only . [[My]147-my father son]3626-my son 's infamy defiles [[his]3626-my son brother]3693-his brother 's birthright , and puts [[his]3626-my son father]3694-his father to shame . Even [[his]3626-my son sister]3454-his sister 's name - "[147-my father]

[He]147-my father stopped , shuddering . When [he]147-my father proceeded , [his]147-my father voice faltered , and [his]147-my father head drooped low .

" [I]147-my father say it again : - [you]3696-you are below all reproach and all condemnation ; but [I]147-my father have a duty to perform towards [[my]147-my father two who are absent]3697-my two who are absent , and [I]147-my father have a last word to say to [you]3696-you when that duty is done . On this page - "[147-my father] as [he]147-my father pointed to the family history , [his]147-my father tones strengthened again - " on this page there is a blank space left , after the last entry , for writing the future events of [your]3696-you life . Here , then , if [I]147-my father still acknowledge [you]3696-you to be [[my]147-my father son]3626-my son ; if [I]147-my father think [your]3696-you presence and the presence of [[my]147-my father daughter]3132-my daughter possible in [the same house]3700-the same house , must be written such a record of dishonour and degradation as has never yet defiled a single page of this book - here , the foul stain of [your]3696-you marriage , and its consequences , must be admitted to spread over all that is pure before it , and to taint to the last whatever comes after . This shall not be . [I]147-my father have no faith or hope in [you]3696-you more . [I]147-my father know [you]3696-you now , only as an enemy to [me]147-my father and to [[my]147-my father house]3400-my house - it is mockery and hypocrisy to call [[you]3696-you [son]478-son]3702-you son ; it is an insult to [Clara]57-clara , and even to [Ralph]39-ralph , to think of [you]3696-you as [[my]147-my father child]3598-my child . In this record [your]3696-you place is destroyed - and destroyed for ever . Would to [God]37-god [I]147-my father could tear the past from [my]147-my father memory , as [I]147-my father tear the leaf from this book ! "[147-my father]

As [he]2156-he spoke , the hour struck ; and the old French clock rang out gaily the same little silvery chime which [[my]0-i mother]148-my mother had so often taken [me]0-i into [[her]148-my mother room]1432-her room to listen to , in the bygone time . The shrill , lively peal mingled awfully with the sharp , tearing sound , as [[my]0-i father]147-my father rent out from the book before [him]147-my father the whole of the leaf which contained [my]0-i name ; tore it into fragments , and cast them on the floor .

[He]2156-he rose abruptly , after [he]2156-he had closed the book again . [His]2156-he cheeks flushed once more ; and when [he]2156-he next spoke , [his]2156-he voice grew louder and louder with every word [he]2156-he uttered . It seemed as if [he]2156-he still distrusted [his]2156-he resolution to abandon [me]0-i ; and sought , in [his]2156-he anger , the strength of purpose which , in [his]2156-he calmer mood , [he]2156-he might even yet have been unable to command .

" Now , [Sir]3046-sir , "[2156-he] [he]2156-he said , " [we]3706-we treat together as [strangers]300-strangers . [You]0-i are [[Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin 's son]3708-mr. sherwin 's son - not [mine]0-i . [You]0-i are [the husband of [[his]2156-he daughter]233-his daughter - not a relation of [[my]2156-he family]197-my family]3709-the husband of his daughter - not a relation of my family . Rise , as [I]2156-he do : [we]3706-we sit together no longer in [the same room]3712-the same room . Write ! "[2156-he] [he]2156-he pushed pen , ink , and paper before [me]0-i , " write [your]0-i terms there - [I]2156-he shall find means to keep [you]0-i to a written engagement - the terms of [your]0-i absence , for life , from [this country]146-this country ; and of [hers]3714-hers : the terms of [your]0-i silence , and of the silence of [[your]0-i accomplices]3715-your accomplices ; of all of [them]3716-them . Write what [you]0-i please ; [I]2156-he am ready to pay dearly for [your]0-i absence , [your]0-i secrecy , and [your]0-i abandonment of the name [you]0-i have degraded . [[My]2156-he God]3522-my god ! that [I]2156-he should live to bargain for hushing up the dishonour of [[my]2156-he family]197-my family , and to bargain for it with [you]0-i . "[2156-he]

[I]0-i had listened to [him]2160-i hitherto without pleading a word in [my]0-i own behalf ; but [his]2160-i last speech roused [me]0-i . Some of [his]2160-i pride stirred in [my]0-i heart against the bitterness of [his]2160-i contempt . [I]0-i raised [my]0-i head , and met [his]2160-i eye steadily for the first time - then , thrust the writing materials away from [me]0-i , and left [my]0-i place at the table .

" Stop ! "[2160-i] [he]2160-i cried . " Do [you]0-i pretend that [you]0-i have not understood [me]2160-i ? "[2160-i]

" It is because [I]2160-i have understood [you]2160-i , [Sir]3046-sir , that [I]2160-i go . [I]2160-i have deserved [your]2160-i anger , and have submitted without a murmur to all that it could inflict . If [you]2160-i see in [my]2160-i conduct towards [you]2160-i no mitigation of [my]2160-i offence ; if [you]2160-i can not view the shame and wrong inflicted on [me]2160-i , with such grief as may have some pity mixed with it - [I]2160-i have , [I]2160-i think , the right to ask that [your]2160-i contempt may be silent , and [your]2160-i last words to [me]2160-i , not words of insult . "[2160-i]

" Insult ! After what has happened , is it for [you]2160-i to utter that word in the tone in which [you]2160-i have just spoken it ? [I]2160-i tell [you]2160-i again , [I]2160-i insist on [your]2160-i written engagement as [I]2160-i would insist on the engagement of [a stranger]842-a stranger - [I]2160-i will have it , before [you]2160-i leave [this room]1236-this room ! "[2160-i]

" All , and more than all , which that degrading engagement could imply , [I]2160-i will do . But [I]2160-i have not fallen so low yet , as to be bribed to perform a duty . [You]2160-i may be able to forget that [you]2160-i are [[my]2160-i father]147-my father ; [I]2160-i can never forget that [I]2160-i am [[your]2160-i son]3723-your son . "[2160-i]

" The remembrance will avail [you]2160-i nothing as long as [I]2160-i live . [I]2160-i tell [you]2160-i again , [I]2160-i insist on [your]2160-i written engagement , though it were only to show that [I]2160-i have ceased to believe in [your]2160-i word . Write at once - do [you]2160-i hear [me]2160-i ? - Write ! "[2160-i]

[I]0-i neither moved nor answered . [His]2161-i face changed again , and grew livid ; [his]2161-i fingers trembled convulsively , and crumpled the sheet of paper , as [he]2161-i tried to take it up from the table on which it lay .

" [You]0-i refuse ? "[2161-i] [he]2161-i said quickly .

" [I]2160-i have already told [you]0-i , [Sir]3046-sir - "[2160-i]

" Go ! "[2161-i] [he]2161-i interrupted , pointing passionately to the door , " go out from [this house]3137-this house , never to return to [it]3137-this house again - go , not as [a stranger to [me]2161-i]3073-a stranger to me , but as [an enemy]3727-an enemy ! [I]2161-i have no faith in a single promise [you]0-i have made : there is no baseness which [I]2161-i do not believe [you]0-i will yet be guilty of . But [I]2161-i tell [you]0-i , and [the wretches with whom [you]0-i are leagued]3728-the wretches with whom you are leagued , to take warning : [I]2161-i have wealth , power , and position ; and there is no use to which [I]2161-i will not put [them]3729-them against [the man or woman who threatens the fair fame of [this family]3731-this family]3730-the man or woman who threatens the fair fame of this family . Leave [me]2161-i , remembering that - and leave [me]2161-i for ever ! "[2161-i]

Just as [he]2162-he uttered the last word , just as [my]0-i hand was on the lock of the door , a faint sound - something between breathing and speaking - was audible in the direction of [the library]1061-the library . [He]2162-he started , and looked round . Impelled , [I]0-i know not how , [I]0-i paused on the point of going out . [My]0-i eyes followed [his]2162-he , and fixed on the cloth door which led into [the library]1061-the library .

It opened a little - then shut again - then opened wide . Slowly and noiselessly , [Clara]57-clara came into [the room]263-the room .

The silence and suddenness of [her]57-clara entrance at such a moment ; the look of terror which changed to unnatural vacancy the wonted softness and gentleness of [her]57-clara eyes , [her]57-clara pale face , [her]57-clara white dress , and slow , noiseless step , made [her]57-clara first appearance in [the room]263-the room seem almost supernatural ; it was as if [an apparition]2167-an apparition had been walking towards [us]2168-us , and not [Clara]57-clara [herself]57-clara ! As [she]57-clara approached [[my]0-i father]147-my father , [he]147-my father pronounced [her]57-clara name in astonishment ; but [his]147-my father voice sank to a whisper , while [he]147-my father spoke it . For an instant , [she]57-clara paused , hesitating - [I]0-i saw [her]57-clara tremble as [her]57-clara eyes met [his]147-my father - then , as [they]2170-they turned towards [me]0-i , [the brave girl]2171-the brave girl came on ; and , taking [my]0-i hand , stood and faced [[my]0-i father]147-my father , standing by [my]0-i side .

" [Clara]57-clara ! "[147-my father] [he]147-my father exclaimed again , still in the same whispering tones .

[I]0-i felt [her]57-clara cold hand close fast on [mine]0-i ; the grasp of the chill , frail fingers was almost painful to [me]0-i . [Her]57-clara lips moved , but [her]57-clara quick , hysterical breathing made the few words [she]57-clara uttered inarticulate .

" [Clara]57-clara ! "[147-my father] repeated [[my]0-i father]147-my father , for the third time , [his]147-my father voice rising , but sinking again immediately - when [he]147-my father spoke [his]147-my father next words , " [Clara]57-clara , "[147-my father] [he]147-my father resumed , sadly and gently , " let go [his]147-my father hand ; this is not a time for [your]57-clara presence , [I]147-my father beg [you]57-clara to leave [us]3732-us . [You]57-clara must not take [his]147-my father hand ! [He]147-my father has ceased to be [[my]147-my father son]3626-my son , or [[your]57-clara brother]3328-your brother . [Clara]57-clara , do [you]57-clara not hear [me]147-my father ? "[147-my father]

" Yes , [Sir]3046-sir , [I]2174-you hear [you]3046-sir , "[2174-you] [she]2174-you answered . " God grant that [[my]2174-you mother]148-my mother in [heaven]3526-heaven may not hear [you]3046-sir too ! "[2174-you]

[He]2175-he was approaching while [she]2174-you replied ; but at [her]2174-you last words , [he]2175-he stopped instantly , and turned [his]2175-he face away from [us]2176-us . Who shall say what remembrances of other days shook [him]2175-he to the heart ?

" [You]2174-you have spoken , [Clara]57-clara , as [you]2174-you should not have spoken , "[2175-he] [he]2175-he went on , without looking up . " [[Your]2174-you mother]3738-your mother - "[2175-he] [his]2175-he voice faltered and failed [him]2175-he . " Can [you]2174-you still hold [his]2175-he hand after what [I]2175-he have said ? [I]2175-he tell [you]2174-you again , [he]2175-he is unworthy to be in [your]2174-you presence ; [[my]2175-he house]3400-my house is [[his]2175-he home]3740-his home no longer - must [I]2175-he command [you]2174-you to leave [him]2175-he ? "[2175-he]

The deeply planted instinct of gentleness and obedience prevailed ; [she]2177-i dropped [my]0-i hand , but did not move away from [me]0-i , even yet .

" Now leave [us]3741-us , [Clara]57-clara , "[2175-he] [he]2175-he said . " [You]57-clara were wrong , [[my]2175-he love]3327-my love , to be in [that room]3524-that room , and wrong to come in here . [I]2175-he will speak to [you]57-clara up - [stairs]1197-stairs - [you]57-clara must remain [here]3265-here no longer . "[2175-he]

[She]2177-i clasped [her]2177-i trembling fingers together , and sighed heavily .

" [I]2177-i can not go , [Sir]3046-sir , "[2177-i] [she]2177-i said quickly and breathlessly .

" Must [I]2175-he tell [you]57-clara for the first time in [your]57-clara life , that [you]57-clara are acting disobediently ? "[2175-he] [he]2175-he asked .

" [I]2177-i can not go , "[2177-i] [she]2177-i repeated in the same manner , " till [you]3046-sir have said [you]3046-sir will let [him]2175-he atone for [his]2175-he offence , and will forgive [him]2175-he . "[2177-i]

" For [his]2175-he offence there is neither atonement nor forgiveness . [Clara]57-clara ! are [you]57-clara so changed , that [you]57-clara can disobey [me]2175-he to [my]2175-he face ? "[2175-he]

[He]2175-he walked away from [us]2178-us as [he]2175-he said this .

" Oh , no ! no ! "[2177-i] [She]2177-i ran towards [him]2175-he ; but stopped halfway , and looked back at [me]0-i affrightedly , as [I]0-i stood near the door . " [Basil]46-basil , "[2177-i] [she]2177-i cried , " [you]46-basil have not done what [you]46-basil promised [me]2177-i ; [you]46-basil have not been patient . Oh , [Sir]3046-sir , if [I]2177-i have ever deserved kindness from [you]46-basil , be kind to [him]2175-he for [my]2177-i sake ! [Basil]46-basil ! speak , [Basil]46-basil ! Ask [his]2175-he pardon on [your]46-basil knees . [Father]71-father , [I]2177-i promised [him]2175-he [he]2175-he should be forgiven , if [I]2177-i asked [you]46-basil . Not a word ; not a word from either ? [Basil]46-basil ! [you]46-basil are not going yet - not going at all ! Remember , [Sir]3046-sir , how good and kind [he]2175-he has always been to [me]2177-i . [[My]2177-i poor mother]3749-my poor mother , [I]2177-i must speak of [her]3749-my poor mother , [[my]2177-i poor mother 's favourite son]3750-my poor mother 's favourite son - [you]46-basil have told [me]2177-i so [yourself]46-basil ! and [he]2175-he has always been [[my]2177-i favourite brother]3751-my favourite brother ; [I]2177-i think because [[my]2177-i mother]148-my mother loved [him]2175-he so ! [His]2175-he first fault , too ! [his]2175-he first grief ! And will [you]46-basil tell [him]2175-he for this , that [[our]3753-our home]3754-our home is [[his]2175-he home]3740-his home no longer ? Punish [me]2177-i , [Sir]3046-sir ! [I]2177-i have done wrong like [him]2175-he ; when [I]2177-i heard [your]46-basil voices so loud , [I]2177-i listened in [the library]1061-the library . [He]2175-he 's going ! No , no , no ! not yet ! "[2177-i]

[She]2179-her ran to the door as [I]0-i opened it , and pushed it to again . Overwhelmed by the violence of [her]2179-her agitation , [[my]0-i father]147-my father had sunk into a chair while [she]2179-her was speaking .

" Come back - come back with [me]2179-her to [his]2175-he knees ! "[2179-her] [she]2179-her whispered , fixing [her]2179-her wild , tearless eyes on [mine]0-i , flinging [her]2179-her arms round [my]0-i neck , and trying to lead [me]0-i with [her]2179-her from the door . " Come back , or [you]147-my father will drive [me]2179-her mad ! "[2179-her] [she]2179-her repeated loudly , drawing [me]0-i away towards [[my]0-i father]147-my father .

[He]147-my father rose instantly from [his]147-my father chair .

" [Clara]57-clara , "[147-my father] [he]147-my father said , " [I]147-my father command [you]57-clara , leave [him]147-my father ! "[147-my father] [He]147-my father advanced a few steps towards [me]0-i . " Go ! "[147-my father] [he]147-my father cried ; " if [you]57-clara are human in [[your]57-clara villany]3758-your villany , [you]57-clara will release [me]147-my father from this ! "[147-my father]

[I]0-i whispered in [her]2179-her ear , " [I]0-i will write , love - [I]0-i will write , "[0-i] and disengaged [her]2179-her arms from [my]0-i neck - they were hanging round it weakly , already ! As [I]0-i passed the door , [I]0-i turned back , and looked again into [the room]263-the room for the last time .

[Clara]57-clara was in [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's arms , [her]57-clara head lay on [his]147-my father shoulder , [her]57-clara face was as still in its heavenly calmness as if [the world]158-the world and [the world]158-the world 's looks knew it no more , and the only light that fell on it now , was light from [the angel]2186-the angel 's eyes . [She]57-clara had fainted .

[He]147-my father was standing with one arm round [her]57-clara , [his]147-my father disengaged hand was searching impatiently over the wall behind [him]147-my father for the bell , and [his]147-my father eyes were fixed in anguish and in love unutterable on the peaceful face , hushed in its sad repose so close beneath [his]147-my father own . For one moment , [I]0-i saw [him]147-my father thus , ere [I]0-i closed the door - the next , [I]0-i had left [the house]244-the house .

[I]0-i never entered [it]244-the house again - [I]0-i have never seen [[my]0-i father]147-my father since .

IV .

[We]2189-we are seldom able to discover under any ordinary conditions of self - knowledge , how intimately that spiritual part of [us]2189-we , which is undying , can attach to itself and its operations the poorest objects of [that external world around [us]2189-we]2190-that external world around us , which is perishable . In the ravelled skein , the slightest threads are the hardest to follow . In analysing the associations and sympathies which regulate the play of [our]2189-we passions , the simplest and homeliest are the last that [we]2189-we detect . It is only when the shock comes , and the mind recoils before it - when joy is changed into sorrow , or sorrow into joy - that [we]2189-we really discern what trifles in [the outer world]1222-the outer world [our]2189-we noblest mental pleasures , or [our]2189-we severest mental pains , have made part of themselves ; atoms which the whirlpool has drawn into its vortex , as greedily and as surely as the largest mass .

It was reserved for [me]0-i to know this , when - after a moment 's pause before the door of [[[my]0-i father]147-my father 's house]2193-my father 's house , more homeless , then , than [the poorest wretch who passed [me]0-i on the pavement , and had [wife]3425-wife or kindred to shelter [him]2194-the poorest wretch who passed me on the pavement , and had wife or kindred to shelter him in a garret that night in a garret that night]2194-the poorest wretch who passed me on the pavement , and had wife or kindred to shelter him in a garret that night - [my]0-i steps turned , as of old , in the direction of [North Villa]11-north villa .

Again [I]0-i passed over the scene of [my]0-i daily pilgrimage , always to the same shrine , for a whole year ; and now , for the first time , [I]0-i knew that there was hardly a spot along the entire way , which [my]0-i heart had not unconsciously made beautiful and beloved to [me]0-i by some association with [Margaret Sherwin]44-margaret . Here was [the friendly , familiar shop]2196-the friendly , familiar shop - window , filled with the glittering trinkets which had so often lured [me]0-i in to buy presents for [her]44-margaret , on [my]0-i way to [the house]244-the house . There was [the noisy street corner]2198-the noisy street corner , void of all adornment in itself , but once bright to [me]0-i with the fairy - land architecture of a dream , because [I]0-i knew that at that place [I]0-i had passed over half the distance which separated [[my]0-i home]2199-my home from [hers]44-margaret . Farther on , the Park trees came in sight - trees that no autumn decay or winter nakedness could make dreary , in the bygone time ; for [she]44-margaret and [I]0-i had walked under [them]2200-them together . And further yet , was the turning which led from [the long , suburban road]2201-the long , suburban road into [Hollyoake Square]12-hollyoake square - [the lonely , dust - whitened place]2202-the lonely , dust - whitened place , around which [my]0-i past happiness and [my]0-i wasted hopes had flung their golden illusions , like jewels hung round the coarse wooden image of [a Roman saint]2203-a roman saint . Dishonoured and ruined , it was among such associations as these - too homely to have been recognised by [me]0-i in former times - that [I]0-i journeyed along the well - remembered way to [North Villa]11-north villa .

[I]0-i went on without hesitating , without even a thought of turning back . [I]0-i had said that the honour of [[my]0-i family]197-my family should not suffer by the calamity which had fallen on [me]0-i ; and , while life remained , [I]0-i was determined that nothing should prevent [me]0-i from holding to [my]0-i word . It was from this resolution that [I]0-i drew the faith in [myself]0-i , the confidence in [my]0-i endurance , the sustaining calmness under [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's sentence of exclusion , which nerved [me]0-i to go on . [I]0-i must inevitably see [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin perhaps even suffer the humiliation of seeing [her]2206-her ! - must inevitably speak such words , disclose such truths , as should show [him]42-mr. sherwin that deceit was henceforth useless . [I]0-i must do this and more , [I]0-i must be prepared to guard the family to which - though banished from it - [I]0-i still belonged , from every conspiracy against [them]197-my family that detected crime or shameless cupidity could form , whether in the desire of revenge , or in the hope of gain .. A hard , almost an impossible task - but , nevertheless , a task that must be done !

[I]0-i kept the thought of this necessity before [my]0-i mind unceasingly ; not only as a duty , but as a refuge from another thought , to which [I]0-i dared not for a moment turn . The still , pale face which [I]0-i had seen lying hushed on [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's breast - [CLARA]57-clara ! - That way , lay the grief that weakens , the yearning and the terror that are near despair ; that way was not it for [me]0-i .

[The servant]315-the servant was at [the garden - gate of [North Villa]11-north villa]939-the garden - gate of north villa - [the same servant whom [I]0-i had seen and questioned in the first days of [my]0-i fatal delusion]2210-the same servant whom i had seen and questioned in the first days of my fatal delusion . [She]315-the servant was receiving a letter from [a man , very poorly dressed , who walked away the moment [I]0-i approached]2211-a man , very poorly dressed , who walked away the moment i approached . [Her]315-the servant confusion and surprise were so great as [she]315-the servant let [me]0-i in , that [she]315-the servant could hardly look at , or speak to [me]0-i . It was only when [I]0-i was ascending the door - steps that [she]315-the servant said -

" [Miss Margaret]44-margaret "[315-the servant] - [she]315-the servant still gave [her]315-the servant that name ! - " [Miss Margaret]44-margaret is [upstairs]3063-upstairs , [Sir]3046-sir . [I]315-the servant suppose [you]3046-sir would like - "[315-the servant]

" [I]315-the servant have no wish to see [her]44-margaret : [I]315-the servant want to speak to [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin . "[315-the servant]

Looking more bewildered , and even frightened , than before , [the girl]687-the girl hurriedly opened one of the doors in [the passage]1048-the passage . [I]0-i saw , as [I]0-i entered , that [she]315-the servant had shown [me]0-i , in [her]315-the servant confusion , into [the wrong room]2214-the wrong room . [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin , who was in [the apartment]1456-the apartment , hastily drew a screen across the lower end of it , apparently to hide something from [me]0-i ; which , however , [I]0-i had not seen as [I]0-i came in .

[He]42-mr. sherwin advanced , holding out [his]42-mr. sherwin hand ; but [his]42-mr. sherwin restless eyes wandered unsteadily , looking away from [me]0-i towards the screen .

" So [you]0-i have come at last , have [you]0-i ? Just let 's step into [the drawing - room]1022-the drawing - room : the fact is - [I]42-mr. sherwin thought [I]42-mr. sherwin wrote to [you]42-mr. sherwin about it - ? "[42-mr. sherwin]

[He]42-mr. sherwin stopped suddenly , and [his]42-mr. sherwin outstretched arm fell to [his]42-mr. sherwin side . [I]0-i had not said a word . Something in [my]0-i look and manner must have told [him]42-mr. sherwin already on what errand [I]0-i had come .

" Why do n't [you]0-i speak ? "[42-mr. sherwin] [he]42-mr. sherwin said , after a moment 's pause . " What are [you]0-i looking at [me]42-mr. sherwin like that for ? Stop ! Let 's say [our]3762-our say in [the other room]3763-the other room . "[42-mr. sherwin] [He]42-mr. sherwin walked past [me]0-i towards the door , and half opened it .

Why was [he]42-mr. sherwin so anxious to get [me]0-i away ? Who , or what , was [he]42-mr. sherwin hiding behind the screen ? [The servant]315-the servant had said [[his]315-the servant daughter]233-his daughter was [upstairs]3063-upstairs ; remembering this , and suspecting every action or word that came from [him]315-the servant , [I]0-i determined to remain in [the room]263-the room , and discover [his]315-the servant secret . It was evidently connected with [me]0-i .

" Now then , "[42-mr. sherwin] [he]42-mr. sherwin continued , opening the door a little wider , " it 's only across [the hall]1423-the hall , [you]0-i know ; and [I]42-mr. sherwin always receive [visitors]3765-visitors in [the best room]3766-the best room . "[42-mr. sherwin]

" [I]0-i have been admitted [here]3265-here , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , " and have neither time nor inclination to follow [you]42-mr. sherwin from [room]1207-room to [room]1207-room , just as [you]42-mr. sherwin like . What [I]0-i have to say is not much ; and , unless [you]42-mr. sherwin give [me]0-i fit reasons to the contrary , [I]0-i shall say it here . "[0-i]

" [You]42-mr. sherwin will , will [you]42-mr. sherwin ? Let [me]2220-you tell [you]42-mr. sherwin that 's damned like what [[we]3770-we plain mercantile [men]518-men]3771-we plain mercantile men call downright incivility . "[2220-you] [He]2220-you saw [I]0-i was determined , and closed the door as [he]2220-you spoke , [his]2220-you face twitching and working violently , and [his]2220-you quick , evil eyes turned again in the direction of the screen .

" Well , "[2220-you] [he]2220-you continued , with a sulky defiance of manner and look , " do as [you]42-mr. sherwin like ; stop here - [you]42-mr. sherwin 'll wish [you]42-mr. sherwin had n't before long , [I]2220-you 'll be bound ! [You]42-mr. sherwin do n't seem to hurry [yourself]42-mr. sherwin much about speaking , so [I]2220-you shall sit down . [You]42-mr. sherwin can do as [you]42-mr. sherwin please . "[2220-you]

" [You]2220-you have written [me]0-i two letters , [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin - "[0-i]

" Yes : and took devilish good care [you]2220-you should get them - [I]2220-you left them [myself]2220-you . "[2220-you]

" In writing those letters , [you]2220-you were either grossly deceived ; and , in that case , are only to be pitied , or - "[0-i]

" Or [you]2220-you have been trying to deceive [me]0-i ; and in that case , [I]0-i have to tell [you]2220-you that deceit is henceforth useless . [I]0-i know all - more than [you]2220-you suspect : more , [I]0-i believe , than [you]2220-you would wish [me]0-i to have known . "[0-i]

" Oh , that 's [your]2220-you tack , is it ? By God , [I]2220-you expected as much the moment [you]2220-you came in ! What ! [You]2220-you 'd better - [I]2220-you 'm off to [[your]2220-you father]302-your father to blow the whole business ; [I]2220-you am , as sure as [my]2220-you name 's [Sherwin]2220-you ! "[2220-you]

[He]2221-i struck [his]2221-i fist on the table , and started up , livid with passion . The screen trembled a little , and a slight rustling noise was audible behind it , just as [he]2221-i advanced towards [me]0-i . [He]2221-i stopped instantly , with an oath , and looked back .

" [I]0-i warn [you]2221-i to remain here , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " This morning , [[my]0-i father]147-my father has heard all from [my]0-i lips . [He]147-my father has renounced [me]0-i as [[his]147-my father son]412-his son , and [I]0-i have left [[his]147-my father house]216-his house for ever . "[0-i]

[He]2221-i turned round quickly , staring at [me]0-i with a face of mingled fury and dismay .

" Then [you]0-i come to [me]2221-i [a beggar]3785-a beggar ! "[2221-i] [he]2221-i burst out ; " [a beggar who has taken [me]2221-i in about [[his]2221-i fine family]3787-his fine family , and [his]2221-i fine prospects]3786-a beggar who has taken me in about his fine family , and his fine prospects ; [a beggar who ca n't support [[my]2221-i child]3598-my child - Yes ! [I]2221-i say it again , a beggar who looks [me]2221-i in the face , and talks as [you]0-i do . [I]2221-i do n't care a damn about [you]0-i or [[your]0-i father]302-your father]3788-a beggar who ca n't support my child - yes ! i say it again , a beggar who looks me in the face , and talks as you do . i do n't care a damn about you or your father ! [I]2221-i know [my]2221-i rights ; [I]2221-i 'm [an Englishman]3791-an englishman , thank [God]37-god ! [you]0-i may stare as angry as [you]0-i like ; staring do n't hurt . [I]2221-i 'm [an honest man]3676-an honest man , and [[my]2221-i girl]3773-my girl 's [an honest girl]3794-an honest girl ! "[2221-i]

[I]0-i was looking at [him]2222-i , at that moment , with the contempt that [I]0-i really felt ; [his]2222-i rage produced no other sensation in [me]0-i . All higher and quicker emotions seemed to have been dried at their sources by the events of the morning .

" [I]2222-i say [[my]2222-i girl]3773-my girl 's [an honest girl]3794-an honest girl , "[2222-i] [he]2222-i repeated , sitting down again ; " and [I]2222-i dare [you]0-i , or [anybody]723-anybody - [I]2222-i do n't care who - to prove the contrary . [You]0-i told [me]2222-i [you]0-i knew all , just now . What all ? Come ! [we]3798-we 'll have this out before [we]3798-we do anything else .
