"[2222-i]

" [I]0-i am not here to ask questions , or to answer them , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied - " [my]0-i errand in [this house]3137-this house is simply to tell [you]0-i , that the miserable falsehoods contained in [your]0-i letter , will avail [you]0-i as little as the foul insolence of language by which [you]0-i are now endeavouring to support [them]3802-them . [I]0-i told [you]0-i before , and [I]0-i now tell [you]0-i again , [I]0-i know all . [I]0-i had been inside [that house]3803-that house , before [I]0-i saw [[your]0-i daughter]3131-your daughter at the door ; and had heard , from [her]3131-your daughter voice and [his]0-i voice , what such shame and misery as [you]0-i can not comprehend forbid [me]0-i to repeat . To [your]0-i past duplicity , and to [your]0-i present violence , [I]0-i have but one answer to give : - [I]0-i will never see [[your]0-i daughter]3131-your daughter again . "[0-i]

" But [you]0-i shall see [her]3131-your daughter again - yes ! and keep [her]3131-your daughter too ! Do [you]0-i think [I]2223-i ca n't see through [you]0-i and [your]0-i precious story ? [[Your]0-i father]302-your father 's cut [you]0-i off with a shilling ; and now [you]0-i want to curry favour with [him]302-your father again by trumping up a case against [[my]2223-i girl]3773-my girl , and trying to get [her]3131-your daughter off [your]0-i hands that way . But it wo n't do ! [You]0-i 've married [her]3131-your daughter , [[my]2223-i fine gentleman]3808-my fine gentleman , and [you]0-i shall stick to [her]3131-your daughter ! Do [you]0-i think [I]2223-i would n't sooner believe [her]3131-your daughter , than believe [you]0-i ? Do [you]0-i think [I]2223-i 'll stand this ? Here [she]3131-your daughter is up - [stairs]1197-stairs , half heart - broken , on [my]2223-i hands ; here 's [[my]2223-i wife]864-my wife "[2223-i] - [his]2223-i voice sank suddenly as [he]2223-i said this - " with [her]3131-your daughter mind in such a state that [I]2223-i 'm kept away from business , day after day , to look after [her]3131-your daughter ; here 's all this crying and misery and mad goings - on in [[my]2223-i house]3400-my house , because [you]0-i choose to behave like [a scamp]3779-a scamp - and do [you]0-i think [I]2223-i 'll put up with it quietly ? [I]2223-i 'll make [you]0-i do [your]0-i duty to [[my]2223-i girl]3773-my girl , if [she]3131-your daughter goes to [the parish]3814-the parish to appeal against [you]0-i ! [Your]0-i story indeed ! Who 'll believe that [a young female]3587-a young female , like [Margaret]44-margaret , could have taken to [a fellow like [Mannion]51-mr. mannion]3816-a fellow like mannion ? and kept it all a secret from [you]0-i ? Who believes that , [I]2223-i should like to know ? "[2223-i]

" [I]2222-i believe it ! "[2222-i]

The third voice which pronounced those words was [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin 's .

But was the figure that now came out from behind the screen , the same frail , shrinking figure which had so often moved [my]0-i pity in the past time ? [the same wan figure of sickness and sorrow , ever watching in the background of the fatal love]2224-the same wan figure of sickness and sorrow , ever watching in the background of the fatal love - scenes at [North Villa]11-north villa ; ever looking like [the same spectre - shadow]2225-the same spectre - shadow , when the evenings darkened in as [I]0-i sat by [Margaret]44-margaret 's side ?

Had [the grave]2226-the grave given up its dead ? [I]0-i stood awe - struck , neither speaking nor moving while [she]44-margaret walked towards [me]0-i . [She]44-margaret was clothed in the white garments of [the sick - room]2227-the sick - room - they looked on [her]44-margaret like the raiment of [the tomb]2228-the tomb . [Her]44-margaret figure , which [I]0-i only remembered as drooping with premature infirmity , was now straightened convulsively to its proper height ; [her]44-margaret arms hung close at [her]44-margaret side , like the arms of a corpse ; the natural paleness of [her]44-margaret face had turned to an earthy hue ; its natural expression , so meek , so patient , so melancholy in uncomplaining sadness , was gone ; and , in its stead , was left a pining stillness that never changed ; a weary repose of lifeless waking - the awful seal of Death stamped ghastly on the living face ; the awful look of [Death]68-death staring out from the chill , shining eyes .

[[Her]44-margaret husband]480-her husband kept [his]480-her husband place , and spoke to [her]44-margaret as [she]44-margaret stopped opposite to [me]0-i . [His]480-her husband tones were altered , but [his]480-her husband manner showed as little feeling as ever .

" There now ! "[480-her husband] [he]480-her husband began , " [you]0-i said [you]0-i were sure [he]480-her husband 'd come [here]3265-here , and that [you]0-i 'd never take to [your]0-i bed , as [the Doctor]3241-the doctor wanted [you]0-i , till [you]0-i 'd seen [him]480-her husband and spoken to [him]480-her husband . Well , [he]480-her husband has come ; there [he]480-her husband is . [He]480-her husband came in while [you]0-i were asleep , [I]480-her husband rather think ; and [I]480-her husband let [him]480-her husband stop , so that if [you]0-i woke up and wanted to see [him]480-her husband , [you]0-i might . [You]0-i ca n't say - [nobody]120-nobody can say - [I]480-her husband have n't given in to [your]0-i whims and fancies after that . There ! [you]0-i 've had [your]0-i way , and [you]0-i 've said [you]0-i believe [him]480-her husband ; and now , if [I]480-her husband ring for [the nurse]3820-the nurse , [you]0-i 'll go [upstairs]3063-upstairs at last , and make no more worry about it - Eh ? "[480-her husband]

[She]2230-i moved [her]2230-i head slowly , and looked at [him]2231-his . As those dying eyes met [his]2231-his , as that face on which the light of life was darkening fast , turned on [him]2231-his , [even]2232-even [his]2231-his gross nature felt the shock . [I]0-i saw [him]2231-his shrink - [his]2231-his sallow cheeks whitened , [he]2231-his moved [his]2231-his chair away , and said no more .

[She]2230-i looked back to [me]0-i again , and spoke . [Her]2230-i voice was still the same soft , low voice as ever . It was fearful to hear how little it had altered , and then to look on the changed face .

" [I]2230-i am dying , "[2230-i] [she]2230-i said to [me]0-i . " Many nights have passed since that night when [Margaret]44-margaret came [home]176-home by [herself]44-margaret and [I]2230-i felt something moving down into [my]2230-i heart , when [I]2230-i looked at [her]2230-i , which [I]2230-i knew was death - many nights , since [I]2230-i have been used to say [my]2230-i prayers , and think [I]2230-i had said them for the last time , before [I]2230-i dared shut [my]2230-i eyes in the darkness and the quiet . [I]2230-i have lived on till to - day , very weary of [my]2230-i life ever since that night when [Margaret]44-margaret came in ; and yet , [I]2230-i could not die , because [I]2230-i had an atonement to make to [you]0-i , and [you]0-i never came to hear it and forgive [me]2230-i . [I]2230-i was not fit for [God]37-god to take [me]2230-i till [you]0-i came - [I]2230-i know that , know it to be truth from a dream . "[2230-i]

[She]2233-i paused , still looking at [me]0-i , but with the same deathly blank of expression . The eye had ceased to speak already ; nothing but the voice was left .

" [[My]2233-i husband]3823-my husband has asked , who will believe [you]0-i ? "[2233-i] [she]2233-i went on ; [her]2233-i weak tones gathering strength with every fresh word [she]2233-i uttered . " [I]2233-i have answered that [I]2233-i will ; for [you]0-i have spoken the truth . Now , when the light of [this world]195-this world is fading from [my]2233-i eyes ; here , in this earthly home of much sorrow and suffering , which [I]2233-i must soon quit - in the presence of [[my]2233-i husband]3823-my husband - under the same roof with [[my]2233-i sinful child]3826-my sinful child - [I]2233-i bear [you]0-i witness that [you]0-i have spoken the truth . [I]2233-i , [[her]3826-my sinful child mother]319-her mother , say it of [her]3826-my sinful child : [Margaret]44-margaret [Sherwin]44-margaret is guilty ; [she]3826-my sinful child is no more worthy to be called [[your]0-i wife]3287-your wife . "[2233-i]

[She]2234-i pronounced the last words slowly , distinctly , solemnly . Till that fearful denunciation was spoken , [[her]2234-i husband]480-her husband had been looking sullenly and suspiciously towards [us]2236-us , as [we]2236-us stood together ; but while [she]2234-i uttered it , [his]480-her husband eyes fell , and [he]480-her husband turned away [his]480-her husband head in silence .

[He]480-her husband never looked up , never moved , or interrupted [her]2234-i , as [she]2234-i continued , still addressing [me]0-i ; but now speaking very slowly and painfully , pausing longer and longer between every sentence .

" From [this room]1236-this room [I]2234-i go to [[my]2234-i death - bed]3830-my death - bed . The last words [I]2234-i speak in [this world]195-this world shall be to [[my]2234-i husband]3823-my husband , and shall change [his]480-her husband heart towards [you]0-i . [I]2234-i have been weak of purpose , "[2234-i] as [she]2234-i said this , a strange sweetness and mournfulness began to steal over [her]2234-i tones , " miserably , guiltily weak , all [my]2234-i life . Much sorrow and pain and heavy disappointment , when [I]2234-i was young , did some great harm to [me]2234-i which [I]2234-i have never recovered since . [I]2234-i have lived always in fear of [others]98-others , and doubt of [myself]2234-i ; and this has made [me]2234-i guilty of a great sin towards [you]0-i . Forgive [me]2234-i before [I]2234-i die ! [I]2234-i suspected the guilt that was preparing - [I]2234-i foreboded the shame that was to come - [they]3834-they hid it from [others]98-others ' eyes ; but , from the first , [they]3834-they could not hide it from [mine]2234-i - and yet [I]2234-i never warned [you]0-i as [I]2234-i ought ! [That man]212-that man had the power of [Satan]72-satan over [me]2234-i ! [I]2234-i always shuddered before [him]212-that man , as [I]2234-i used to shudder at the darkness when [I]2234-i was [a little child]1109-a little child ! [My]2234-i life has been all fear - fear of [him]212-that man ; fear of [[my]2234-i husband]3823-my husband , and even of [[my]2234-i daughter]3132-my daughter ; fear , worse still , of [my]2234-i own thoughts , and of what [I]2234-i had discovered that should be told to [you]0-i . When [I]2234-i tried to speak , [you]0-i were too generous to understand [me]2234-i - [I]2234-i was afraid to think [my]2234-i suspicions were right , long after they should have been suspicions no longer . It was misery ! - oh , what misery from then till now ! "[2234-i]

[Her]2237-her voice died away for a moment , in faint , breathless murmurings . [She]2237-her struggled to recover it , and repeated in a whisper :

" Forgive [me]2237-her before [I]2237-her die ! [I]2237-her have made a terrible atonement ; [I]2237-her have borne witness against the innocence of [[my]2237-her own child]3691-my own child . [[My]2237-her own child]3691-my own child ! [I]2237-her dare not bid [God]37-god bless [her]3691-my own child , if [they]3842-they bring [her]3691-my own child to [my]2237-her bedside ! - forgive [me]2237-her ! - forgive [me]2237-her before [I]2237-her die ! "[2237-her]

[She]2237-her took [my]0-i hand , and pressed it to [her]2237-her cold lips . The tears gushed into [my]0-i eyes , as [I]0-i tried to speak to [her]2237-her .

" No tears for [me]2237-her ! "[2237-her] [she]2237-her murmured gently . " [Basil]46-basil ! - let [me]2237-her call [you]46-basil as [[your]46-basil mother]3738-your mother would call [you]46-basil if [she]3738-your mother was alive - [Basil]46-basil ! pray that [I]2237-her may be forgiven in the dreadful Eternity to which [I]2237-her go , as [you]0-i have forgiven [me]2237-her ! And , for [her]2237-her ? - oh ! who will pray for [her]2237-her when [I]2237-her am gone ? "[2237-her]

Those words were the last [I]0-i heard [her]2237-her pronounce . Exhausted beyond the power of speaking more , though it were only in a whisper , [she]2237-her tried to take [my]0-i hand again , and express by a gesture the irrevocable farewell . But [her]2237-her strength failed [her]2237-her even for this - failed [her]2237-her with awful suddenness . [Her]2237-her hand moved halfway towards [mine]0-i ; then stopped , and trembled for a moment in the air ; then fell to [her]2237-her side , with the fingers distorted and clenched together . [She]2237-her reeled where [she]2237-her stood , and sank helplessly as [I]0-i stretched out [my]0-i arms to support [her]2237-her .

[[Her]2237-her husband]480-her husband rose fretfully from [his]480-her husband chair , and took [her]2237-her from [me]0-i . When [his]480-her husband eyes met [mine]0-i , the look of sullen self - restraint in [his]480-her husband countenance was crossed , in an instant , by an expression of triumphant malignity . [He]480-her husband whispered to [me]0-i : " If [you]0-i do n't change [your]0-i tone by to - morrow ! "[480-her husband] - paused - and then , without finishing the sentence , moved away abruptly , and supported [[his]480-her husband wife]997-his wife to the door .

Just when [her]2237-her face was turned towards where [I]0-i stood , as [he]480-her husband took [her]2237-her out , [I]0-i thought [I]0-i saw the cold , vacant eyes soften as they rested on [me]0-i , and change again tenderly to the old look of patience and sadness which [I]0-i remembered so well . Was [my]0-i imagination misleading [me]0-i ? or had the light of that meek spirit shone out on [earth]1969-earth , for the last time at parting , in token of farewell to [mine]0-i ? [She]2237-her was gone to [me]0-i , gone for ever - before [I]0-i could look nearer , and know .

[I]0-i was told , afterwards , how [she]2237-her died .

For the rest of that day , and throughout the night , [she]2237-her lay speechless , but still alive . The next morning , the faint pulse still fluttered . As the day wore on , [the doctors]1997-the doctors applied fresh stimulants , and watched [her]2237-her in astonishment ; for [they]1997-the doctors had predicted [her]2237-her death as impending every moment , at least twelve hours before . When [they]1997-the doctors spoke of this to [[her]2237-her husband]480-her husband , [his]480-her husband behaviour was noticed as very altered and unaccountable by [every one]1283-every one . [He]480-her husband sulkily refused to believe that [her]2237-her life was in danger ; [he]480-her husband roughly accused anybody who spoke of [her]2237-her death , as wanting to fix on [him]480-her husband the imputation of having ill - used [her]2237-her , and so being the cause of [her]2237-her illness ; and more than this , [he]480-her husband angrily vindicated [himself]480-her husband to every one about [her]2237-her - even to [the servants]745-the servants - by quoting the indulgence [he]480-her husband had shown to [her]2237-her fancy for seeing [me]0-i when [I]0-i called , and [his]480-her husband patience while [she]2237-her was as [he]480-her husband termed it wandering in [her]2237-her mind in trying to talk to [me]0-i . [The doctors]1997-the doctors , suspecting how [his]480-her husband uneasy conscience was accusing [him]480-her husband , forbore in disgust all expostulation . Except when [he]480-her husband was in [[[his]480-her husband daughter]233-his daughter 's room]2247-his daughter 's room , [he]480-her husband was shunned by [everybody in [the house]244-the house]2248-everybody in the house .

Just before noon , on the second day , [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin rallied a little under the stimulants administered to [her]43-mrs. sherwin , and asked to see [[her]43-mrs. sherwin husband]480-her husband alone . Both [her]43-mrs. sherwin words and manner gave the lie to [his]480-her husband assertion that [her]43-mrs. sherwin faculties were impaired - it was observed by all [[her]43-mrs. sherwin attendants]2251-her attendants , that whenever [she]43-mrs. sherwin had strength to speak , [her]43-mrs. sherwin speech never wandered in the slightest degree . [[Her]43-mrs. sherwin husband]480-her husband quitted [[her]43-mrs. sherwin room]1432-her room more fretfully uneasy , more sullenly suspicious of the words and looks of those about [him]480-her husband than ever - went instantly to seek [[his]480-her husband daughter]233-his daughter - and sent [her]233-his daughter in alone to [[her]233-his daughter mother]319-her mother 's bedside . In a few minutes , [she]233-his daughter hurriedly came out again , pale , and violently agitated ; and was heard to say , that [she]233-his daughter had been spoken to so unnaturally , and so shockingly , that [she]233-his daughter could not , and would not , enter [that room]3524-that room again until [[her]233-his daughter mother]319-her mother was better . Better ! [the father]2258-the father and [daughter]2259-daughter were both agreed in that ; [both]1955-both agreed that [she]233-his daughter was not dying , but only out of [her]233-his daughter mind .

During the afternoon , [the doctors]1997-the doctors ordered that [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin should not be allowed to see [[her]43-mrs. sherwin husband]480-her husband or [[her]43-mrs. sherwin child]2263-her child again , without [their]1997-the doctors permission . There was little need of taking such a precaution to preserve the tranquillity of [her]233-his daughter last moments . As the day began to decline , [she]233-his daughter sank again into insensibility : [her]233-his daughter life was just not death , and that was all . [She]233-his daughter lingered on in this quiet way , with [her]233-his daughter eyes peacefully closed , and [her]233-his daughter breathing so gentle as to be quite inaudible , until late in the evening . Just as it grew quite dark , and the candle was lit in [the sick room]2264-the sick room , [the servant who was helping to watch by [her]233-his daughter]2265-the servant who was helping to watch by her , drew aside the curtain to look at [[her]2265-the servant who was helping to watch by her mistress]2266-her mistress ; and saw that , though [her]233-his daughter eyes were still closed , [she]233-his daughter was smiling . [The girl]687-the girl turned round , and beckoned to [the nurse]3820-the nurse to come to the bedside . When [they]3820-the nurse lifted the curtains again to look at [her]233-his daughter , [she]233-his daughter was dead .

Let [me]0-i return to the day of [my]0-i last visit to [North Villa]11-north villa . More remains to be recorded , before [my]0-i narrative can advance to the morrow .

After the door had closed , and [I]0-i knew that [I]0-i had looked [my]0-i last on [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin in [this world]195-this world , [I]0-i remained a few minutes alone in [the room]263-the room , until [I]0-i had steadied [my]0-i mind sufficiently to go out again into [the streets]241-the streets . As [I]0-i walked down [the garden - path]2272-the garden - path to the gate , [the servant whom [I]0-i had seen on [my]0-i entrance]2273-the servant whom i had seen on my entrance , ran after [me]0-i , and eagerly entreated that [I]0-i would wait one moment and speak to [her]43-mrs. sherwin .

When [I]0-i stopped and looked at [the girl]687-the girl , [she]687-the girl burst into tears . " [I]687-the girl 'm afraid [I]687-the girl 've been doing wrong , [Sir]3046-sir , "[687-the girl] [she]687-the girl sobbed out , " and at this dreadful time too , when [[my]687-the girl poor mistress]3845-my poor mistress is dying ! [I]0-i gave [her]687-the girl a little time to compose [herself]687-the girl ; and then asked what [she]687-the girl had to say .

" [I]687-the girl think [you]3046-sir must have seen [a man]3101-a man leaving a letter with [me]687-the girl , [Sir]3046-sir , "[687-the girl] [she]687-the girl continued , " just when [you]3046-sir came up to the door , a little while ago ? "[687-the girl]

" Yes : [I]0-i saw [him]3101-a man . "[0-i]

" It was for [Miss Margaret]44-margaret , [Sir]3046-sir , that letter ; and [I]687-the girl was to keep it secret ; and - and - it is n't the first [I]687-the girl 've taken in for [her]44-margaret . " Why , [Susan]64-susan ? - tell [me]0-i candidly why ? "[0-i]

" [I]687-the girl hope [you]3046-sir wo n't take it amiss , [Sir]3046-sir , if [I]687-the girl say that having lived in [the family]179-the family so long as [I]687-the girl have , [I]687-the girl ca n't help knowing a little about what [you]3046-sir and [Miss Margaret]44-margaret used to be to [each other]102-each other , and that something 's happened wrong between [you]3046-sir lately ; and so , [Sir]3046-sir , it seems to be very bad and dishonest in [me]687-the girl after first helping [you]3046-sir to come together , as [I]687-the girl did , to be giving [her]44-margaret strange letters , unknown to [you]3046-sir . " Go on , [Susan]64-susan - speak as freely and as truly to [me]0-i as ever . "[0-i]

" Well , [Sir]3046-sir , [Miss Margaret]44-margaret 's been very much altered , ever since that night when [she]44-margaret came [home]176-home alone , and frightened [us]3861-us so . "[687-the girl]

[She]2275-she held out a letter . [I]0-i hesitated before [I]0-i looked at it .

" Oh , [Sir]3046-sir ! please , please do take it ! "[687-the girl] said [the girl]687-the girl earnestly . " [I]687-the girl did wrong , [I]687-the girl 'm afraid , in giving [her]44-margaret the first ; but [I]687-the girl ca n't do wrong again , when [[my]687-the girl poor mistress]3845-my poor mistress is dying in [the house]244-the house . "[687-the girl]

Weeping bitterly as [she]2277-she said this , [the kind - hearted girl]2278-the kind - hearted girl held out the letter to [me]0-i once more . This time [I]0-i took it from [her]2277-she , and looked at the address .

Though [I]0-i did not know the handwriting , still there was something in those unsteady characters which seemed familiar to [me]0-i . Was it possible that [I]0-i had ever seen them before ? [I]0-i tried to consider ; but [my]0-i memory was confused , [my]0-i mind wearied out , after all that had happened since the morning . The effort was fruitless : [I]0-i gave back the letter .

" [I]2279-i know as little about it , [Susan]64-susan , as [you]64-susan do . "[2279-i]

" But ought [I]2279-i to take it up - [stairs]1197-stairs , [Sir]3046-sir ? only tell [me]2279-i that ! "[2279-i]

" It is not for [me]2279-i to say . All interest or share on [my]2279-i part , [Susan]64-susan , in what [she]2277-she - in what [[your]64-susan young mistress]3880-your young mistress receives , is at an end . "[2279-i]

" [I]2279-i 'm very sorry to hear [you]64-susan say that , [Sir]3046-sir ; very , very sorry . But what would [you]64-susan advise [me]2279-i to do ? "[2279-i]

" Let [me]2279-i look at the letter once more . "[2279-i]

On a second view , the handwriting produced the same effect on [me]0-i as before , ending too with just the same result . [I]0-i returned the letter again .

" [I]2279-i respect [your]64-susan scruples , [Susan]64-susan , but [I]2279-i am not [the person to remove or to justify them]3882-the person to remove or to justify them . Why should [you]64-susan not apply in this difficulty to [[your]64-susan master]3045-your master ? "[2279-i]

" [I]2279-i dare not , [Sir]3046-sir ; [I]2279-i dare not for [my]2279-i life . [He]3045-your master 's been worse than ever , lately ; if [I]2279-i said as much to [him]3045-your master as [I]2279-i 've said to [you]3046-sir , [I]2279-i believe [he]3045-your master 'd kill [me]2279-i ! "[2279-i] [She]2279-i hesitated , then continued more composedly ; " Well , at any rate [I]2279-i 've told [you]3046-sir , [Sir]3046-sir , and that 's made [my]2279-i mind easier ; and - and [I]2279-i 'll give [her]2279-i the letter this once , and then take in no more - if [they]3886-they come , unless [I]2279-i hear a proper account of [them]3886-they . "[2279-i]

[She]2279-i curtseyed ; and , bidding [me]0-i farewell very sadly and anxiously , returned to [the house]244-the house with the letter in [her]2279-i hand . If [I]0-i had guessed at that moment who it was written by ! If [I]0-i could only have suspected what were its contents !

[I]0-i left [Hollyoake Square]12-hollyoake square in a direction which led to [some fields a little distance on]2281-some fields a little distance on . It was very strange ; but that unknown handwriting still occupied [my]0-i thoughts : that wretched trifle absolutely took possession of [my]0-i mind , at such a time as this ; in such a position as mine was now .

[I]0-i stopped wearily in [the fields]2282-the fields at a lonely spot , away from [the footpath]2283-the footpath . [My]0-i eyes ached at the sunlight , and [I]0-i shaded them with [my]0-i hand . Exactly at the same instant , the lost recollection flashed back on [me]0-i so vividly that [I]0-i started almost in terror . The handwriting shown [me]0-i by [the servant at [North Villa]11-north villa]2284-the servant at north villa , was the same as the handwriting on that unopened and forgotten letter in [my]0-i pocket , which [I]0-i had received from [the servant]315-the servant at [home]176-home - received in the morning , as [I]0-i crossed [the hall]1423-the hall to enter [[[my]0-i father]147-my father 's room]2093-my father 's room .

[I]0-i took out the letter , opened it with trembling fingers , and looked through the cramped , closely - written pages for the signature .

It was " [ROBERT MANNION]73-mannion . "[74-v. mannion]

[V.

Mannion]74-v. mannion ! [I]0-i had never suspected that the note shown to [me]0-i at [North Villa]11-north villa might have come from [him]2290-his . And yet , the secrecy with which it had been delivered ; [the person to whom it was addressed]2291-the person to whom it was addressed ; the mystery connected with it even in [the servant]315-the servant 's eyes , all pointed to the discovery which [I]0-i had so incomprehensibly failed to make . [I]0-i had suffered a letter , which might contain written proof of [her]2293-her guilt , to be taken , from under [my]0-i own eyes , to [Margaret Sherwin]44-margaret ! How had [my]0-i perceptions become thus strangely blinded ? The confusion of [my]0-i memory , the listless incapacity of all [my]0-i faculties , answered the question but too readily , of [themselves]2294-themselves .

" [Robert Mannion]73-mannion ! "[0-i] [I]0-i could not take [my]0-i eyes from that name : [I]0-i still held before [me]0-i the crowded , closely - written lines of [his]2290-his writing , and delayed to read them . Something of the horror which the presence of [the man himself]2295-the man himself would have inspired in [me]0-i , was produced by the mere sight of [his]2290-his letter , and that letter addressed to [me]0-i . The vengeance which [my]0-i own hands had wreaked on [him]2290-his , [he]2290-his was , of [all men the surest to repay]2296-all men the surest to repay . Perhaps , in these lines , the dark future through which [his]2290-his way and mine might lie , would be already shadowed forth . [Margaret]44-margaret too ! Could [he]2290-his write so much , and not write of [her]44-margaret ? not disclose the mystery in which the motives of [her]44-margaret crime were still hidden ? [I]0-i turned back again to the first page , and resolved to read the letter . It began abruptly , in the following terms : -

" [[St. Helen]75-st. helen 's Hospital]3887-st. helen 's hospital .[0-i]

" [You]3888-you may look at the signature when [you]3888-you receive this , and may be tempted to tear up [my]0-i letter , and throw it from [you]3888-you unread . [I]0-i warn [you]3888-you to read what [I]0-i have written , and to estimate , if [you]3888-you can , its importance to [yourself]3888-you . Destroy these pages afterwards if [you]3888-you like - they will have served [their]3889-their purpose .[0-i]

" Do [you]3888-you know where [I]0-i am , and what [I]0-i suffer ? [I]0-i am [one of [the patients of [this hospital]3892-this hospital]3891-the patients of this hospital , hideously mutilated for life by [your]3888-you hand]3890-one of the patients of this hospital , hideously mutilated for life by your hand . If [I]0-i could have known certainly the day of [my]0-i dismissal , [I]0-i should have waited to tell [you]3888-you with [my]0-i own lips what [I]0-i now write - but [I]0-i am ignorant of this . At the very point of recovery [I]0-i have suffered a relapse .[0-i]

" [You]3888-you will silence any uneasy upbraidings of conscience , should [you]3888-you feel them , by saying that [I]0-i have deserved death at [your]3888-you hands . [I]0-i will tell [you]3888-you , in answer , what [you]3888-you deserve and shall receive at [mine]0-i .[0-i]

" But [I]0-i will first assume that it was knowledge of [[your]3888-you wife]3287-your wife 's guilt which prompted [your]3888-you attack on [me]0-i . [I]0-i am well aware that [she]3287-your wife has declared [herself]3287-your wife innocent , and that [[her]3287-your wife father]1224-her father supports [her]3287-your wife declaration . By the time [you]3888-you receive this letter [my]0-i injuries oblige [me]0-i to allow [myself]0-i a whole fortnight to write it in , [I]0-i shall have taken measures which render further concealment unnecessary . Therefore , if [my]0-i confession avail [you]3888-you aught , [you]3888-you have it here : - [She]3287-your wife is guilty : willingly guilty , remember , whatever [she]3287-your wife may say to the contrary . [You]3888-you may believe this , and believe all [I]0-i write hereafter . Deception between [us]3895-us two is at an end .[0-i]

" [I]0-i have told [you]3888-you [Margaret Sherwin]44-margaret is guilty . Why was [she]44-margaret guilty ? What was the secret of [my]0-i influence over [her]44-margaret ?[0-i]

" To make [you]3888-you comprehend what [I]0-i have now to communicate , it is necessary for [me]0-i to speak of [myself]0-i ; and of [my]0-i early life . To - morrow , [I]0-i will undertake this disclosure - to - day , [I]0-i can neither hold the pen , nor see the paper any longer . If [you]3888-you could look at [my]0-i face , where [I]0-i am now laid , [you]3888-you would know why ! "[0-i]

" When [we]3895-us met for the first time at [North Villa]11-north villa , [I]0-i had not been five minutes in [your]3888-you presence before [I]0-i detected [your]3888-you curiosity to know something about [me]0-i , and perceived that [you]3888-you doubted , from the first , whether [I]0-i was born and bred for such a situation as [I]0-i held under [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin . On that night , [I]0-i determined to baulk [your]3888-you curiosity , and yet to gain [your]3888-you confidence ; and [I]0-i succeeded . [You]3888-you little thought , when [you]3888-you bade [me]0-i farewell at [my]0-i own door , that [you]3888-you had given [your]3888-you hand and [your]3888-you friendship to [a man , who - long before [you]3888-you met with [Margaret Sherwin]44-margaret]3900-a man , who - long before you met with margaret sherwin - had inherited the right to be the enemy of [[your]3888-you father]302-your father , and of every descendant of [[[your]3888-you father]302-your father 's house]3903-your father 's house .[0-i]

" Does this declaration surprise [you]3888-you ? Read on , and [you]3888-you will understand it .[0-i]

" [I]0-i am [the son of [a gentleman]3111-a gentleman]3904-the son of a gentleman . [[My]0-i father]147-my father 's means were miserably limited , and [[his]147-my father family]218-his family was not an old family , like [yours]3888-you . Nevertheless , [he]147-my father was [a gentleman]3111-a gentleman in [anybody]723-anybody 's sense of the word ; [he]147-my father knew it , and that knowledge was [his]147-my father ruin . [He]147-my father was [a weak , kind , careless man]3910-a weak , kind , careless man ; [a worshipper of conventionalities]3911-a worshipper of conventionalities ; and [a great respecter of the wide gaps which lay between social stations in [his]147-my father time]3912-a great respecter of the wide gaps which lay between social stations in his time . Thus , [he]147-my father determined to live like [a gentleman]3111-a gentleman , by following [a gentleman]3111-a gentleman 's pursuit - a profession , as distinguished from a trade . Failing in this , [he]147-my father failed to follow out [his]147-my father principle , and starve like [a gentleman]3111-a gentleman . [He]147-my father died the death of [a felon]3916-a felon ; leaving [me]0-i no inheritance but the name of [[a felon]3916-a felon 's son]3918-a felon 's son .[0-i]

" While still [a young man]293-a young man , [he]147-my father contrived to be introduced to [a gentleman of great family , great position , and great wealth]3920-a gentleman of great family , great position , and great wealth . [He]147-my father interested , or fancied [he]147-my father interested , [this gentleman]3237-this gentleman ; and always looked on [him]3237-this gentleman as [the patron who was to make [his]147-my father fortune]3922-the patron who was to make his fortune , by getting [him]147-my father the first government sinecure they were plenty enough in those days ! which might fall vacant . In firm and foolish expectation of this , [he]147-my father lived far beyond [his]147-my father little professional income - lived among [rich people]3923-rich people without the courage to make use of [them]3923-rich people as [a poor man]3924-a poor man . It was the old story : debts and liabilities of all kinds pressed heavy on [him]147-my father - [creditors]3925-creditors refused to wait - exposure and utter ruin threatened [him]147-my father - and the prospect of the sinecure was still as far off as ever .[0-i]

" Nevertheless [he]147-my father believed in the advent of [this office]3926-this office ; and all the more resolutely now , because [he]147-my father looked to it as [his]147-my father salvation . [He]147-my father was quite confident of the interest of [[his]147-my father patron]3927-his patron , and of its speedy exertion in [his]147-my father behalf . Perhaps , [that gentleman]3928-that gentleman had overrated [his]147-my father own political influence ; perhaps , [[my]0-i father]147-my father had been too sanguine , and had misinterpreted polite general promises into special engagements . However it was , [the bailiffs]3930-the bailiffs came into [[his]147-my father house]216-his house one morning , while help from a government situation , or any situation , was as unattainable as ever - came to take [him]147-my father to [prison]3932-prison : to seize everything , in execution , even to the very bed on which [[my]0-i mother]148-my mother then seriously ill was lying . The whole fabric of false prosperity which [he]147-my father had been building up to make [the world]158-the world respect [him]147-my father , was menaced with instant and shameful overthrow . [He]147-my father had not the courage to let it go ; so [he]147-my father took refuge from misfortune in a crime .[0-i]

" [He]147-my father forged a bond , to prop up [his]147-my father credit for a little time longer . The name [he]147-my father made use of was the name of [[his]147-my father patron]3927-his patron . In doing this , [he]147-my father believed - as [all men who commit crime]3936-all men who commit crime believe - that [he]147-my father had the best possible chance of escaping consequences . In the first place , [he]147-my father might get the long - expected situation in time to repay the amount of the bond before detection . In the second place , [he]147-my father had almost the certainty of a legacy from [a rich relative , old and in ill - health , whose death might be fairly expected from day to day]3937-a rich relative , old and in ill - health , whose death might be fairly expected from day to day . If both these prospects failed and they did fail , there was still a third chance - the chance that [[his]147-my father rich patron]3938-his rich patron would rather pay the money than appear against [him]147-my father . In those days [they]3938-his rich patron hung for forgery . [[My]0-i father]147-my father believed it to be impossible that [a man at whose table [he]147-my father had sat , whose relatives and [friends]440-friends [he]147-my father had amused and instructed by [his]147-my father talents]3940-a man at whose table he had sat , whose relatives and friends he had amused and instructed by his talents , would be [the man to give evidence which should condemn [him]147-my father to be hanged on [the public scaffold]3943-the public scaffold]3942-the man to give evidence which should condemn him to be hanged on the public scaffold .[0-i]

" [He]147-my father was wrong . [The wealthy patron]3944-the wealthy patron held strict principles of honour which made no allowance for temptations and weaknesses ; and was moreover influenced by high - flown notions of [his]147-my father responsibilities as [a legislator]3945-a legislator [he]147-my father was [a member of Parliament to the laws of [[his]147-my father country]3947-his country]3946-a member of parliament to the laws of his country . [He]147-my father appeared accordingly , and gave evidence against [the prisoner]3948-the prisoner ; who was found guilty , and left for execution .[0-i]

" Then , when it was too late , [this man of pitiless honour]3949-this man of pitiless honour thought [himself]3949-this man of pitiless honour at last justified in leaning to the side of mercy , and employed [his]3949-this man of pitiless honour utmost interest , in every direction , to obtain a mitigation of the sentence to transportation for life . The application failed ; even a reprieve of a few days was denied . At the appointed time , [[my]0-i father]147-my father died on the scaffold by [the hangman]3951-the hangman 's hand .[0-i]

" Have [you]3952-you suspected , while reading this part of [my]0-i letter , who [the high - born gentleman]3953-the high - born gentleman was whose evidence hung [him]147-my father ? [You]3952-you will now wonder no longer how [I]0-i could have inherited the right to be [[his]147-my father enemy]3956-his enemy , and [the enemy of all who are of [his]147-my father blood]3957-the enemy of all who are of his blood .[0-i]

" The shock of [[her]3958-her husband]480-her husband 's horrible death deprived [[my]0-i mother]148-my mother of reason . [She]148-my mother lived a few months after [his]147-my father execution ; but never recovered [her]148-my mother faculties . [I]0-i was [[their]3961-their only child]3962-their only child ; and was left penniless to begin life as [the son of [a father who had been hanged]3964-a father who had been hanged , and of a mother who had died in [a public madhouse]3965-a public madhouse]3963-the son of a father who had been hanged , and of a mother who had died in a public madhouse .[0-i]

" More of [myself]0-i to - morrow - [my]0-i letter will be a long one : [I]0-i must pause often over it , as [I]0-i pause to - day . "[0-i]

" Well : [I]0-i started in life with [the hangman]3951-the hangman 's mark on [me]0-i - with [the parent]3967-the parent 's shame for [the son]3968-the son 's reputation . Wherever [I]0-i went , whatever [friends]440-friends [I]0-i kept , whatever acquaintances [I]0-i made - [people]106-people knew how [[my]0-i father]147-my father had died : and showed that [they]106-people knew it . Not so much by shunning or staring at [me]0-i vile as human nature is , there were not many who did that , as by insulting [me]0-i with over - acted sympathy , and elaborate anxiety to sham entire ignorance of [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's fate . The gallows - brand was on [my]0-i forehead ; but [they]106-people were too benevolently blind to see it . The gallows - infamy was [my]0-i inheritance ; but [they]106-people were too resolutely generous to discover it ! This was hard to bear . However , [I]0-i was strong - hearted even then , when [my]0-i sensations were quick , and [my]0-i sympathies young : so [I]0-i bore it .[0-i]

" [My]0-i only weakness was [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's weakness - the notion that [I]0-i was born to a station ready made for [me]0-i , and that the great use of [my]0-i life was to live up to it . [[My]0-i station]3974-my station ! [I]0-i battled for that with [the world]158-the world for years and years , before [I]0-i discovered that the highest of [all stations]3976-all stations is [the station [a man]3101-a man makes for [himself]3101-a man]3977-the station a man makes for himself : and the lowest , [the station that is made for [him]3101-a man by [others]98-others]3979-the station that is made for him by others .[0-i]

" At starting in life , [[your]0-i father]302-your father wrote to make [me]0-i offers of assistance - assistance , after [he]302-your father had ruined [me]0-i ! Assistance to [the child]1296-the child , from hands which had tied the rope round [the parent]3967-the parent 's neck ! [I]0-i sent [him]302-your father back [his]302-your father letter . [He]302-your father knew that [I]0-i was [[his]302-your father enemy]3956-his enemy , [[[his]302-your father son]412-his son 's enemy]3986-his son 's enemy , and [[[his]302-your father son]412-his son 's son 's enemy]3988-his son 's son 's enemy , as long as [I]0-i lived . [I]0-i never heard from [him]302-your father again .[0-i]

" Trusting boldly to [myself]0-i to carve out [my]0-i own way , and to live down [my]0-i undeserved ignominy ; resolving in the pride of [my]0-i integrity to combat openly and fairly with misfortune , [I]0-i shrank , at first , from disowning [my]0-i parentage and abandoning [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's name . Standing on [my]0-i own character , confiding in [my]0-i intellect and [my]0-i perseverance , [I]0-i tried pursuit after pursuit , and was beaten afresh at every new effort . Whichever way [I]0-i turned , the gallows still rose as the same immovable obstacle between [me]0-i and fortune , between [me]0-i and station , between [me]0-i and [[my]0-i fellowmen]3990-my fellowmen . [I]0-i was morbidly sensitive on this point . The slightest references to [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's fate , however remote or accidental , curdled [my]0-i blood . [I]0-i saw open insult , or humiliating compassion , or forced forbearance , in the look and manner of [every man about [me]0-i]3992-every man about me . So [I]0-i broke off with [old friends]3993-old friends , and tried new ; and , in seeking fresh pursuits , sought fresh connections , where [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's infamy might be unknown . Wherever [I]0-i went , the old stain always broke out afresh , just at the moment when [I]0-i had deceived [myself]0-i into the belief that it was utterly effaced . [I]0-i had a warm heart then - it was some time before it turned to stone , and felt nothing . Those were the days when failure and humiliation could still draw tears from [me]0-i : that epoch in [my]0-i life is marked in [my]0-i memory as the epoch when [I]0-i could weep .[0-i]

" At last , [I]0-i gave way before difficulty , and conceded the first step to the calamity which had stood front to front with [me]0-i so long . [I]0-i left [the neighbourhood where [I]0-i was known]3995-the neighbourhood where i was known , and assumed the name of [a schoolfellow who had died]3996-a schoolfellow who had died . For some time this succeeded ; but the curse of [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's death followed [me]0-i , though [I]0-i saw it not . After various employments - still , mind , the employments of [a gentleman]3111-a gentleman ! - had first supported , then failed [me]0-i , [I]0-i became [an usher at [a school]3197-a school]3999-an usher at a school . It was there that [my]0-i false name was detected , and [my]0-i identity discovered again - [I]0-i never knew through whom . The exposure was effected by [some enemy]4001-some enemy , anonymously . For several days , [I]0-i thought [everybody in [the school]4003-the school]4002-everybody in the school treated [me]0-i in an altered way . The cause came out , first in whispers , then in reckless jests , while [I]0-i was taking care of [the boys in [the playground]4005-the playground]4004-the boys in the playground . In the fury of the moment [I]0-i struck one of the most insolent , and [the eldest of [them]4004-the boys in the playground]4006-the eldest of them , and hurt [him]4007-him rather seriously . [The parents]4008-the parents heard of it , and threatened [me]0-i with prosecution ; [the whole neighbourhood]4009-the whole neighbourhood was aroused . [I]0-i had to leave [my]0-i situation secretly , by night , or [the mob]4010-the mob would have pelted [[the felon]4011-the felon 's son]4012-the felon 's son out of [the parish]3814-the parish .[0-i]

" [I]0-i went back to [London]10-london , bearing another assumed name ; and tried , as a last resource to save [me]0-i from starvation , the resource of writing . [I]0-i served [my]0-i apprenticeship to literature as [a hack - author of the lowest degree]4014-a hack - author of the lowest degree . Knowing [I]0-i had talents which might be turned to account , [I]0-i tried to vindicate [them]4004-the boys in the playground by writing an original work . But [my]0-i experience of [the world]158-the world had made [me]0-i unfit to dress [my]0-i thoughts in popular costume : [I]0-i could only tell bitter truths bitterly ; [I]0-i exposed licenced hypocrisies too openly ; [I]0-i saw the vicious side of many respectabilities , and said [I]0-i saw it - in short , [I]0-i called things by [their]4016-their right names ; and [no publisher]4017-no publisher would treat with [me]0-i . So [I]0-i stuck to [my]0-i low task - work ; [my]0-i penny - a lining in third - class newspapers ; [my]0-i translating from [Frenchmen]4018-frenchmen and [Germans]4019-germans , and plagiarising from [dead authors]4020-dead authors , to supply the raw material for bookmongering by [more accomplished bookmongers]4021-more accomplished bookmongers than [I.]0-i In this life , there was one advantage which compensated for much misery and meanness , and bitter , biting disappointment : [I]0-i could keep [my]0-i identity securely concealed . Character was of no consequence to [me]0-i ; [nobody]120-nobody cared to know who [I]0-i was , or to inquire what [I]0-i had been - the gallows - mark was smoothed out at last ![0-i]

" While [I]0-i was living thus on the offal of literature , [I]0-i met with [a woman of good birth , and fair fortune]4023-a woman of good birth , and fair fortune , whose sympathies or whose curiosity [I]0-i happened to interest . " The very day of the marriage was fixed . [I]0-i believed [I]0-i had successfully parried all perilous inquiries - but [I]0-i was wrong .
