" With this event , [my]0-i long strife and struggle with [the world]158-the world ended .[0-i]

" [My]0-i eyes opened to a new view of life , and the purpose of life . [My]0-i first aspirations to live up to [my]0-i birth - right position , in spite of adversity and dishonour , to make [my]0-i name sweet enough in [men]518-men 's nostrils , to cleanse away the infamy on [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's , were now no more . The ambition which - whether [I]0-i was [a hack - author]4051-a hack - author , [a travelling portrait - painter]4052-a travelling portrait - painter , or [an usher at [a school]3197-a school]3999-an usher at a school - had once whispered to [me]0-i : low down as [you]4055-you are in dark , miry ways , [you]4055-you are on the path which leads upward to high places in [the sunshine]4056-the sunshine afar - off ; [you]4055-you are not working to scrape together wealth for [another man]118-another man ; [you]4055-you are independent , self - reliant , labouring in [your]4055-you own cause - the daring ambition which had once counselled thus , sank dead within [me]0-i at last . [The strong , stern spirit]4058-the strong , stern spirit was beaten by spirits stronger and sterner yet - Infamy and Want .[0-i]

" [I]0-i wrote to [a man of character and wealth]4059-a man of character and wealth ; one of [[my]0-i friends of early days , who had ceased to hold communication with [me]0-i , like [other friends]4061-other friends]4060-my friends of early days , who had ceased to hold communication with me , like other friends , but , unlike [them]4061-other friends , had given [me]0-i up in genuine sorrow : [I]0-i wrote , and asked [him]4059-a man of character and wealth to meet [me]0-i privately by night . [I]0-i was too ragged to go to [[his]4059-a man of character and wealth house]216-his house , too sensitive still even if [I]0-i had gone and had been admitted to risk encountering [people there]4063-people there , who either knew [[my]0-i father]147-my father , or knew how [he]147-my father had died . [I]0-i wished to speak to [[my]0-i former friend]4065-my former friend , unseen , and made the appointment accordingly . [He]4059-a man of character and wealth kept it .[0-i]

" When [we]4066-we met , [I]0-i said to [him]4059-a man of character and wealth : - [I]0-i have a last favour to ask of [you]4059-a man of character and wealth . When [we]4066-we parted years ago , [I]0-i had high hopes and brave resolutions - both are worn out . [I]0-i then believed that [I]0-i could not only rise superior to [my]0-i misfortune , but could make that very misfortune the motive of [my]0-i rise . [You]4067-you told [me]0-i [I]0-i was too quick of temper , too morbidly sensitive about the slightest reference to [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's death , too fierce and changeable under undeserved trial and disappointment . This might have been true then ; but [I]0-i am altered now : pride and ambition have been persecuted and starved out of [me]0-i . An obscure , monotonous life , in which thought and spirit may be laid asleep , never to wake again , is the only life [I]0-i care for . Help [me]0-i to lead it . [I]0-i ask [you]4067-you , first , as [a beggar]3785-a beggar , to give [me]0-i from [your]4067-you superfluity , apparel decent enough to bear the daylight . [I]0-i ask [you]4067-you next , to help [me]0-i to some occupation which will just give [me]0-i [my]0-i bread , [my]0-i shelter , and [my]0-i hour or two of solitude in the evening . [You]4067-you have plenty of influence to do this , and [you]4067-you know [I]0-i am honest . [You]4067-you can not choose [me]0-i too humble and obscure an employment ; let [me]0-i descend low enough to be lost to sight beneath [the world [I]0-i have lived in]4070-the world i have lived in ; let [me]0-i go among [people who want to know that [I]0-i work honestly for [them]4071-people who want to know that i work honestly for them]4071-people who want to know that i work honestly for them , and want to know nothing more . Get [me]0-i a mean hiding - place to conceal [myself]0-i and [my]0-i history in for ever , and then neither attempt to see [me]0-i nor communicate with [me]0-i again . If [former friends]4072-former friends chance to ask after [me]0-i , tell [them]4072-former friends [I]0-i am dead , or gone into [another country]4073-another country . The wisest life is the life the animals lead : [I]0-i want , like [them]4072-former friends , to serve [[my]0-i master]3047-my master for food , shelter , and liberty to lie asleep now and then in the sunshine , without being driven away as [a pest]4075-a pest or [a trespasser]4076-a trespasser . Do [you]4077-you believe in this resolution ? - it is [my]0-i last .[0-i]

" [He]3047-my master did believe in it ; and [he]3047-my master granted what [I]0-i asked . Through [his]3047-my master interference and recommendation , [I]0-i entered the service of [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin . -[0-i]

" [I]0-i must stop [here]3265-here for to - day . To - morrow [I]0-i shall come to disclosures of vital interest to [you]4077-you . Have [you]4077-you been surprised that [I]0-i , [[your]4077-you enemy]4079-your enemy by every cause of enmity that [one man]1777-one man can have against another , should write to [you]4077-you so fully about the secrets of [my]0-i early life ? [I]0-i have done so , because [I]0-i wish the strife between [us]4081-us to be an open strife on [my]0-i side ; because [I]0-i desire that [you]4077-you should know thoroughly what [you]4077-you have to expect from [my]0-i character , after such a life as [I]0-i have led . There was purpose in [my]0-i deceit , when [I]0-i deceived [you]4077-you - there is purpose in [my]0-i frankness , when [I]0-i now tell [you]4077-you all . "[0-i]

" [I]0-i began in [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin 's employment , as [the lowest clerk in [[his]42-mr. sherwin office]4083-his office]4082-the lowest clerk in his office . Both [the master]1387-the master and [the men]4085-the men looked a little suspiciously on [me]0-i , at first . [My]0-i account of [myself]0-i was always the same - simple and credible ; [I]0-i had entered [the counting - house]4086-the counting - house with the best possible recommendation , and [I]0-i acted up to it . These circumstances in [my]0-i favour , joined to a manner that never varied , and to a steadiness at [my]0-i work that never relaxed , soon produced [their]4085-the men effect - all curiosity about [me]0-i gradually died away : [I]0-i was left to pursue [my]0-i avocations in peace . [The friend who had got [me]0-i [my]0-i situation]4087-the friend who had got me my situation , preserved [my]0-i secret as [I]0-i had desired [him]4087-the friend who had got me my situation ; of all [the people whom [I]0-i had formerly known]4088-the people whom i had formerly known , [pitiless enemies and lukewarm adherents]4089-pitiless enemies and lukewarm adherents , [not one]4090-not one ever suspected that [[my]0-i hiding - place]4091-my hiding - place was [the back office of [a linen - draper 's shop]784-a linen - draper 's shop]4092-the back office of a linen - draper 's shop . For the first time in [my]0-i life , [I]0-i felt that the secret of [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's misfortune was [mine]0-i , and mine only ; that [my]0-i security from exposure was at length complete .[0-i]

" Before long , [I]0-i rose to [the chief place in [the counting - house]4086-the counting - house]4095-the chief place in the counting - house . It was no very difficult matter for [me]0-i to discover , that [[my]0-i new master]4097-my new master 's character had other elements besides that of the highest respectability . In plain terms , [I]0-i found [him]4097-my new master to be [a pretty equal compound by nature]4098-a pretty equal compound by nature , of [the fool]4099-the fool , [the tyrant]4100-the tyrant , and [the coward]4101-the coward . There was only one direction in which what grovelling sympathies [he]4097-my new master had , could be touched to some purpose . Save [him]4097-my new master waste , or get [him]4097-my new master profit ; and [he]4097-my new master was really grateful . [I]0-i succeeded in working both these marvels . [[His]4097-my new master managing man]4102-his managing man cheated [him]4097-my new master ; [I]0-i found it out ; refused to be bribed to collusion ; and exposed the fraud to [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin . This got [me]0-i [his]42-mr. sherwin confidence , and the place of [chief clerk]4103-chief clerk . In that position , [I]0-i discovered a means , which had never occurred to [[my]0-i employer]3352-my employer , of greatly enlarging [his]42-mr. sherwin business and its profits , with the least possible risk . [He]42-mr. sherwin tried [my]0-i plan , and it succeeded . This gained [me]0-i [his]42-mr. sherwin warmest admiration , an increase of salary , and a firm footing in [[his]42-mr. sherwin family circle]4105-his family circle . [My]0-i projects were more than fulfilled : [I]0-i had money enough , and leisure enough ; and spent [my]0-i obscure existence exactly as [I]0-i had proposed .[0-i]

" But [my]0-i life was still not destined to be altogether devoid of an animating purpose . When [I]0-i first knew [Margaret Sherwin]44-margaret , [she]44-margaret was just changing from childhood to girlhood . [I]0-i marked the promise of future beauty in [her]44-margaret face and figure ; and secretly formed the resolution which [you]4106-you afterwards came forward to thwart , but which [I]0-i have executed , and will execute , in spite of [you]4106-you .[0-i]

" The thoughts out of which that resolution sprang , counselled [me]0-i more calmly than [you]4106-you can suppose . [I]0-i said within [myself]0-i : ' The best years of [my]0-i life have been irrevocably wasted ; misery and humiliation and disaster have followed [my]0-i steps from [my]0-i youth ; of all the pleasant draughts which [other men]3437-other men drink to sweeten existence , not one has passed [my]0-i lips . [I]0-i will know happiness before [I]0-i die ; and [this girl]4108-this girl shall confer it . [She]4108-this girl shall grow up to maturity for [me]0-i : [I]0-i will imperceptibly gain such a hold on [her]4108-this girl affections , while [they]4109-they are yet young and impressible , that , when the time comes , and [I]0-i speak the word - though [my]0-i years more than double [hers]4108-this girl , though [I]0-i am dependent on [[her]4108-this girl father]1224-her father for the bread [I]0-i eat , though [parents]4111-parents ' voice and [lover]992-lover 's voice unite to call [her]4108-this girl back - [she]4108-this girl shall still come to [my]0-i side , and of [her]4108-this girl own free will put [her]4108-this girl hand in [mine]0-i , and follow [me]0-i wherever [I]0-i go ; [[my]0-i wife]864-my wife , [[my]0-i mistress]4114-my mistress , [[my]0-i servant]4115-my servant , which [I]0-i choose .[0-i]

" This was [my]0-i project . To execute it , time and opportunity were [mine]0-i ; and [I]0-i steadily and warily made use of them , hour by hour , day by day , year by year . From first to last , [[the girl]687-the girl 's father]4117-the girl 's father never suspected [me]0-i . Besides the security which [he]4117-the girl 's father felt in [my]0-i age , [he]4117-the girl 's father had judged [me]0-i by [his]4117-the girl 's father own small commercial standard , and had found [me]0-i a model of integrity . [A man who had saved [him]4117-the girl 's father from being cheated , who had so enlarged and consolidated [his]4117-the girl 's father business as to place [him]4117-the girl 's father among [the top dignitaries of the trade]4119-the top dignitaries of the trade ; who was the first to come to the desk in the morning , and [the last to remain there in the evening]4120-the last to remain there in the evening ; who had not only never demanded , but had absolutely refused to take , a single holiday]4118-a man who had saved him from being cheated , who had so enlarged and consolidated his business as to place him among the top dignitaries of the trade ; who was the first to come to the desk in the morning , and the last to remain there in the evening ; who had not only never demanded , but had absolutely refused to take , a single holiday - such [a man as this]4121-a man as this was , morally and intellectually , [a man in ten thousand]4122-a man in ten thousand ; [a man to be admired and trusted in every relation of life]4123-a man to be admired and trusted in every relation of life ![0-i]

" [His]4117-the girl 's father confidence in [me]0-i knew no bounds . [He]4117-the girl 's father was uneasy if [I]0-i was not by to advise [him]4117-the girl 's father in the simplest matters . [My]0-i ears were the first to which [he]4117-the girl 's father confided [his]4117-the girl 's father insane ambition on the subject of [[his]4117-the girl 's father daughter]233-his daughter - [his]4117-the girl 's father anxiety to see [her]233-his daughter marry above [her]233-his daughter station - [his]4117-the girl 's father stupid resolution to give [her]233-his daughter the false , flippant , fashionable education which [she]233-his daughter subsequently received . [I]0-i thwarted [his]4117-the girl 's father plans in nothing , openly - counteracted them in everything , secretly . The more [I]0-i strengthened [my]0-i sources of influence over [Margaret]44-margaret , the more pleased [he]4117-the girl 's father was . [He]4117-the girl 's father was delighted to hear [her]44-margaret constantly referring to [me]0-i about [her]44-margaret home - lessons ; to see [her]44-margaret coming to [me]0-i , evening after evening , to learn new occupations and amusements . [He]4117-the girl 's father suspected [I]0-i had been [a gentleman]3111-a gentleman ; [he]4117-the girl 's father had been told [I]0-i spoke pure English ; [he]4117-the girl 's father felt sure [I]0-i had received a first - rate education - [I]0-i was nearly as good for [Margaret]44-margaret as good society itself ! When [she]44-margaret grew older , and went to [the fashionable school]4126-the fashionable school , as [[her]44-margaret father]1224-her father had declared [she]44-margaret should , [my]0-i offer to keep up [her]44-margaret lessons in the holidays , and to examine what progress [she]44-margaret had made , when [she]44-margaret came [home]176-home regularly every fortnight for the Sunday , was accepted with greedy readiness , and acknowledged with servile gratitude . At this time , [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin 's own estimate of [me]0-i , among [[his]42-mr. sherwin friends]4129-his friends , was , that [he]42-mr. sherwin had got [me]0-i for half nothing , and that [I]0-i was worth more to [him]42-mr. sherwin than a thousand a - year .[0-i]

" But there was [one member of [the family]179-the family]4130-one member of the family who suspected [my]0-i intentions from the first . [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin - [the weak , timid , sickly woman , whose opinion [nobody regarded , whose character]4133-nobody regarded , whose character [nobody]120-nobody understood - [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin , of all those who dwelt in [the house]244-the house , or came to [the house]244-the house]4132-the weak , timid , sickly woman , whose opinion nobody regarded , whose character nobody understood - mrs. sherwin , of all those who dwelt in the house , or came to the house , was [the only one whose looks , words , and manner]4137-the only one whose looks , words , and manner kept [me]0-i constantly on [my]0-i guard . The very first time [we]4138-we saw [each other]102-each other , [that woman]4140-that woman doubted [me]0-i , as [I]0-i doubted [her]4140-that woman ; and for ever afterwards , when [we]4138-we met , [she]4140-that woman was on the watch . This mutual distrust , this antagonism of [our]4138-we two natures , never openly proclaimed itself , and never wore away . [My]0-i chance of security lay , not so much in [my]0-i own caution , and [my]0-i perfect command of look and action under all emergencies , as in the self - distrust and timidity of [her]4140-that woman nature ; in the helpless inferiority of position to which [[her]4140-that woman husband]480-her husband 's want of affection , and [[her]4140-that woman daughter]1101-her daughter 's want of respect , condemned [her]4140-that woman in [[her]4140-that woman own house]4143-her own house ; and in the influence of repulsion - at times , even of absolute terror - which [my]0-i presence had the power of communicating to [her]4140-that woman . Suspecting what [I]0-i am assured [she]4140-that woman suspected - incapable as [she]4140-that woman was of rendering [her]4140-that woman suspicions certainties - knowing beforehand , as [she]4140-that woman must have known , that no words [she]4140-that woman could speak would gain the smallest respect or credit from [[her]4140-that woman husband]480-her husband or [[her]4140-that woman child]2263-her child - [that woman]4140-that woman 's life , while [I]0-i was at [North Villa]11-north villa , must have been a life of the direst mental suffering to which [any human being]4147-any human being was ever condemned .[0-i]

" As time passed , and [Margaret]44-margaret grew older , [her]44-margaret beauty both of face and form approached nearer to perfection than [I]0-i had foreseen , closely as [I]0-i watched [her]44-margaret . But neither [her]44-margaret mind nor [her]44-margaret disposition kept pace with [her]44-margaret beauty . [I]0-i studied [her]44-margaret closely , with the same patient , penetrating observation , which [my]0-i experience of [the world]158-the world has made it a habit with [me]0-i to direct on [every one with whom [I]0-i am brought in contact]4149-every one with whom i am brought in contact - [I]0-i studied [her]44-margaret , [I]0-i say , intently ; and found [her]44-margaret worthy of nothing , not even of the slave - destiny which [I]0-i had in store for [her]44-margaret .[0-i]

" [She]44-margaret had neither heart nor mind , in the higher sense of those words . [She]44-margaret had simply instincts - most of the bad instincts of an animal ; none of the good . The great motive power which really directed [her]44-margaret , was Deceit . [I]0-i never met with [any human being]4147-any human being so inherently disingenuous , so naturally incapable of candour even in the most trifling affairs of life , as [she]44-margaret was . The best training could never have wholly overcome this vice in [her]44-margaret : the education [she]44-margaret actually got - an education under false pretences - encouraged it . [Everybody]361-everybody has read , [some people]4152-some people have known , of [young girls who have committed the most extraordinary impostures , or sustained the most infamous false accusations]4153-young girls who have committed the most extraordinary impostures , or sustained the most infamous false accusations ; [their]4153-young girls who have committed the most extraordinary impostures , or sustained the most infamous false accusations chief motive being often the sheer enjoyment of practising deceit . Of [such characters]4154-such characters was the character of [Margaret Sherwin]44-margaret .[0-i]

" [She]44-margaret had strong passions , but not [their]4153-young girls who have committed the most extraordinary impostures , or sustained the most infamous false accusations frequent accompaniment - strong will , and strong intellect . [She]44-margaret had some obstinacy , but no firmness . Appeal in the right way to [her]44-margaret vanity , and [you]4155-you could make [her]44-margaret do the thing [she]44-margaret had declared [she]44-margaret would not do , the minute after [she]44-margaret had made the declaration . As for [her]44-margaret mind , it was of [the lowest schoolgirl average]4156-the lowest schoolgirl average . [She]44-margaret had a certain knack at learning this thing , and remembering that ; but [she]44-margaret understood nothing fairly , felt nothing deeply . If [I]0-i had not had [my]0-i own motive in teaching [her]44-margaret , [I]0-i should have shut the books again , the first time [she]44-margaret and [I]0-i opened them together , and have given [her]44-margaret up as [a fool]4157-a fool .[0-i]

" All , however , that [I]0-i discovered of bad in [her]44-margaret character , never made [me]0-i pause in the prosecution of [my]0-i design ; [I]0-i had carried it too far for that , before [I]0-i thoroughly knew [her]44-margaret . Besides , what mattered [her]44-margaret duplicity to [me]0-i ? - [I]0-i could see through it . [Her]44-margaret strong passions ? - [I]0-i could control them . [Her]44-margaret obstinacy ? - [I]0-i could break it . [Her]44-margaret poverty of intellect ? - [I]0-i cared nothing about [her]44-margaret intellect . What [I]0-i wanted was youth and beauty ; [she]44-margaret was young and beautiful and [I]0-i was sure of [her]44-margaret .[0-i]

" Yes ; sure . [[Her]44-margaret showy person]4158-her showy person , showy accomplishments , and showy manners dazzled all eyes but [mine]0-i - Of [all the people about [her]44-margaret]4159-all the people about her , [I]0-i alone found out what [she]44-margaret really was ; and in that lay the main secret of [my]0-i influence over [her]44-margaret . [I]0-i dreaded no rivalry . [[Her]44-margaret father]1224-her father , prompted by [his]1224-her father ambitious hopes , kept [most young men of [[her]44-margaret class]4162-her class away from [the house]244-the house]4161-most young men of her class away from the house ; [the few who did come]4164-the few who did come were not dangerous ; [they]4164-the few who did come were as incapable of inspiring , as [she]44-margaret was of feeling , real love . [[Her]44-margaret mother]319-her mother still watched [me]0-i , and still discovered nothing ; still suspected [me]0-i behind [my]0-i back , and still trembled before [my]0-i face . Months passed on monotonously , year succeeded to year ; and [I]0-i bided [my]0-i time as patiently , and kept [my]0-i secret as cautiously as at the first . No change occurred , nothing happened to weaken or alter [my]0-i influence at [North Villa]11-north villa , until the day arrived when [Margaret]44-margaret left [school]344-school and came [home]176-home for good .[0-i]

" Exactly at the period to which [I]0-i have referred , certain business transactions of great importance required the presence of [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin , or of [some confidential person to represent [him]42-mr. sherwin]4168-some confidential person to represent him , at [Lyons]13-lyons . Secretly distrusting [his]42-mr. sherwin own capabilities , [he]42-mr. sherwin proposed to [me]0-i to go ; saying that it would be a pleasant trip for [me]0-i , and a good introduction to [[his]42-mr. sherwin wealthy manufacturing correspondents]4169-his wealthy manufacturing correspondents . After some consideration , [I]0-i accepted [his]42-mr. sherwin offer .[0-i]

" [I]0-i had never hinted a word of [my]0-i intentions towards [her]44-margaret to [Margaret]44-margaret ; but [she]44-margaret understood them well enough - [I]0-i was certain of that , from many indications which [no man]4170-no man could mistake . For reasons which will presently appear , [I]0-i resolved not to explain [myself]0-i until [my]0-i return from [Lyons]13-lyons . [My]0-i private object in going [there]161-there , was to make interest secretly with [[Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin 's correspondents]4172-mr. sherwin 's correspondents for a situation in [[their]4172-mr. sherwin 's correspondents house]4173-their house . [I]0-i knew that when [I]0-i made [my]0-i proposals to [Margaret]44-margaret , [I]0-i must be prepared to act on them on the instant ; [I]0-i knew that [[her]44-margaret father]1224-her father 's fury when [he]1224-her father discovered that [I]0-i had been helping to educate [[his]1224-her father daughter]233-his daughter only for [myself]0-i , would lead [him]1224-her father to any extremities ; [I]0-i knew that [we]4176-we must fly to [some foreign country]4177-some foreign country ; and , lastly , [I]0-i knew the importance of securing a provision for [our]4176-we maintenance , when [we]4176-we got [there]161-there . [I]0-i had saved money , it is true - nearly two - thirds of [my]0-i salary , every year - but had not saved enough for two . Accordingly , [I]0-i left [England]1-england to push [my]0-i own interests , as well as [[my]0-i employer]3352-my employer 's ; left it , confident that [my]0-i short absence would not weaken the result of years of steady influence over [Margaret]44-margaret . The sequel showed that , cautious and calculating as [I]0-i was , [I]0-i had nevertheless overlooked the chances against [me]0-i , which [my]0-i own experience of [her]44-margaret vanity and duplicity ought to have enabled [me]0-i thoroughly to foresee .[0-i]

" Well : [I]0-i had been some time at [Lyons]13-lyons ; had managed [[my]0-i employer]3352-my employer 's business from first to last , [I]0-i was faithful , as [I]0-i had engaged to be , to [his]3352-my employer commercial interests ; and had arranged [my]0-i own affairs securely and privately . Already , [I]0-i was looking forward , with sensations of happiness which were new to [me]0-i , to [my]0-i return and to the achievement of the one success , the solitary triumph of [my]0-i long life of humiliation and disaster , when a letter arrived from [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin . It contained the news of [your]42-mr. sherwin private marriage , and of the extraordinary conditions that had been attached to it with [your]42-mr. sherwin consent .[0-i]

" [Other people]4181-other people were in [the room]263-the room with [me]0-i when [I]0-i read that letter ; but [my]0-i manner betrayed nothing to [them]4181-other people . [My]0-i hand never trembled when [I]0-i folded the sheet of paper again ; [I]0-i was not a minute late in attending a business engagement which [I]0-i had accepted ; the slightest duties of other kinds which [I]0-i had to do , [I]0-i rigidly fulfilled . Never did [I]0-i more thoroughly and fairly earn the evening 's leisure by the morning 's work , than [I]0-i earned it that day .[0-i]

" Leaving [the town]356-the town at the close of afternoon , [I]0-i walked on till [I]0-i came to a solitary place on [the bank of [the great river]4185-the great river which runs near [Lyons]13-lyons]4184-the bank of the great river which runs near lyons . There [I]0-i opened the letter for the second time , and read it through again slowly , with no necessity now for self - control , because [no human being]4186-no human being was near to look at [me]0-i . There [I]0-i read [your]4187-your name , constantly repeated in every line of writing ; and knew that [the man who , in [my]0-i absence , had stepped between [me]0-i and [my]0-i prize]4188-the man who , in my absence , had stepped between me and my prize - [the man who , in [his]4188-the man who , in my absence , had stepped between me and my prize insolence of youth]4189-the man who , in his insolence of youth , and birth , and fortune , had snatched from [me]0-i the one long - delayed reward for twenty years of misery , just as [my]0-i hands were stretched forth to grasp it , was [the son of that honourable and high - born gentleman who had given [[my]0-i father]147-my father to the gallows , and had made [me]0-i [the outcast of [my]0-i social privileges for life]4192-the outcast of my social privileges for life]4190-the son of that honourable and high - born gentleman who had given my father to the gallows , and had made me the outcast of my social privileges for life .[0-i]

" The sun was setting when [I]0-i looked up from the letter ; flashes of rose - light leapt on [the leaping river]4193-the leaping river ; the birds were winging nestward to the distant trees , and the ghostly stillness of night was sailing solemnly over earth and sky , as the first thought of the vengeance [I]0-i would have on [father]477-father and [son]478-son began to burn fiercely at [my]0-i heart , to move like a new life within [me]0-i , to whisper to [my]0-i spirit - Wait : be patient ; [they]4196-they are both in [your]478-son power ; [you]478-son can now foul [the father]2258-the father 's name as [the father]2258-the father fouled [yours]478-son - [you]478-son can yet thwart [the son]3968-the son , as [the son]3968-the son has thwarted [you]478-son .[0-i]

" In the few minutes that passed , while [I]0-i lingered in [that lonely place]4201-that lonely place after reading the letter , [I]0-i imagined the whole scheme which it afterwards took a year to execute . [I]0-i laid the whole plan against [you]478-son and [[your]478-son father]302-your father , the first half of which , through the accident that led [you]478-son to [your]478-son discovery , has alone been carried out . [I]0-i believed then , as [I]0-i believe now , that [I]0-i stood towards [you]478-son both in the place of [an injured man]4203-an injured man , whose right it was , in self - defence and self - assertion , to injure [you]478-son . Judged by [your]478-son ideas , this may read wickedly ; but to [me]0-i , after having lived and suffered as [I]0-i have , the modern common - places current in [the world]158-the world are so many brazen images which society impudently worships - like [the Jews of old]4205-the jews of old - in the face of living Truth .[0-i]

" Let [us]4206-us get back to [England]1-england .[0-i]

" That evening , when [we]4206-us met for the first time , did [you]478-son observe that [Margaret]44-margaret was unusually agitated before [I]0-i came in ? [I]0-i detected some change , the moment [I]0-i saw [her]44-margaret . Did [you]478-son notice that [I]0-i avoided speaking to [her]44-margaret , or looking at [her]44-margaret ? it was because [I]0-i was afraid to do so . [I]0-i saw that , with [my]0-i return , [my]0-i old influence over [her]44-margaret was coming back : and [I]0-i still believe that , hypocritical and heartless though [she]44-margaret was , and blinded though [you]478-son were by [your]478-son passion for [her]44-margaret , [she]44-margaret would unconsciously have betrayed everything to [you]478-son on that evening , if [I]0-i had not acted as [I]0-i did . [[Her]44-margaret mother]319-her mother , too ! how [[her]44-margaret mother]319-her mother watched [me]0-i from the moment when [I]0-i came in ![0-i]

" Afterwards , while [you]478-son were trying hard to open , undetected , the sealed history of [my]0-i early life , [I]0-i was warily discovering from [Margaret]44-margaret all that [I]0-i desired to know . [I]0-i say ' warily , ' but the word poorly expresses [my]0-i consummate caution and patience , at that time . [I]0-i never put [myself]0-i in [her]44-margaret power , never risked offending , or frightening , or revolting [her]44-margaret ; never lost an opportunity of bringing [her]44-margaret back to [her]44-margaret old habits of familiarity ; and , more than all , never gave [[her]44-margaret mother]319-her mother a single opportunity of detecting [me]0-i . This was the sum of what [I]0-i gathered up , bit by bit , from secret and scattered investigations , persevered in through many weeks .[0-i]

" [Her]44-margaret vanity had been hurt , [her]44-margaret expectations disappointed , at [my]0-i having left [her]44-margaret for [Lyons]13-lyons , with no other parting words than such as [I]0-i might have spoken to [any other woman whom [I]0-i looked on merely as [a friend]512-a friend]4210-any other woman whom i looked on merely as a friend . That [she]44-margaret felt any genuine love for [me]0-i [I]0-i never have believed , and never shall : but [I]0-i had that practical ability , that firmness of will , that obvious personal ascendancy over most of those with whom [I]0-i came in contact , which extorts the respect and admiration of [women of all characters]4212-women of all characters , and even of [women of no character at all]4213-women of no character at all . As far as [her]44-margaret senses , [her]44-margaret instincts , and [her]44-margaret pride could take [her]44-margaret , [I]0-i had won [her]44-margaret over to [me]0-i but no farther - because no farther could [she]44-margaret go . [I]0-i mention pride among [her]44-margaret motives , advisedly . [She]44-margaret was proud of being the object of such attentions as [I]0-i had now paid to [her]44-margaret for years , because [she]44-margaret fancied that , through those attentions , [I]0-i , who , more or less , ruled [everyone else in [her]44-margaret sphere]4214-everyone else in her sphere , had yielded to [her]44-margaret the power of ruling [me]0-i . The manner of [my]0-i departure from [England]1-england showed [her]44-margaret too plainly that [she]44-margaret had miscalculated [her]44-margaret influence , and that the power , in [her]44-margaret case , as in the case of [others]98-others , was all on [my]0-i side . Hence the wound to [her]44-margaret vanity , to which [I]0-i have alluded .[0-i]

" It was while this wound was still fresh that [you]4216-you met [her]44-margaret , and appealed to [her]44-margaret self - esteem in a new direction . [You]4216-you must have seen clearly enough , that such proposals as [yours]4216-you far exceeded the most ambitious expectations formed by [[her]44-margaret father]1224-her father . [No man]4170-no man 's alliance could have lifted [her]44-margaret much higher out of [her]44-margaret own class : [she]44-margaret knew this , and from that knowledge married [you]4216-you - married [you]4216-you for [your]4216-you station , for [your]4216-you name , for [[your]4216-you great friends]4219-your great friends and connections , for [[your]4216-you father]302-your father 's money , and carriages , and [fine houses]4221-fine houses ; for everything , in short , but [yourself]4216-you .[0-i]

" Still , in spite of the temptations of youth , wealth , and birth which [your]4216-you proposals held out to [her]44-margaret , [she]44-margaret accepted them at first [I]0-i made [her]44-margaret confess it [herself]44-margaret with a secret terror and misgiving , produced by the remembrance of [me]0-i . These sensations , however , [she]44-margaret soon quelled , or fancied [she]44-margaret quelled ; and these , it was now [my]0-i last , best chance to revive . [I]0-i had a whole year for the work before [me]0-i ; and [I]0-i felt certain of success .[0-i]

" On [your]4216-you side , [you]4216-you had immense advantages . [You]4216-you had social superiority ; [you]4216-you had [[her]44-margaret father]1224-her father 's full approbation ; and [you]4216-you were married to [her]44-margaret . If [she]44-margaret had loved [you]4216-you for [yourself]4216-you , loved [you]4216-you for anything besides [her]44-margaret own sensual interests , [her]44-margaret vulgar ambition , [her]44-margaret reckless vanity , every effort [I]0-i could have made against [you]4216-you would have been defeated from the first . But , setting this out of the question , in spite of the utter heartlessness of [her]44-margaret attachment to [you]4216-you , if [you]4216-you had not consented to that condition of waiting a year for [her]44-margaret after marriage ; or , consenting to it , if [you]4216-you had broken it long before the year was out - knowing , as [you]4216-you should have known , that in [most women]4223-most women 's eyes [a man]3101-a man is not dishonoured by breaking [his]3101-a man promise , so long as [he]3101-a man breaks it for [a woman]325-a woman 's sake - if , [I]0-i say , [you]4216-you had taken either of these courses , [I]0-i should still have been powerless against [you]4216-you . But [you]4216-you remained faithful to [your]4216-you promise , faithful to the condition , faithful to the ill - directed modesty of [your]4216-you love ; and that very fidelity put [you]4216-you in [my]0-i power . [A pure - minded girl]4226-a pure - minded girl would have loved [you]4216-you a thousand times better for acting as [you]4216-you did - but [Margaret Sherwin]44-margaret was not [a pure - minded girl]4226-a pure - minded girl , not [a maidenly girl]4228-a maidenly girl : [I]0-i have looked into [her]44-margaret thoughts , and [I]0-i know it .[0-i]

" Such were [your]4216-you chances against [me]0-i ; and such was the manner in which [you]4216-you misused them . On [my]0-i side , [I]0-i had indefatigable patience ; personal advantages equal , with the exception of birth and age , to [yours]4216-you : long - established influence ; freedom to be familiar ; and more than all , that stealthy , unflagging strength of purpose which only springs from the desire of revenge . [I]0-i first thoroughly tested [your]4216-you character , and discovered on what points it was necessary for [me]0-i to be on [my]0-i guard against [you]4216-you , when [you]4216-you took shelter under [my]0-i roof from the storm . If [[your]4216-you father]302-your father had been with [you]4216-you on that night , there were moments , while the tempest was wrought to its full fury , when , if [my]0-i voice could have called the thunder down on [the house]244-the house to crush it and every one in it to atoms , [I]0-i would have spoken the word , and ended the strife for all of [us]4231-us . The wind , the hail , and the lightning maddened [my]0-i thoughts of [[your]4216-you father]302-your father and [you]4216-you - [I]0-i was nearly letting [you]4216-you see it , when that flash came between [us]4231-us as [we]4231-us parted at [my]0-i door .[0-i]

" How [I]0-i gained [your]4216-you confidence , [you]4216-you know ; and [you]4216-you know also , how [I]0-i contrived to make [you]4216-you use [me]0-i , afterwards , as [the secret friend who procured [you]4216-you privileges with [Margaret]44-margaret which [[her]44-margaret father]1224-her father would not grant at [your]4216-you own request]4233-the secret friend who procured you privileges with margaret which her father would not grant at your own request . This , at the outset , secured [me]0-i from suspicion on [your]4216-you part ; and [I]0-i had only to leave it to [your]4216-you infatuation to do the rest . With [you]4216-you [my]0-i course was easy - with [her]44-margaret it was beset by difficulties ; but [I]0-i overcame them . [Your]4216-you fatal consent to wait through a year of probation , furnished [me]0-i with weapons against [you]4216-you , which [I]0-i employed to the most unscrupulous purpose . [I]0-i can picture to [myself]0-i what would be [your]4216-you indignation and [your]4216-you horror , if [I]0-i fully described the use which [I]0-i made of the position in which [your]4216-you compliance with [[her]44-margaret father]1224-her father 's conditions placed [you]4216-you towards [Margaret]44-margaret . [I]0-i spare [you]4216-you this avowal - it would be useless now . Consider [me]0-i what [you]4216-you please ; denounce [my]0-i conduct in any terms [you]4216-you like : [my]0-i justification will always be the same . [I]0-i was [the injured man]4236-the injured man , [you]4216-you were [the aggressor]4237-the aggressor ; [I]0-i was righting [myself]0-i by getting back a possession of which [you]4216-you had robbed [me]0-i , and any means were sanctified by such an end as that .[0-i]

" But [my]0-i success , so far , was of little avail , in itself ; against the all - powerful counter - attraction which [you]4216-you possessed . Contemptible , or not , [you]4216-you still had this superiority over [me]0-i - [you]4216-you could make [a fine lady of [her]4239-her]4238-a fine lady of her . From that fact sprang the ambition which all [my]0-i influence , dating as it did from [her]4239-her childhood , could not destroy . There , was fastened the main - spring which regulated [her]4239-her selfish devotion to [you]4216-you , and which it was next to impossible to snap asunder . [I]0-i never made the attempt .[0-i]

" The scheme which [I]0-i proposed to [her]4239-her , when [she]4239-her was fully prepared to hear it , and to conceal that [she]4239-her had heard it , left [her]4239-her free to enjoy all the social advantages which [your]4216-you alliance could bestow - free to ride in [her]4239-her carriage , and go into [[[her]4239-her father]1224-her father 's shop]4241-her father 's shop that was one of [her]4239-her ambitions ! as [a new customer]4242-a new customer added to [his]4242-a new customer aristocratic connection - free even to become [one of [[your]4216-you family]953-your family]4243-one of your family , unsuspected , in case [your]4216-you rash marriage was forgiven . [Your]4216-you credulity rendered the execution of this scheme easy . In what manner it was to be carried out , and what object [I]0-i proposed to [myself]0-i in framing it , [I]0-i abstain from avowing ; for the simple reason that the discovery at which [you]4216-you arrived by following [us]4245-us on the night of the party , made [my]0-i plan abortive , and has obliged [me]0-i since to renounce it . [I]0-i need only say , in [this place]3077-this place , that it threatened [[your]4216-you father]302-your father as well as [you]4216-you , and that [Margaret]44-margaret recoiled from it at first - not from any horror of the proposal , but through fear of discovery . Gradually , [I]0-i overcame [her]44-margaret apprehensions : very gradually , for [I]0-i was not thoroughly secure of [her]44-margaret devotion to [my]0-i purpose , until [your]4216-you year of probation was nearly out .[0-i]

" Through all that year , daily visitor as [you]4216-you were at [North Villa]11-north villa , [you]4216-you never suspected either of [us]4245-us ! And yet , had [you]4216-you been one whit less infatuated , how many warnings [you]4216-you might have discovered , which , in spite of [her]44-margaret duplicity and [my]0-i caution , would then have shown themselves plainly enough to put [you]4216-you on [your]4216-you guard ! Those abrupt changes in [her]44-margaret manner , those alternate fits of peevish silence and capricious gaiety , which sometimes displayed themselves even in [your]4216-you presence , had every one of them their meaning - though [you]4216-you could not discern it . Sometimes , they meant fear of discovery , sometimes fear of [me]0-i : now , they might be traced back to hidden contempt ; now , to passions swelling under fancied outrage ; now , to secret remembrance of disclosures [I]0-i had just made , or eager anticipation of disclosures [I]0-i had yet to reveal . There were times at which every step of the way along which [I]0-i was advancing was marked , faintly yet significantly , in [her]44-margaret manner and [her]44-margaret speech , could [you]4216-you only have interpreted them aright . [My]0-i first renewal of [my]0-i old influence over [her]44-margaret , [my]0-i first words that degraded [you]4216-you in [her]44-margaret eyes , [my]0-i first successful pleading of [my]0-i own cause against [yours]4216-you , [my]0-i first appeal to those passions in [her]44-margaret which [I]0-i knew how to move , [my]0-i first proposal to [her]44-margaret of the whole scheme which [I]0-i had matured in solitude , in [the foreign country]4248-the foreign country , by [the banks of the great river]4249-the banks of the great river - all these separate and gradual advances on [my]0-i part towards the end which [I]0-i was vowed to achieve , were outwardly shadowed forth in [her]44-margaret , consummate as were [her]44-margaret capacities for deceit , and consummately as [she]44-margaret learnt to use them against [you]4216-you .[0-i]

" Do [you]4216-you remember noticing , on [your]4216-you return from [the country]370-the country , how ill [Margaret]44-margaret looked , and how ill [I]0-i looked ? [We]4251-we had some interviews during [your]4216-you absence , at which [I]0-i spoke such words to [her]44-margaret as would have left their mark on the face of [a Jezebel]4252-a jezebel , or [a Messalina]4253-a messalina . Have [you]4216-you forgotten how often , during the latter days of [your]4216-you year of expectation , [I]0-i abruptly left [the room]263-the room after [you]4216-you had called [me]0-i in to bear [you]4216-you company in [your]4216-you evening readings ? [My]0-i pretext was sudden illness ; and illness it was , but not of the body . As the time approached , [I]0-i felt less and less secure of [my]0-i own caution and patience . With [you]4216-you , indeed , [I]0-i might still have considered [myself]0-i safe : it was the presence of [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin that drove [me]0-i from [the room]263-the room . Under [that woman]4140-that woman 's fatal eye [I]0-i shrank , when the last days drew near - [I]0-i , who had defied [her]4140-that woman detection , and stood firmly on [my]0-i guard against [her]4140-that woman sleepless , silent , deadly vigilance , for months and months - gave way as the end approached ! [I]0-i knew that [she]4140-that woman had once or twice spoken strangely to [you]4216-you , and [I]0-i dreaded lest [her]4140-that woman wandering , incoherent words might yet take in time a recognisable direction , a palpable shape . They did not ; the instinct of terror bound [her]4140-that woman tongue to the last . Perhaps , even if [she]4140-that woman had spoken plainly , [you]4216-you would not have believed [her]4140-that woman ; [you]4216-you would have been still true to [yourself]4216-you and to [your]4216-you confidence in [Margaret]44-margaret . Enemy as [I]0-i am to [you]4216-you , enemy as [I]0-i will be to the day of [your]4216-you death , [I]0-i will do [you]4216-you justice for the past : - [Your]4216-you love for [that girl]4257-that girl was a love which [even the purest and best of women]4258-even the purest and best of women could never have thoroughly deserved .[0-i]

" [My]0-i letter is nearly done : [my]0-i retrospect is finished . [I]0-i have brought it down to the date of events , about which [you]4216-you know as much as [I]0-i do . Accident conducted [you]4216-you to a discovery which , otherwise , [you]4216-you might not have made , perhaps for months , perhaps not at all , until [I]0-i had led [you]4216-you to it of [my]0-i own accord . [I]0-i say accident , positively ; knowing that from first to last [I]0-i trusted [no third person]4259-no third person . What [you]4216-you know , [you]4216-you knew by accident alone .[0-i]

" But for that chance discovery , [you]4216-you would have seen [me]0-i bring [her]4257-that girl back to [North Villa]11-north villa at the appointed time , in [my]0-i care , just as [she]4257-that girl went out . [I]0-i had no dread of [her]4257-that girl meeting [you]4216-you . But enough of [her]4257-that girl ! [I]0-i shall dispose of [her]4257-that girl future , as [I]0-i had resolved to dispose of it years ago ; careless how [she]4257-that girl may be affected when [she]4257-that girl first sees the hideous alteration which [your]4216-you attack has wrought in [me]0-i . Enough , [I]0-i say , of [the Sherwins]4260-the sherwins - [father]477-father , [mother]1225-mother , and [daughter]2259-daughter - [your]4216-you destiny lies not with [them]4260-the sherwins , but with [me]0-i .[0-i]

" Do [you]4216-you still exult in having deformed [me]0-i in every feature , in having given [me]0-i a face to revolt [every human being who looks at [me]0-i]4264-every human being who looks at me ? Do [you]4216-you triumph in the remembrance of this atrocity , as [you]4216-you triumphed in the acting of it - believing that [you]4216-you had destroyed [my]0-i future with [Margaret]44-margaret , in destroying [my]0-i very identity as [a man]3101-a man ? [I]0-i tell [you]4216-you , that with the hour when [I]0-i leave [this hospital]3892-this hospital [your]4216-you day of triumph will be over , and [your]4216-you day of expiation will begin - never to end till the death of one of [us]4267-us . [You]4216-you shall live - [refined educated gentleman]4268-refined educated gentleman as [you]4216-you are - to wish , like [a ruffian]4269-a ruffian , that [you]4216-you had killed [me]0-i ; and [[your]4216-you father]302-your father shall live to wish it too .[0-i]

" Am [I]0-i trying to awe [you]4216-you with the fierce words of [a boaster]4271-a boaster and [a bully]4272-a bully ? Test [me]0-i , by looking back a little , and discovering what [I]0-i have abstained from for the sake of [my]0-i purpose , since [I]0-i have been [here]3265-here . A word or two from [my]0-i lips , in answer to the questions with which [I]0-i have been baited , day after day , by those about [me]0-i , would have called [you]4216-you before [a magistrate]4274-a magistrate to answer for an assault - a shocking and a savage assault , even in [this country]146-this country , where hand to hand brutality is a marketable commodity between [the Prisoner]3948-the prisoner and [the Law]4277-the law . [[Your]4216-you father]302-your father 's name might have been publicly coupled with [your]4216-you dishonour , if [I]0-i had but spoken ; and [I]0-i was silent . [I]0-i kept the secret - kept it , because to avenge [myself]0-i on [you]4216-you by a paltry scandal , which [you]4216-you and [[your]4216-you family]953-your family opposing to it wealth , position , previous character , and general sympathy would live down in a few days , was not [my]0-i revenge : because to be righted before [magistrates]4280-magistrates and [judges]4281-judges by [a beggarman]4282-a beggarman 's exhibition of physical injury , and [a coward]4283-a coward 's confession of physical defeat , was not [my]0-i way of righting [myself]0-i . [I]0-i have a lifelong retaliation in view , which laws and [lawgivers]4284-lawgivers are powerless either to aid or to oppose - the retaliation which set a mark upon [Cain]76-cain as [I]0-i will set a mark on [you]4216-you ; and then made [his]76-cain life [his]76-cain punishment as [I]0-i will make [your]4216-you life [yours]4216-you .[0-i]

" How ? Remember what [my]0-i career has been ; and know that [I]0-i will make [your]4216-you career like it . As [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's death by [the hangman]3951-the hangman affected [my]0-i existence , so the events of that night when [you]4216-you followed [me]0-i shall affect [yours]4216-you . [[Your]4216-you father]302-your father shall see [you]4216-you living the life to which [his]302-your father evidence against [[my]0-i father]147-my father condemned [me]0-i - shall see the foul stain of [your]4216-you disaster clinging to [you]4216-you wherever [you]4216-you go . The infamy with which [I]0-i am determined to pursue [you]4216-you , shall be [your]4216-you own infamy that [you]4216-you can not get quit of - for [you]4216-you shall never get quit of [me]0-i , never get quit of [the wife who has dishonoured [you]4216-you]4289-the wife who has dishonoured you . [You]4216-you may leave [[your]4216-you home]4290-your home , and leave [England]1-england ; [you]4216-you may make [new friends]4291-new friends , and seek new employments ; years and years may pass away - and still , [you]4216-you shall not escape [us]4292-we : still , [you]4216-you shall never know when [we]4292-we are near , or when [we]4292-we are distant ; when [we]4292-we are ready to appear before [you]4216-you , or when [we]4292-we are sure to keep out of [your]4216-you sight . [My]0-i deformed face and [her]4289-the wife who has dishonoured you fatal beauty shall hunt [you]4216-you through [the world]158-the world . The terrible secret of [your]4216-you dishonour , and of the atrocity by which [you]4216-you avenged it , shall ooze out through strange channels , in vague shapes , by tortuous intangible processes ; ever changing in the manner of its exposure , never remediable by [your]4216-you own resistance , and always directed to the same end - [your]4216-you isolation as [a marked man]4294-a marked man , in every fresh sphere , among [every new community to which [you]4216-you retreat]4295-every new community to which you retreat .[0-i]

" Do [you]4216-you call this a very madness of malignity and revenge ? It is the only occupation in life for which [your]4216-you mutilation of [me]0-i has left [me]0-i fit ; and [I]0-i accept it , as work worthy of [my]0-i deformity . In the prospect of watching how [you]4216-you bear this hunting through life , that never quite hunts [you]4216-you down ; how long [you]4216-you resist the poison - influence , as slow as it is sure , of a crafty tongue that can not be silenced , of a denouncing presence that can not be fled , of a damning secret torn from [you]4216-you and exposed afresh each time [you]4216-you have hidden it - there is the promise of a nameless delight which it sometimes fevers , sometimes chills [my]0-i blood to think of . Lying in [this place]3077-this place at night , in those hours of darkness and stillness when the surrounding atmosphere of human misery presses heavy on [me]0-i in [my]0-i heavy sleep , prophecies of dread things to come between [us]4297-us , trouble [my]0-i spirit in dreams . At those times , [I]0-i know , and shudder in knowing , that there is something besides the motive of retaliation , something less earthly and apparent than that , which urges [me]0-i horribly and supernaturally to link [myself]0-i to [you]4216-you for life ; which makes [me]0-i feel as the bearer of a curse that shall follow [you]4216-you ; as the instrument of a fatality pronounced against [you]4216-you long ere [we]4297-us met - a fatality beginning before [[our]4297-us fathers]4298-our fathers were parted by [the hangman]3951-the hangman ; perpetuating itself in [you]4216-you and [me]0-i ; ending who shall say how , or when ?[0-i]

" Beware of comforting [yourself]4216-you with a false security , by despising [my]0-i words , as the wild words of [a madman , dreaming of the perpetration of impossible crimes]4300-a madman , dreaming of the perpetration of impossible crimes . Throughout this letter [I]0-i have warned [you]4216-you of what [you]4216-you may expect ; because [I]0-i will not assail [you]4216-you at disadvantage , as [you]4216-you assailed [me]0-i ; because it is [my]0-i pleasure to ruin [you]4216-you , openly resisting [me]0-i at every step . [I]0-i have given [you]4216-you fair play , as [the huntsmen]4301-the huntsmen give fair play at starting to the animal [they]4301-the huntsmen are about to run down . Be warned against seeking a false hope in the belief that [my]0-i faculties are shaken , and that [my]0-i resolves are visionary - false , because such a hope is only despair in disguise .[0-i]

" [I]0-i have done . The time is not far distant when [my]0-i words will become deeds . [They]4302-they cure fast in [a public hospital]4303-a public hospital : [we]4304-we shall meet soon ![0-i]

" [ROBERT MANNION]73-mannion . "[0-i]

" [We]4304-we shall meet soon ! "[0-i]

How ? Where ? [I]0-i looked back at the last page of writing . But [my]0-i attention wandered strangely ; [I]0-i confused one paragraph with another ; the longer [I]0-i read , the less [I]0-i was able to grasp the meaning , not of sentences merely , but even of the simplest words .

From the first lines to the last , the letter had produced no distinct impressions on [my]0-i mind . So utterly was [I]0-i worn out by the previous events of the day , that even those earlier portions of [Mannion]73-mannion 's confession , which revealed the connection between [[my]0-i father]147-my father and [his]147-my father , and the terrible manner of [their]2298-their separation , hardly roused [me]0-i to more than a momentary astonishment . [I]0-i just called to remembrance that [I]0-i had never heard the subject mentioned at [home]176-home , except once or twice in vague hints dropped mysteriously by [an old servant]2300-an old servant , and little regarded by [me]0-i at the time , as referring to matters which had happened before [I]0-i was born . [I]0-i just reflected thus briefly and languidly on the narrative at the commencement of the letter ; and then mechanically read on . Except the passages which contained the exposure of [Margaret]44-margaret 's real character , and those which described the origin and progress of [Mannion]73-mannion 's infamous plot , nothing in the letter impressed [me]0-i , as [I]0-i was afterwards destined to be impressed by it , on a second reading . The lethargy of all feeling into which [I]0-i had now sunk , seemed a very lethargy of death .

[I]0-i tried to clear and concentrate [my]0-i faculties by thinking of other subjects ; but without success . All that [I]0-i had heard and seen since the morning , now recurred to [me]0-i more and more vaguely and confusedly . [I]0-i could form no plan either for the present or the future . [I]0-i knew as little how to meet [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin 's last threat of forcing [me]0-i to acknowledge [[his]42-mr. sherwin guilty daughter]2301-his guilty daughter , as how to defend [myself]0-i against the life - long hostility with which [I]0-i was menaced by [Mannion]73-mannion . A feeling of awe and apprehension , which [I]0-i could trace to no distinct cause , stole irresistibly and mysteriously over [me]0-i . A horror of the searching brightness of daylight , a suspicion of the loneliness of the place to which [I]0-i had retreated , a yearning to be among [my]0-i fellow - creatures again , to live where there was life - the busy life of [London]10-london - overcame [me]0-i . [I]0-i turned hastily , and walked back from [the suburbs]1078-the suburbs to [the city]635-the city .

It was growing towards evening as [I]0-i gained [one of [the great thoroughfares]2305-the great thoroughfares]2304-one of the great thoroughfares . Seeing [some of [the inhabitants of [the houses]1909-the houses]2307-the inhabitants of the houses]2306-some of the inhabitants of the houses , as [I]0-i walked along , sitting at [their]2306-some of the inhabitants of the houses open windows to enjoy the evening air , the thought came to [me]0-i for the first time that day : - where shall [I]0-i lay [my]0-i head tonight ? [Home]176-home [I]0-i had none . [Friends who would have gladly received [me]0-i]2310-friends who would have gladly received me were not wanting ; but to go to [them]2310-friends who would have gladly received me would oblige [me]0-i to explain [myself]0-i ; to disclose something of the secret of [my]0-i calamity ; and this [I]0-i was determined to keep concealed , as [I]0-i had told [[my]0-i father]147-my father [I]0-i would keep it . [My]0-i last - left consolation was [my]0-i knowledge of still preserving that resolution , of still honourably holding by it at all hazards , cost what it might .

So [I]0-i thought no more of succour or sympathy from [any one of [[my]0-i friends]1271-my friends]2312-any one of my friends . As [a stranger]842-a stranger [I]0-i had been driven from [[my]0-i home]2199-my home , and as [a stranger]842-a stranger [I]0-i was resigned to live , until [I]0-i had learnt how to conquer [my]0-i misfortune by [my]0-i own vigour and endurance . Firm in this determination , though firm in nothing else , [I]0-i now looked around [me]0-i for the first shelter [I]0-i could purchase from [strangers]300-strangers - the humbler the better .

[I]0-i happened to be in the poorest part , and on the poorest side of [the great street along which [I]0-i was walking]2318-the great street along which i was walking - among [the inferior shops]2319-the inferior shops , and [the houses of few stories]2320-the houses of few stories . [A room to let]2321-a room to let was not hard to find [here]3265-here . [I]0-i took the first [I]0-i saw ; escaped questions about names and references by paying [my]0-i week 's rent in advance ; and then found [myself]0-i left in possession of [the one little room which [I]0-i must be resigned to look on for the future]2323-the one little room which i must be resigned to look on for the future - perhaps for a long future ! - as [[my]0-i home]2199-my home .

[Home]176-home ! A dear and a mournful remembrance was revived in the reflections suggested by that simple word . Through the darkness that thickened over [my]0-i mind , there now passed one faint ray of light which gave promise of the morning - the light of the calm face that [I]0-i had last looked on when it was resting on [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's breast .

[Clara]57-clara ! [My]0-i parting words to [her]57-clara , when [I]0-i had unclasped from [my]0-i neck those kind arms which would fain have held [me]0-i to [home]176-home for ever , had expressed a promise that was yet unfulfilled . [I]0-i trembled as [I]0-i now thought on [[my]0-i sister]296-my sister 's situation . Not knowing whither [I]0-i had turned [my]0-i steps on leaving [home]176-home ; uncertain to what extremities [my]0-i despair might hurry [me]0-i ; absolutely ignorant even whether [she]57-clara might ever see [me]0-i again - it was terrible to reflect on the suspense under which [she]57-clara might be suffering , at this very moment , on [my]0-i account . [My]0-i promise to write to [her]57-clara , was of all promises the most vitally important , and the first that should be fulfilled .

[My]0-i letter was very short . [I]0-i communicated to [her]57-clara the address of [the house in which [I]0-i was living]2330-the house in which i was living well knowing that nothing but positive information on this point would effectually relieve [her]57-clara anxiety - [I]0-i asked [her]57-clara to write in reply , and let [me]0-i hear some news of [her]57-clara , the best that [she]57-clara could give - and [I]0-i entreated [her]57-clara to believe implicitly in [my]0-i patience and courage under every disaster ; and to feel assured that , whatever happened , [I]0-i should never lose the hope of soon meeting [her]57-clara again . Of the perils that beset [me]0-i , of the wrong and injury [I]0-i might yet be condemned to endure , [I]0-i said nothing . Those were truths which [I]0-i was determined to conceal from [her]57-clara , to the last . [She]57-clara had suffered for [me]0-i more than [I]0-i dared think of , already !

[I]0-i sent [my]0-i letter by hand , so as to ensure its immediate delivery . In writing those few simple lines , [I]0-i had no suspicion of the important results which they were destined to produce . In thinking of to - morrow , and of all the events which to - morrow might bring with it , [I]0-i little thought whose voice would be the first to greet [me]0-i the next day , whose hand would be held out to [me]0-i as the helping hand of [a friend]512-a friend .

[VI]77-vi .

It was still early in the morning , when a loud knock sounded at [the house]244-the house - door , and [I]0-i heard [the landlady]625-the landlady calling to [the servant]315-the servant : " [A gentleman]3111-a gentleman to see [the gentleman who came in last night]4306-the gentleman who came in last night . "[625-the landlady] The moment the words reached [me]0-i , [my]0-i thoughts recurred to the letter of yesterday - Had [Mannion]73-mannion found [me]0-i out in [my]0-i retreat ? As the suspicion crossed [my]0-i mind , the door opened , and [the visitor]1388-the visitor entered .

[I]0-i looked at [him]1388-the visitor in speechless astonishment . It was [[my]0-i elder brother]149-my elder brother ! It was [Ralph]39-ralph [himself]39-ralph who now walked into [the room]263-the room !

" Well , [Basil]46-basil ! how are [you]46-basil ? "[1388-the visitor] [he]1388-the visitor said , with [his]1388-the visitor old off - hand manner and hearty voice .

" [Ralph]39-ralph ! [You]46-basil in [England]1-england ! - [you]46-basil here ! "[1388-the visitor]

" [I]1388-the visitor came back from [Italy]3-italy last night . [Basil]46-basil , how awfully [you]46-basil 're changed ! [I]1388-the visitor hardly know [you]46-basil again . "[1388-the visitor]

All the shame and grief of [my]0-i banishment from [home]176-home came back on [me]0-i , at sight of [his]1388-the visitor friendly , familiar face . [I]0-i struggled hard to keep [my]0-i self - possession , and tried to bid [him]1388-the visitor welcome cheerfully ; but the effort was too much for [me]0-i . " [Basil]46-basil ! [Basil]46-basil ! what are [you]46-basil about ? This wo n't do . Look up , and listen to [me]1388-the visitor . " [He]147-my father offered [me]154-my brother money , at parting ; but with such words of contempt and insult that [I]154-my brother would have died rather than take it .
