And [I]154-my brother go to - day to make that sacrifice . The loss of the little [I]154-my brother have to depend on , is the least part of it . [He]147-my father may not see [his]147-my father injustice in doubting [me]154-my brother , till too late ; but [he]147-my father shall see it . "[154-my brother]

" [I]154-my brother beg [your]154-my brother pardon , [Basil]46-basil ; but this is almost as great an insanity , as the insanity of [your]154-my brother marriage . [I]154-my brother honour the independence of [your]154-my brother principle , [[my]154-my brother dear fellow]4373-my dear fellow ; but , while [I]154-my brother am to the fore , [I]154-my brother 'll take good care that [you]154-my brother do n't ruin [yourself]154-my brother gratuitously , for the sake of any principles whatever ! Just listen to [me]154-my brother , now . In the first place , remember that what [[my]154-my brother father]147-my father said to [you]154-my brother , [he]147-my father said in a moment of violent exasperation . [You]154-my brother had been trampling the pride of [his]147-my father life in the mud : [no man]4170-no man likes that - [[my]154-my brother father]147-my father least of any . And , as for the offer of [your]154-my brother poor little morsel of an income to stop [these people]4377-these people 's greedy mouths , it is n't a quarter enough for [them]4377-these people . [They]4377-these people know [[our]4378-our family]145-our family is [a wealthy family]4380-a wealthy family ; and [they]4377-these people will make [their]4377-these people demand accordingly . Any other sacrifice , even to taking [the girl]687-the girl back though [you]154-my brother never could bring [yourself]154-my brother to do that ! , would be of no earthly use . Nothing but money will do ; money cunningly doled out , under the strongest possible stipulations . Now , [I]154-my brother 'm just [the man to do that]4382-the man to do that , and [I]154-my brother have got the money - or , rather , [[my]154-my brother father]147-my father has , which comes to the same thing . Write [me]154-my brother [the fellow]4384-the fellow 's name and address ; there 's no time to be lost - [I]154-my brother 'm off to see [him]4384-the fellow at once ! "[154-my brother]

" [I]2347-he ca n't allow [you]147-my father , [Ralph]39-ralph , to ask [[my]2347-he father]147-my father for what [I]2347-he would not ask [him]147-my father [myself]2347-he - "[2347-he]

" Give [me]154-my brother the name and address , or [you]147-my father will sour [my]154-my brother excellent temper for the rest of [my]154-my brother life . [Your]147-my father obstinacy wo n't do with [me]154-my brother , [Basil]46-basil - it did n't at [school]344-school , and it wo n't now . [I]154-my brother shall ask [[my]154-my brother father]147-my father for money for [myself]154-my brother ; and use as much of it as [I]154-my brother think proper for [your]147-my father interests . [He]147-my father 'll give [me]154-my brother anything [I]154-my brother want , now [I]154-my brother have [turned good boy]4388-turned good boy . [I]154-my brother do n't owe fifty pounds , since [my]154-my brother last debts were paid off - thanks to [Mrs. Ralph]39-ralph , who is [the most managing woman in [the world]158-the world]4389-the most managing woman in the world . By - the - bye , when [you]147-my father see [her]39-ralph , do n't seem surprised at [her]39-ralph being older than [I]154-my brother am . Oh ! this is the address , is it ? [Hollyoake Square]12-hollyoake square ? Where the devil 's that ! Never mind , [I]154-my brother 'll take [a cab]637-a cab , and shift the responsibility of finding [the place]435-the place on [the driver]1797-the driver . Keep up [your]147-my father spirits , and wait here till [I]154-my brother come back . [You]147-my father shall have such news of [Mr. Shopkeeper]79-mr. shopkeeper and [[his]79-mr. shopkeeper daughter]233-his daughter as [you]147-my father little expect ! [Au revoir]4395-au revoir , [[my]154-my brother dear fellow]4373-my dear fellow - au revoir . "[154-my brother]

[He]2347-he left [the room]263-the room as rapidly as [he]2347-he had entered [it]263-the room . The minute afterwards , [I]0-i remembered that [I]0-i ought to have warned [him]2347-he of the fatal illness of [Mrs. Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin . [She]43-mrs. sherwin might be dying - dead for aught [I]0-i knew - when [he]2347-he reached [the house]244-the house . [I]0-i ran to the window , to call [him]2347-he back : it was too late . [Ralph]39-ralph was gone .

Even if [he]2347-he were admitted at [North Villa]11-north villa , would [he]2347-he succeed ? [I]0-i was little capable of estimating the chances . The unexpectedness of [his]2347-he visit ; the strange mixture of sympathy and levity in [his]2347-he manner , of worldly wisdom and boyish folly in [his]2347-he conversation , appeared to be still confusing [me]0-i in [his]2347-he absence , just as they had confused [me]0-i in [his]2347-he presence . [My]0-i thoughts imperceptibly wandered away from [Ralph]39-ralph , and the mission [he]2347-he had undertaken on [my]0-i behalf , to a subject which seemed destined , for the future , to steal on [my]0-i attention , irresistibly and darkly , in all [my]0-i lonely hours . Already , the fatality denounced against [me]0-i in [Mannion]73-mannion 's letter had begun to act : already , that terrible confession of past misery and crime , that monstrous declaration of enmity which was to last with the lasting of life , began to exercise its numbing influence on [my]0-i faculties , to cast its blighting shadow over [my]0-i heart .

[I]0-i opened the letter again , and re - read the threats against [me]0-i at its conclusion . One by one , the questions now arose in [my]0-i mind : how can [I]0-i resist , or how escape the vengeance of [this evil spirit]2350-this evil spirit ? how shun the dread deformity of that face , which is to appear before [me]0-i in secret ? how silence [that fiend]2351-that fiend 's tongue , or make harmless the poison which it will pour drop by drop into [my]0-i life ? When should [I]0-i first look for that avenging presence ? - now , or not till months hence ? Where should [I]0-i first see it ? in [the house]244-the house ? - or in [the street]163-the street ? At what time would it steal to [my]0-i side ? by night - or by day ? Should [I]0-i show the letter to [Ralph]39-ralph ? - it would be useless . What would avail any advice or assistance which [his]73-mannion reckless courage could give , against [an enemy who combined the ferocious vigilance of a savage]2354-an enemy who combined the ferocious vigilance of a savage with the far - sighted iniquity of [a civilised man]2355-a civilised man ?

As this last thought crossed [my]0-i mind , [I]0-i hastily closed the letter ; determining alas ! how vainly ! never to open it again . Almost at the same instant , [I]0-i heard another knock at [the house]244-the house - door . Could [Ralph]39-ralph have returned already ? impossible ! Besides , the knock was very different from [his]73-mannion - it was only just loud enough to be audible where [I]0-i now sat .

[Mannion]73-mannion ? But would [he]73-mannion come thus ? openly , fairly , in the broad daylight , through [the populous street]2357-the populous street ?

A light , quick step ascended the stairs - [my]0-i heart bounded ; [I]0-i started to [my]0-i feet . It was the same step which [I]0-i used to listen for , and love to hear , in [my]0-i illness . [I]0-i ran to the door , and opened it . [My]0-i instinct had not deceived [me]0-i ! it was [[my]0-i sister]296-my sister !

" [Basil]46-basil ! "[296-my sister] [she]296-my sister exclaimed , before [I]0-i could speak - " has [Ralph]39-ralph been here ? "[296-my sister]

" Yes , love - yes . "[296-my sister]

" Where has [he]73-mannion gone ? what has [he]73-mannion done for [you]296-my sister ? [He]73-mannion promised [me]296-my sister - "[296-my sister]

" And [he]73-mannion has kept [his]73-mannion promise nobly , [Clara]57-clara : [he]73-mannion is away helping [me]296-my sister now . "[296-my sister]

" Thank [God]37-god ! thank [God]37-god ! "[296-my sister]

[She]296-my sister sank breathless into a chair , as [she]296-my sister spoke . Oh , the pang of looking at [her]296-my sister at that moment , and seeing how [she]296-my sister was changed ! - seeing the dimness and weariness of the gentle eyes ; the fear and the sorrow that had already overshadowed the bright young face !

" [I]296-my sister shall be better directly , "[296-my sister] [she]296-my sister said , guessing from [my]0-i expression what [I]0-i then felt - " but , seeing [you]0-i in [this strange place]4397-this strange place , after what happened yesterday ; and having come here so secretly , in terror of [[my]296-my sister father]147-my father finding it out - [I]296-my sister ca n't help feeling [your]0-i altered position and mine a little painfully at first . But [we]4399-we wo n't complain , as long as [I]296-my sister can get here sometimes to see [you]0-i : [we]4399-we will only think of the future now . What a mercy , what a happiness it is that [Ralph]39-ralph has come back ! [We]4399-we have always done [him]147-my father injustice ; [he]147-my father is far kinder and far better than [we]4399-we ever thought [him]147-my father . But , [Basil]46-basil , how worn and ill [you]46-basil are looking ! Have [you]46-basil not told [Ralph]39-ralph everything ? Are [you]46-basil in any danger ? "[296-my sister]

" None , [Clara]57-clara - none , indeed ! "[296-my sister]

" Do n't grieve too deeply about yesterday ! Try and forget that horrible parting , and all that brought it about . [He]147-my father has not spoken of it since , except to tell [me]296-my sister that [I]296-my sister must never know more of [your]0-i fault and [your]0-i misfortune , than the little - the very little - [I]296-my sister know already . And [I]296-my sister have resolved not to think about it , as well as not to ask about it , for the future . [I]296-my sister have a hope already , [Basil]46-basil - very , very far off fulfilment - but still a hope . Can [you]46-basil not think what it is ? "[296-my sister]

" [Your]46-basil hope is far off fulfilment , indeed , [Clara]57-clara , if it is hope from [[my]296-my sister father]147-my father ! "[296-my sister]

" Hush ! do n't say so ; [I]296-my sister know better . Something occurred , even so soon as last night - a very trifling event - but enough to show that [he]147-my father thinks of [you]46-basil , already , in grief far more than in anger . "[296-my sister]

" [I]296-my sister wish [I]296-my sister could believe it , love ; but [my]296-my sister remembrance of yesterday - "[296-my sister]

" Do n't trust that remembrance ; do n't recall it ! [I]296-my sister will tell [you]46-basil what occurred . Some time after [you]46-basil had gone , and after [I]296-my sister had recovered [myself]296-my sister a little in [[my]296-my sister own room]3311-my own room , [I]296-my sister went [downstairs]3774-downstairs again to see [[my]296-my sister father]147-my father ; for [I]296-my sister was too terrified and too miserable at what had happened , to be alone . [He]147-my father was not in [[his]147-my father room]4404-his room when [I]296-my sister got [there]161-there . As [I]296-my sister looked round [me]296-my sister for a moment , [I]296-my sister saw the pieces of [your]46-basil page in the book about [[our]4406-our family]145-our family , scattered on the floor ; and the miniature likeness of [you]46-basil , when [you]46-basil were [a child]226-a child , was lying among the other fragments . It had been torn out of its setting in the paper , but not injured . [I]296-my sister picked it up , [Basil]46-basil , and put it on the table , at the place where [he]147-my father always sits ; and laid [my]296-my sister own little locket , with [your]46-basil hair in it , by the side , so that [he]147-my father might know that the miniature had not been accidentally taken up and put there by [the servant]315-the servant . Then , [I]296-my sister gathered together the pieces of the page and took them away with [me]296-my sister , thinking it better that [he]147-my father should not see them again . Just as [I]296-my sister had got through the door that leads into [the library]1061-the library , and was about to close it , [I]296-my sister heard the other door , by which [you]46-basil enter [the study]4411-the study from [the hall]1423-the hall , opening ; and [he]147-my father came in , and went directly to the table . [His]147-my father back was towards [me]296-my sister , so [I]296-my sister could look at [him]147-my father unperceived . [He]147-my father observed the miniature directly and stood quite still with it in [his]147-my father hand ; then sighed - sighed so bitterly ! - and then took the portrait of [[our]4413-our dear mother]4414-our dear mother from one of the drawers of the table , opened the case in which it is kept , and put [your]46-basil miniature inside , very gently and tenderly . [I]296-my sister could not trust [myself]296-my sister to see any more , so [I]296-my sister went up to [[my]296-my sister room]136-my room again : and shortly afterwards [he]147-my father came in with [my]296-my sister locket , and gave it [me]296-my sister back , only saying - ' [You]46-basil left this on [my]296-my sister table , [Clara]57-clara . ' But if [you]46-basil had seen [his]147-my father face then , [you]46-basil would have hoped all things from [him]147-my father in the time to come , as [I]296-my sister hope now . "[296-my sister]

" And as [I]296-my sister will hope , [Clara]57-clara , though it be from no stronger motive than gratitude to [you]57-clara . "[296-my sister]

" Before [I]2359-i left [home]176-home , "[2359-i] [she]2359-i proceeded , after a moment 's silence , " [I]2359-i thought of [your]46-basil loneliness in this strange place - knowing that [I]2359-i could seldom come to see [you]46-basil , and then only by stealth ; by committing a fault which , if [[my]2359-i father]147-my father found it out - but [we]4418-we wo n't speak of that ! [I]2359-i thought of [your]46-basil lonely hours here ; and [I]2359-i have brought with [me]2359-i [an old , forgotten companion of yours]4419-an old , forgotten companion of yours , to bear [you]46-basil company , and to keep [you]46-basil from thinking too constantly on what [you]46-basil have suffered . Look , [Basil]46-basil ! wo n't [you]46-basil welcome [this old friend]4420-this old friend again ? "[2359-i]

[She]2359-i gave [me]0-i a small roll of manuscript , with an effort to resume [her]2359-i kind smile of former days , even while the tears stood thick in [her]2359-i eyes . [I]0-i untied the leaves , glanced at the handwriting , and saw before [me]0-i , once more , the first few chapters of [my]0-i unfinished romance ! Again [I]0-i looked on the patiently - laboured pages , familiar relics of that earliest and best ambition which [I]0-i had abandoned for love ; too faithful records of the tranquil , ennobling pleasures which [I]0-i had lost for ever ! Oh , for one Thought - Flower now , from [the dream - garden of the happy Past]2360-the dream - garden of the happy past !

" [I]57-clara took more care of those leaves of writing , after [you]46-basil had thrown them aside , than of anything else [I]57-clara had , "[57-clara] said [Clara]57-clara . " [I]57-clara always thought the time would come , when [you]46-basil would return again to the occupation which it was once [your]46-basil greatest pleasure to pursue , and [my]57-clara greatest pleasure to watch . And surely that time has arrived . [I]57-clara am certain , [Basil]46-basil , [your]46-basil book will help [you]46-basil to wait patiently for happier times , as nothing else can . [This place]3077-this place must seem very strange and lonely ; but the sight of those pages , and the sight of [me]57-clara sometimes when [I]57-clara can come , may make it look almost like [home]176-home to [you]46-basil ! [The room]263-the room is not - not very - "[57-clara]

[She]57-clara stopped suddenly . [I]0-i saw [her]57-clara lip tremble , and [her]57-clara eyes grow dim again , as [she]57-clara looked round [her]57-clara . When [I]0-i tried to speak all the gratitude [I]0-i felt , [she]57-clara turned away quickly , and began to busy [herself]57-clara in re - arranging the wretched furniture ; in setting in order the glaring ornaments on the chimney - piece ; in hiding the holes in the ragged window - curtains ; in changing , as far as [she]57-clara could , all the tawdry discomfort of [[my]0-i one miserable little room]2361-my one miserable little room . [She]57-clara was still absorbed in this occupation , when the church - clocks of [the neighbourhood]718-the neighbourhood struck the hour - the hour that warned [her]57-clara to stay no longer .

" [I]57-clara must go , "[57-clara] [she]57-clara said ; " it is later than [I]57-clara thought . Do n't be afraid about [my]57-clara getting [home]176-home : [old Martha]80-old martha came here with [me]57-clara , and is waiting [downstairs]3774-downstairs to go back [you]0-i know [we]4426-we can trust [her]80-old martha . Write to [me]57-clara as often as [you]0-i can ; [I]57-clara shall hear about [you]0-i every day , from [Ralph]39-ralph ; but [I]57-clara should like a letter sometimes , as well . Be as hopeful and as patient [yourself]0-i , [dear]3113-dear , under misfortune , as [you]0-i wish [me]57-clara to be ; and [I]57-clara shall despair of nothing . Do n't tell [Ralph]39-ralph [I]57-clara have been [here]3265-here - [he]4429-he might be angry . [I]57-clara will come again , the first opportunity . Good - bye , [Basil]46-basil ! Let [us]4430-us try and part happily , in the hope of better days . Good - bye , [dear]3113-dear - good - bye , only for the present ! "[57-clara]

[Her]2363-her self - possession nearly failed [her]2363-her , as [she]2363-her kissed [me]0-i , and then turned to the door . [She]2363-her just signed to [me]0-i not to follow [her]2363-her down - [stairs]1197-stairs , and , without looking round again , hurried from [the room]263-the room .

It was well for the preservation of [our]2366-we secret , that [she]2363-her had so resolutely refrained from delaying [her]2363-her departure . [She]2363-her had been gone but for a few minutes - the lovely and consoling influence of [her]2363-her presence was still fresh in [my]0-i heart - [I]0-i was still looking sadly over the once precious pages of manuscript which [she]2363-her had restored to [me]0-i - when [Ralph]39-ralph returned from [North Villa]11-north villa . [I]0-i heard [him]2367-i leaping , rather than running , up [the ricketty wooden stairs]2368-the ricketty wooden stairs . [He]2367-i burst into [[my]0-i room]136-my room more impetuously than ever .

" All right ! "[2367-i] [he]2367-i said , jumping back to [his]2367-i former place on the bed . " [We]2366-we can buy [Mr. Shopkeeper]79-mr. shopkeeper for anything [we]2366-we like - for nothing at all , if [we]2366-we choose to be stingy . [[His]79-mr. shopkeeper innocent daughter]4432-his innocent daughter has made the best of all confessions , just at the right time . [Basil]46-basil , [[my]2367-i boy]4433-my boy , [she]4432-his innocent daughter has left [[[her]4432-his innocent daughter father]1224-her father 's house]4352-her father 's house ! "[2367-i]

" What do [you]2367-i mean ? "[2367-i]

" [She]4432-his innocent daughter has eloped to [the hospital]3549-the hospital ! "[2367-i]

" [Mannion]73-mannion ! "[2367-i]

" Yes , [Mannion]73-mannion : [I]2367-i have got [his]79-mr. shopkeeper letter to [her]4432-his innocent daughter . [She]4432-his innocent daughter is criminated by it , even past [[her]4432-his innocent daughter father]1224-her father 's contradiction - and [he]79-mr. shopkeeper does n't stick at a trifle ! But [I]2367-i 'll begin at the beginning , and tell [you]46-basil everything . Hang it , [Basil]46-basil , [you]46-basil look as if [I]2367-i 'd brought [you]46-basil bad news instead of good ! "[2367-i]

" Never mind how [I]2367-i look , [Ralph]39-ralph - pray go on ! "[2367-i]

" Well : the first thing [I]2367-i heard , on getting to [the house]244-the house , was that [[Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin 's wife]4439-sherwin 's wife was dying . [The servant]315-the servant took in [my]2367-i name : but [I]2367-i thought of course [I]2367-i should n't be admitted . No such thing ! [I]2367-i was let in at once , and the first words [this fellow]4441-this fellow , [Sherwin]43-mrs. sherwin , said to [me]2367-i , were , that [[his]4441-this fellow wife]997-his wife was only ill , that [the servants]745-the servants were exaggerating , and that [he]4441-this fellow was quite ready to hear what [[Mr. Basil]46-basil 's ' highly - respected ' brother]4444-mr. basil 's ' highly - respected ' brother fancy calling [me]2367-i ' highly - respected ! ' had to say to [him]4441-this fellow . [The fool]4099-the fool , however , as [you]4446-you see , was cunning enough to try civility to begin with . [A more ill - looking human mongrel [I]2367-i never set eyes on]4447-a more ill - looking human mongrel i never set eyes on ! [I]2367-i took the measure of [[my]2367-i man]4448-my man directly , and in two minutes told [him]4448-my man exactly what [I]2367-i came for , without softening a single word . "[2367-i]

" And how did [he]4448-my man answer [you]2367-i ? "[2367-i]

" As [I]2367-i anticipated , by beginning to bluster immediately . [I]2367-i took [him]4448-my man down , just as [he]4448-my man swore [his]4448-my man second oath . ' [Sir]3046-sir , ' [I]2367-i said very politely , ' if [you]3046-sir mean to make a cursing and a swearing conference of this , [I]2367-i think it only fair to inform [you]3046-sir before - hand that [you]3046-sir are likely to get the worst of it . When the whole collection of British oaths is exhausted , [I]2367-i can swear fluently in five foreign languages : [I]2367-i have always made it a principle to pay back abuse at compound interest , and [I]2367-i do n't exaggerate in saying , that [I]2367-i am quite capable of swearing [you]3046-sir out of [your]3046-sir senses , if [you]3046-sir persist in setting [me]2367-i the example . And now , if [you]3046-sir like to go on , pray do - [I]2367-i 'm ready to hear [you]3046-sir . ' While [I]2367-i was speaking , [he]4448-my man stared at [me]2367-i in a state of helpless astonishment ; when [I]2367-i had done , [he]4448-my man began to bluster again - but it was a pompous , dignified , parliamentary sort of bluster , now , ending in [his]4448-my man pulling [your]3046-sir unlucky marriage - certificate out of [his]4448-my man pocket , asserting for the fiftieth time , that [the girl]687-the girl was innocent , and declaring that [he]4448-my man 'd make [you]3046-sir acknowledge [her]687-the girl , if [he]4448-my man went before [a magistrate]4274-a magistrate to do it . That 's what [he]4448-my man said when [you]3046-sir saw [him]4448-my man , [I]2367-i suppose ? "[2367-i]

" Yes : almost word for word . "[2367-i]

" [I]2367-i had [my]2367-i answer ready for [him]4448-my man , before [he]4448-my man could put the certificate back in [his]4448-my man pocket . ' Now , [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin , ' [I]2367-i said , ' have the goodness to listen to [me]2367-i . [[My]2367-i father]147-my father has certain family prejudices and nervous delicacies , which [I]2367-i do not inherit from [him]147-my father , and which [I]2367-i mean to take good care to prevent [you]42-mr. sherwin from working on . At the same time , [I]2367-i beg [you]42-mr. sherwin to understand that [I]2367-i have come here without [his]147-my father knowledge . [I]2367-i am not [[my]2367-i father 's ambassador]4453-my father 's ambassador , but [[my]2367-i brother]154-my brother 's - who is unfit to deal with [you]42-mr. sherwin , [himself]154-my brother ; because [he]154-my brother is not half hard - hearted , or half worldly enough . As [[[my]2367-i brother]154-my brother 's envoy]4456-my brother 's envoy , therefore , and out of consideration for [[my]2367-i father]147-my father 's peculiar feelings , [I]2367-i now offer [you]42-mr. sherwin , from [my]2367-i own resources , a certain annual sum of money , far more than sufficient for all [[your]42-mr. sherwin daughter]3131-your daughter 's expenses - a sum payable quarterly , on condition that neither [you]42-mr. sherwin nor [she]3131-your daughter shall molest [us]4459-we ; that [you]42-mr. sherwin shall never make use of [our]4459-we name anywhere ; and that the fact of [[my]2367-i brother]154-my brother 's marriage hitherto preserved a secret shall for the future be consigned to oblivion . [We]4459-we keep [our]4459-we opinion of [[your]42-mr. sherwin daughter]3131-your daughter 's guilt - [you]42-mr. sherwin keep [your]42-mr. sherwin opinion of [her]3131-your daughter innocence . [We]4459-we have silence to buy , and [you]42-mr. sherwin have silence to sell , once a quarter ; and if either of [us]4459-we break [our]4459-we conditions , [we]4459-we both have [our]4459-we remedy - [your]42-mr. sherwin 's the easy remedy , [our]4459-we 's the difficult . This arrangement - a very unfair and dangerous for [us]4459-we ; a very advantageous and safe one for [you]42-mr. sherwin - [I]2367-i understand that [you]42-mr. sherwin finally refuse ? ' ' [Sir]3046-sir , ' says [he]42-mr. sherwin , solemnly , ' [I]2367-i should be unworthy the name of [a father]3249-a father - ' ' Thank [you]42-mr. sherwin ' - [I]2367-i remarked , feeling that [he]42-mr. sherwin was falling back on paternal sentiment - ' thank [you]42-mr. sherwin ; [I]2367-i quite understand . [We]4459-we will get on , if [you]42-mr. sherwin please , to the reverse side of the question . ' "[2367-i]

" The reverse side ! What reverse side , [Ralph]39-ralph ? What could [you]39-ralph possibly say more ? "[2367-i]

" [You]39-ralph shall hear . ' Being , on [your]42-mr. sherwin part , thoroughly determined , ' [I]2367-i said , ' to permit no compromise , and to make [[my]2367-i brother]154-my brother [[his]154-my brother family]218-his family of course included acknowledge [a woman]325-a woman , of whose guilt [they]218-his family entertain not the slightest doubt , [you]42-mr. sherwin think [you]42-mr. sherwin can gain [your]42-mr. sherwin object by threatening an exposure . Will revenge pay a farthing towards [[your]42-mr. sherwin daughter]3131-your daughter 's keep ? Will revenge make [us]4459-we receive [her]3131-your daughter ? Not a bit of it ! [We]4459-we shall be driven into a corner ; [we]4459-we shall have no exposure to dread after [you]42-mr. sherwin have exposed [us]4459-we ; [we]4459-we shall have no remedy left , but a desperate remedy , and [we]4459-we 'll go to law - boldly , openly go to law , and get a divorce . [We]4459-we send [you]42-mr. sherwin back [[your]42-mr. sherwin daughter]3131-your daughter , without a shred of character left to cover [her]3131-your daughter ; and [we]4459-we comfortably wash [our]4459-we hands of [you]42-mr. sherwin altogether . ' "[2367-i]

" [Ralph]39-ralph ! [Ralph]39-ralph ! how could [you]42-mr. sherwin - "[2367-i]

" Stop ! hear the end of it . Of course [I]2367-i knew that [we]4459-we could n't carry out this divorce - threat , without its being the death of [[my]2367-i father]147-my father ; but [I]2367-i thought a little quiet bullying on [my]2367-i part might do [Mr. Shopkeeper]79-mr. shopkeeper Sherwin some good . And [I]2367-i was right . [You]42-mr. sherwin never saw [a man]3101-a man sit sorer on the sharp edges of a dilemma than [he]3101-a man did . [I]2367-i stuck to [my]2367-i point in spite of everything ; silence and money , or exposure and divorce - just which [he]3101-a man pleased . ' [I]2367-i deny every one of [your]2367-i infamous imputations , ' said [he]3101-a man . ' That 's not the question , ' said [I.]2367-i ' [I]2367-i 'll go to [[your]2367-i father]302-your father , ' said [he]3101-a man . " Not [he]3101-a man . [He]3101-a man went up - [stairs]1197-stairs , and in a few minutes ran down again , with an open letter in [his]3101-a man hand , looking as if [the devil]4488-the devil was after [him]3101-a man before [his]3101-a man time . [I]2367-i just heard [him]3101-a man say [[his]3101-a man daughter]233-his daughter should come back , if [he]3101-a man put a straight waistcoat on [her]233-his daughter , as [he]3101-a man passed the door . [I]2367-i picked it up before [I]2367-i went away , suspecting it might be good evidence on [our]4494-our side ; and [I]2367-i was right . [I]0-i took the letter , and read in [Mannion]73-mannion 's handwriting these words , dated from [the hospital]3549-the hospital : -

" [I]2367-i have received [your]4495-you last note , and can not wonder that [you]4495-you are getting impatient under restraint . [I]2367-i gave [you]4495-you the lesson , and [you]4495-you have been wise enough to profit by it .[2367-i]

" The time has now come for a change in [my]2372-i plans . [I]2372-i have suffered a relapse ; and the date of [my]2372-i discharge from [this place]3077-this place is still uncertain . [I]2372-i doubt the security , both on [your]4495-you account , and on [mine]2372-i , of still leaving [you]4495-you at [[[your]4495-you father]302-your father 's house]3903-your father 's house , to await [my]2372-i cure . " R. M. "[2367-i]

This was evidently the letter about which [I]0-i had been consulted by [the servant at [North Villa]11-north villa]2284-the servant at north villa ; the date corresponded with the date of [Mannion]73-mannion 's letter to [me]0-i . " No , "[2372-i] [he]2372-i replied ; " [Sherwin]73-mannion dropped the letter just in the state in which [I]2372-i have given it to [you]0-i . " But , [Ralph]39-ralph , do [you]39-ralph think - "[0-i]

" Do [I]2372-i think [[her]687-the girl father]1224-her father will get [her]687-the girl back ? This seems to [me]2372-i to be how the matter stands now , [Basil]46-basil : - After that letter , and [her]687-the girl running away , [Sherwin]1224-her father will have nothing for it but to hold [his]1224-her father tongue about [her]687-the girl innocence ; [we]4512-we may consider [him]1224-her father as settled and done with . What 's the matter now ? - [you]0-i 're looking pale again . "[2372-i]

[I]0-i felt that [my]0-i colour was changing , while [he]2373-he spoke . There was something ominous in the contrast which , at that moment , [I]0-i could not fail to draw between [Mannion]73-mannion 's enmity , as [Ralph]39-ralph ignorantly estimated it , and as [I]0-i really knew it . Already the first step towards the conspiracy with which [I]0-i was threatened , had been taken by the departure of [[Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin 's daughter]2374-sherwin 's daughter from [[[her]2374-sherwin 's daughter father]1224-her father 's house]4352-her father 's house . " [I]2373-he suppose , [Basil]46-basil , "[2373-he] [he]2373-he said , " the truth is , that [you]46-basil ca n't help being a little shocked - though [you]46-basil could expect nothing better from [the girl]687-the girl - at [her]687-the girl boldly following [this fellow Mannion]4518-this fellow mannion , even to [the hospital]3549-the hospital "[2373-he] [Ralph]39-ralph was right ; in spite of [myself]0-i , this feeling was one among the many which now influenced [me]0-i . " Setting that aside , however , [we]4520-we are quite ready , [I]39-ralph take it , to let [her]687-the girl stick to [her]687-the girl choice , and live just as [she]687-the girl pleases , so long as [she]687-the girl does n't live under [our]4520-we name . VII .

The next morning , [Ralph]39-ralph never appeared - the day passed on , and [I]0-i heard nothing - at last , when it was evening , a letter came from [him]2378-he .

The letter informed [me]0-i that [[my]0-i brother]154-my brother had written to [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin , simply asking whether [he]42-mr. sherwin had recovered [[his]42-mr. sherwin daughter]233-his daughter . The answer to this question did not arrive till late in the day ; and was in the negative - [Mr. Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin had not found [[his]42-mr. sherwin daughter]233-his daughter . [She]233-his daughter had left [the hospital]3549-the hospital before [he]42-mr. sherwin got [there]161-there ; and [no one]743-no one could tell [him]42-mr. sherwin whither [she]233-his daughter had gone . [His]2378-he language and manner , as [he]2378-he himself admitted , had been so violent that [he]2378-he was not allowed to enter [the ward where [Mannion]73-mannion lay]2385-the ward where mannion lay . When [he]2378-he returned [home]176-home , [he]2378-he found [[his]2378-he wife]997-his wife at the point of death ; and on the same evening [she]997-his wife expired . [Ralph]39-ralph described [his]2378-he letter , as the letter of [a man half out of [his]2378-he senses]2388-a man half out of his senses . [He]2378-he only mentioned [[his]2378-he daughter]233-his daughter , to declare , in terms almost of fury , that [he]2378-he would accuse [her]233-his daughter before [[[his]2378-he wife]997-his wife 's surviving relatives]2391-his wife 's surviving relatives , of having been the cause of [[her]233-his daughter mother]319-her mother 's death ; and called down the most terrible denunciations on [his]2378-he own head , if [he]2378-he ever spoke to [[his]2378-he child]322-his child again , though [he]2378-he should see [her]233-his daughter starving before [him]2378-he in [the streets]241-the streets . In a postscript , [Ralph]39-ralph informed [me]0-i that [he]2378-he would call the next morning , and concert measures for tracking [[Sherwin]42-mr. sherwin 's daughter]2374-sherwin 's daughter to [her]233-his daughter present retreat .

Every sentence in this letter bore warning of the crisis which was now close at hand ; yet [I]0-i had as little of the desire as of the power to prepare for it . A superstitious conviction that [my]0-i actions were governed by a fatality which no human foresight could alter or avoid , began to strengthen within [me]0-i . From this time forth , [I]0-i awaited events with the uninquiring patience , the helpless resignation of despair .

[[My]0-i brother]154-my brother came , punctual to [his]154-my brother appointment . When [he]154-my brother proposed that [I]0-i should at once accompany [him]154-my brother to [the hospital]3549-the hospital , [I]0-i never hesitated at doing as [he]154-my brother desired . [We]2398-we reached [our]2398-we destination ; and [Ralph]39-ralph approached the gates to make [his]2378-he first enquiries .

[He]2378-he was still speaking to [the porter]2399-the porter , when [a gentleman]3111-a gentleman advanced towards [them]2401-them , on [his]3111-a gentleman way out of [the hospital]3549-the hospital . [I]0-i saw [him]3111-a gentleman recognise [[my]0-i brother]154-my brother , and heard [Ralph]39-ralph exclaim :

" [Bernard]82-jack ! [Jack Bernard]82-jack ! Have [you]82-jack come to [England]1-england , of [all the men in [the world]158-the world]4542-all the men in the world ! "[39-ralph]

" Why not ? "[3111-a gentleman] was the answer . " [I]39-ralph got every surgical testimonial [the Hotel Dieu]4544-the hotel dieu could give [me]39-ralph , six months ago ; and could n't afford to stay in [Paris]9-paris only for [my]39-ralph pleasure . Do [you]4545-you remember calling [me]39-ralph a ' mute , [inglorious Liston]83-inglorious liston , ' long ago , when [we]4546-we last met ? Well , [I]39-ralph have come to [England]1-england to soar out of [my]39-ralph obscurity and blaze into a shining light of the profession . Plenty of practice at [the hospital]3549-the hospital , here - very little anywhere else , [I]39-ralph am sorry to say . "[39-ralph]

" [You]39-ralph do n't mean that [you]39-ralph belong to [this hospital]3892-this hospital ? "[39-ralph]

" [[My]39-ralph dear fellow]4373-my dear fellow , [I]39-ralph am regularly on [the staff]4550-the staff ; [I]39-ralph 'm [here]3265-here every day of [my]39-ralph life . "[39-ralph]

" [You]4373-my dear fellow 're [the very man]4552-the very man to enlighten [us]4546-we . [You]46-basil 've often heard [me]39-ralph talk , [Basil]46-basil , of [a younger son of old Sir [William Bernard]85-william bernard 's , who preferred a cure of bodies to a cure of souls]4555-a younger son of old sir william bernard 's , who preferred a cure of bodies to a cure of souls ; and actually insisted on working in [a hospital]4556-a hospital when [he]4555-a younger son of old sir william bernard 's , who preferred a cure of bodies to a cure of souls might have idled in [a family]330-a family living . This is [the man]696-the man - the best of [doctors]4559-doctors and [good fellows]4560-good fellows . "[39-ralph]

" Are [you]84-mr. bernard bringing [[your]84-mr. bernard brother]3328-your brother to [the hospital]3549-the hospital to follow [my]84-mr. bernard mad example ? "[84-mr. bernard] asked [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard , as [he]84-mr. bernard shook hands with [me]0-i .

" Not exactly , [Jack]82-jack ! But [we]2404-we really have an object in coming [here]3265-here . Can [you]84-mr. bernard give [us]2404-we ten minutes ' talk , somewhere in private ? [We]2404-we want to know about [one of [[your]84-mr. bernard patients]4565-your patients]4564-one of your patients . "[84-mr. bernard]

[He]84-mr. bernard led [us]2404-we into [an empty room]1823-an empty room , on [the ground - floor of [the building]2407-the building]2406-the ground - floor of the building . " Leave the matter in [my]39-ralph hands , "[39-ralph] whispered [Ralph]39-ralph to [me]0-i , as [we]2404-we sat down . " [I]39-ralph 'll find out everything . "[39-ralph]

" Now , [Bernard]82-jack , "[84-mr. bernard] [he]84-mr. bernard said , " [you]82-jack have [a man here]4566-a man here , who calls [himself]4566-a man here [Mr. Turner]81-turner ? "[84-mr. bernard]

" Are [you]82-jack [a friend of [that mysterious patient]4568-that mysterious patient]4567-a friend of that mysterious patient ? Wonderful ! [The students]4569-the students call [him]4568-that mysterious patient ' [The Great Mystery of [London]10-london]4570-the great mystery of london ; ' and [I]39-ralph begin to think [the students]4569-the students are right . Do [you]82-jack want to see [him]4568-that mysterious patient ? "[39-ralph]

" No , no - at least , not at present ; [[my]84-mr. bernard brother]154-my brother here , not at all . The fact is , certain circumstances have happened which oblige [us]4573-our to look after [this man]656-this man ; and which [I]84-mr. bernard am sure [you]82-jack wo n't inquire into , when [I]84-mr. bernard tell [you]82-jack that it is [our]4573-our interest to keep [them]4575-them secret . "[84-mr. bernard]

" Certainly not ! "[39-ralph]

" Then , without any more words about it , [our]4573-our object here , to - day , is to find out everything [we]4573-our can about [Mr. Turner]81-turner , and [the people who have been to see]4576-the people who have been to see [him]81-turner . Did [a woman]325-a woman come , the day before yesterday ? "[84-mr. bernard]

" Yes ; and behaved rather oddly , [I]39-ralph believe . [I]39-ralph was not here when [she]325-a woman came , but was told [she]325-a woman asked for [Turner]81-turner , in a very agitated manner . [She]325-a woman was directed to [the Victoria Ward]4578-the victoria ward , where [he]81-turner is ; and when [she]325-a woman got [there]161-there , looked excessively flurried and excited - seeing [the Ward]4580-the ward quite full , and , perhaps , not being used to [hospitals]4581-hospitals . However it was , though [the nurse]3820-the nurse pointed out the right bed to [her]325-a woman , [she]325-a woman ran in a mighty hurry to the wrong one . "[39-ralph]

" [I]39-ralph understand , "[39-ralph] said [Ralph]39-ralph ; " just as [some women]4583-some women run into [the wrong omnibus]4584-the wrong omnibus , when [the right one]4585-the right one is straight before [them]4583-some women . "[39-ralph]

" Exactly . Well , [she]325-a woman only discovered [her]325-a woman mistake [the room]263-the room being rather dark , after [she]325-a woman had stooped down close over [the stranger]4587-the stranger , who was lying with [his]4587-the stranger head away from [her]325-a woman . By that time , [the nurse]3820-the nurse was at [her]325-a woman side , and led [her]325-a woman to the right bed . There , [I]39-ralph 'm told , another scene happened . At sight of [the patient]3555-the patient 's face , which is very frightfully disfigured , [she]325-a woman was on the point as [the nurse]3820-the nurse thought of going into a fit ; but [Turner]81-turner stopped [her]325-a woman in an instant . [He]81-turner just laid [his]81-turner hand on [her]325-a woman arm , and whispered something to [her]325-a woman ; and , though [she]325-a woman turned as pale as ashes , [she]325-a woman was quiet directly . The next thing [they]4591-we say [he]81-turner did , was to give [her]325-a woman a slip of paper , coolly directing [her]325-a woman to go to the address written on it , and to come back to [the hospital]3549-the hospital again , as soon as [she]325-a woman could show a little more resolution . [She]325-a woman went away at once - [nobody]120-nobody knows where . "[39-ralph]

" Has [nobody]120-nobody asked where ? "[39-ralph]

" Yes ; [a fellow who said [he]81-turner was [[her]325-a woman father]1224-her father , and who behaved like [a madman]4491-a madman]4595-a fellow who said he was her father , and who behaved like a madman . [He]81-turner came [here]3265-here about an hour after [she]325-a woman had left , and would n't believe that [we]4591-we knew nothing about [her]325-a woman how [the deuce]3504-the deuce should [we]4591-we know anything ! [He]81-turner threatened [Turner]81-turner whom , by the bye , [he]81-turner called [Manning]86-manning , or some such name in such an outrageous manner , that [we]4591-we were obliged to refuse [him]81-turner admission . [Turner]81-turner [himself]81-turner will give no information on the subject ; but [I]39-ralph suspect that [his]81-turner injuries are the result of a quarrel with [the father]2258-the father about [the daughter]4601-the daughter - a pretty savage quarrel , [I]39-ralph must say , looking to the consequences - [I]39-ralph beg [your]0-i pardon , but [[your]0-i brother]3328-your brother seems ill ! [I]39-ralph 'm afraid , "[39-ralph] turning to [me]0-i , " [you]0-i find [the room]263-the room rather close ? "[39-ralph]

" No , indeed ; not at all . [I]39-ralph have just recovered from a serious illness - but pray go on . "[39-ralph]

" [I]39-ralph have very little more to say . [The father]2258-the father went away in a fury , just as [he]2258-the father came ; [the daughter]4601-the daughter has not yet made [her]4601-the daughter appearance a second time . But , after what was reported to [me]39-ralph of the first interview , [I]39-ralph daresay [she]4601-the daughter will come . [He]81-turner has been making [himself]81-turner worse by perpetually writing letters ; [we]4606-we were rather afraid of erysipelas , but [he]81-turner 'll get over that danger , [I]39-ralph think . "[39-ralph]

" About [the woman]695-the woman , "[39-ralph] said [Ralph]39-ralph ; " it is of the greatest importance that [we]4606-we should know where [she]695-the woman is now living . "[39-ralph]

"[84-mr. bernard]

" Anything in [the world]158-the world , [[my]39-ralph [dear fellow]4616-dear fellow]4373-my dear fellow . Have [you]4612-you got pen and ink ? " If [he]154-my brother wrote to [my]39-ralph address , [Mrs. Ralph]39-ralph might see the letter . [She]39-ralph is the most amiable of [her]39-ralph sex ; but if written information of [[a woman]325-a woman 's residence]4619-a woman 's residence , directed to [me]39-ralph , fell into [her]39-ralph hands - [you]4612-you understand , [Basil]46-basil ! Here [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard brought [us]2409-we pen and ink . While [Ralph]39-ralph was writing [my]0-i address , [[his]84-mr. bernard friend]2410-his friend said to [me]0-i :

" [I]2410-his friend hope [you]0-i will not suspect [me]2410-his friend of wishing to intrude on [your]0-i secrets , if assuming [your]0-i interest in [Turner]81-turner to be the reverse of a friendly interest [I]2410-his friend warn [you]0-i to look sharply after [him]81-turner when [he]81-turner leaves [the hospital]3549-the hospital . Either there has been madness in [[his]81-turner family]218-his family , or [his]81-turner brain has suffered from [his]81-turner external injuries . [Legally]87-legally , [he]81-turner may be quite fit to be at large ; for [he]81-turner will be able to maintain the appearance of perfect self - possession in all the ordinary affairs of life . But , morally , [I]2410-his friend am convinced that [he]81-turner is [a dangerous monomaniac]4623-a dangerous monomaniac ; [his]81-turner mania being connected with some fixed idea which evidently never leaves [him]81-turner day or night . [I]2410-his friend would lay a heavy wager that [he]81-turner dies in [a prison]4624-a prison or [a madhouse]4045-a madhouse . "[2410-his friend]

" And [I]39-ralph 'll lay another wager , if [he]81-turner 's mad enough to annoy [us]4626-we , that [we]4626-we are [the people]1418-the people to shut [him]81-turner up , "[39-ralph] said [Ralph]39-ralph . " There is the address . And now , [we]4626-we need n't waste [your]4628-your time any longer . [I]39-ralph have taken a little place at [Brompton]22-brompton , [Jack]82-jack , - [you]4628-your and [Basil]46-basil must come and dine with [me]39-ralph , as soon as the carpets are down . "[39-ralph]

[We]2411-we left [the room]263-the room . As [we]2411-we crossed [the hall]1423-the hall , [a gentleman]3111-a gentleman came forward , and spoke to [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard .

" [That man]212-that man 's fever in [the Victoria Ward]4578-the victoria ward has declared itself at last , "[3111-a gentleman] [he]3111-a gentleman said . " This morning the new symptoms have appeared . "[3111-a gentleman]

" And what do they indicate ? "[3111-a gentleman]

" Typhus of the most malignant character - not a doubt of it . Come up , and look at [him]212-that man . "[3111-a gentleman]

[I]0-i saw [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard start , and glance quickly at [[my]0-i brother]154-my brother . [Ralph]39-ralph fixed [his]84-mr. bernard eyes searchingly on [[his]84-mr. bernard friend]2410-his friend 's face ; exclaimed : " [Victoria Ward]23-victoria ward ! why [you]84-mr. bernard mentioned that - ; "[84-mr. bernard] and then stopped , with a very strange and sudden alteration in [his]84-mr. bernard expression . The next moment [he]3111-a gentleman drew [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard aside , saying : " [I]3111-a gentleman want to ask [you]39-ralph whether [the bed in [Victoria Ward]23-victoria ward]4631-the bed in victoria ward , occupied by [this man whose fever has turned to typhus]4632-this man whose fever has turned to typhus , is [the same bed]4633-the same bed , or near the bed which - "[3111-a gentleman] The rest of the sentence was lost to [me]0-i as [they]2417-they walked away .

After talking together in whispers for a few moments , [they]2417-they rejoined [me]0-i . [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard was explaining the different theories of infection to [Ralph]39-ralph .

" [My]84-mr. bernard notion , "[84-mr. bernard] [he]84-mr. bernard said , " is , that infection is taken through the lungs ; one breath inhaled from the infected atmosphere hanging immediately around [the diseased person]4634-the diseased person , and generally extending about a foot from [him]4634-the diseased person , being enough to communicate [his]4634-the diseased person malady to [the breather]4635-the breather - provided there exists , at the time , in [the individual exposed to catch the malady]4636-the individual exposed to catch the malady , a constitutional predisposition to infection . This predisposition [we]4637-we know to be greatly increased by mental agitation , or bodily weakness ; but , in the case [we]4637-we have been talking of , "[84-mr. bernard] [he]84-mr. bernard looked at [me]0-i , " the chances of infection or non - infection may be equally balanced . At any rate , [I]84-mr. bernard can predict nothing about [them]4638-them at this stage of the discovery . "[84-mr. bernard]

" [You]39-ralph will write the moment [you]39-ralph hear anything ? "[39-ralph] said [Ralph]39-ralph , shaking hands with [him]84-mr. bernard .

" The very moment . [I]84-mr. bernard have [[your]39-ralph brother]3328-your brother 's address safe in [my]84-mr. bernard pocket . "[84-mr. bernard]

[We]2418-our separated . [Ralph]39-ralph was unusually silent and serious on [our]2418-our way back . [He]84-mr. bernard took leave of [me]0-i at the door of [[my]0-i lodging]2419-my lodging , very abruptly ; without referring again to [our]2418-our visit to [the hospital]3549-the hospital .

A week passed away , and [I]0-i heard nothing from [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard . During this interval , [I]0-i saw little of [[my]0-i brother]154-my brother ; [he]84-mr. bernard was occupied in moving into [[his]84-mr. bernard new house]2422-his new house . Towards the latter part of the week , [he]84-mr. bernard came to inform [me]0-i that [he]84-mr. bernard was about to leave [London]10-london for a few days . [[My]0-i father]147-my father had asked [him]84-mr. bernard to go to [the family house]2424-the family house , in [the country]370-the country , on business connected with [the local management of [the estates]2427-the estates]2426-the local management of the estates . [Ralph]39-ralph still retained all [his]84-mr. bernard old dislike of [the steward]366-the steward 's accounts and [the lawyer]2429-the lawyer 's consultations ; but [he]84-mr. bernard felt bound , out of gratitude for [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's special kindness to [him]84-mr. bernard since [his]84-mr. bernard return to [England]1-england , to put a constraint on [his]84-mr. bernard own inclinations , and go to [the country]370-the country as [he]84-mr. bernard was desired . [He]84-mr. bernard did not expect to be absent more than two or three days ; but earnestly charged [me]0-i to write to [him]84-mr. bernard , if [I]0-i had any news from [the hospital]3549-the hospital while [he]84-mr. bernard was away .

During the week , [Clara]57-clara came twice to see [me]0-i - escaping from [home]176-home by stealth , as before . On each occasion , [she]57-clara showed the same affectionate anxiety to set [me]0-i an example of cheerfulness , and to sustain [me]0-i in hope . [I]0-i saw , with a sorrow and apprehension which [I]0-i could not altogether conceal from [her]57-clara , that the weary look in [her]57-clara face had never changed , never diminished since [I]0-i had first observed it . [Ralph]39-ralph had , from motives of delicacy , avoided increasing the hidden anxieties which were but too evidently preying upon [her]57-clara health , by keeping [her]57-clara in perfect ignorance of [our]2434-our visit to [the hospital]3549-the hospital , and , indeed , of the particulars of all [our]2434-our proceedings since [his]84-mr. bernard return . [I]0-i took care to preserve the same secrecy , during [her]57-clara short interviews with [me]0-i . [She]57-clara bade [me]0-i farewell after [her]57-clara third visit , with a sadness which [she]57-clara vainly endeavoured to hide . [I]0-i little thought , then , that the tones of [her]57-clara sweet , clear voice had fallen on [my]0-i ear for the last time , before [I]0-i wandered to [the far West of [England]1-england]131-the far west of england where [I]0-i now write .

At the end of the week - it was on a Saturday , [I]0-i remember - [I]0-i left [[my]0-i lodgings]2437-my lodgings early in the morning , to go into [the country]370-the country ; with no intention of returning before evening . [I]0-i had felt a sense of oppression , on rising , which was almost unendurable . The perspiration stood thick on [my]0-i forehead , though the day was not unusually hot ; the air of [London]10-london grew harder and harder to breathe , with every minute ; [my]0-i heart felt tightened to bursting ; [my]0-i temples throbbed with fever - fury ; [my]0-i very life seemed to depend on escaping into pure air , into [some place where there was shade from trees]2439-some place where there was shade from trees , and [water that ran cool and refreshing to look on]2440-water that ran cool and refreshing to look on . So [I]0-i set forth , careless in what direction [I]0-i went ; and remained in [the country]370-the country all day . Evening was changing into night as [I]0-i got back to [London]10-london .

[I]0-i inquired of [the servant at [[my]0-i lodging]2419-my lodging]2442-the servant at my lodging , when [she]2442-the servant at my lodging let [me]0-i in , whether any letter had arrived for [me]0-i . [She]2442-the servant at my lodging answered , that one had come just after [I]0-i had gone out in the morning , and that it was lying on [my]0-i table . [My]0-i first glance at it , showed [me]0-i [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard 's name written in the corner of the envelope . [I]0-i eagerly opened the letter , and read these words :

" Private .[0-i]

" Friday .[0-i]

" [[My]0-i DEAR]3163-my dear SIR ,[0-i]

" On the enclosed slip of paper [you]3163-my dear will find the address of [the young woman]4641-the young woman , of whom [[your]3163-my dear brother]3328-your brother spoke to [me]0-i when [we]4643-we met at [the hospital]3549-the hospital . [I]0-i regret to say , that the circumstances under which [I]0-i have obtained information of [[her]4641-the young woman residence]4645-her residence , are of the most melancholy nature .[0-i]

" The plan which [I]0-i arranged for discovering [[her]4641-the young woman abode]4646-her abode , in accordance with [[your]3163-my dear brother]3328-your brother 's suggestion , proved useless . [The young woman]4641-the young woman never came to [the hospital]3549-the hospital a second time . [Her]4641-the young woman address was given to [me]0-i this morning , by [[Turner]81-turner [himself]4650-turner himself]4650-turner himself ; who begged that [I]0-i would visit [her]4641-the young woman professionally , as [he]4650-turner himself had no confidence in [the medical man who was then in attendance on [her]4641-the young woman]4651-the medical man who was then in attendance on her . Many circumstances combined to make [my]0-i compliance with [his]4650-turner himself request anything but easy or desirable ; but knowing that [you]3163-my dear - or [[your]3163-my dear brother]3328-your brother [I]0-i ought , perhaps , rather to say - were interested in [the young woman]4641-the young woman , [I]0-i determined to take the very earliest opportunity of seeing [her]4641-the young woman , and consulting with [[her]4641-the young woman medical attendant]4654-her medical attendant . [I]0-i could not get to [her]4641-the young woman till late in the afternoon . When [I]0-i arrived , [I]0-i found [her]4641-the young woman suffering from one of the worst attacks of Typhus [I]0-i ever remember to have seen ; and [I]0-i think it [my]0-i duty to state candidly , that [I]0-i believe [her]4641-the young woman life to be in imminent danger . At the same time , it is right to inform [you]3163-my dear that [the gentleman in attendance on [her]4641-the young woman]4655-the gentleman in attendance on her does not share [my]0-i opinion : [he]4655-the gentleman in attendance on her still thinks there is a good chance of saving [her]4641-the young woman .[0-i]

" There can be no doubt whatever , that [she]4641-the young woman was infected with Typhus at [the hospital]3549-the hospital . [You]3163-my dear may remember [my]0-i telling [you]3163-my dear , how [her]4641-the young woman agitation appeared to have deprived [her]4641-the young woman of self - possession , when [she]4641-the young woman entered [the ward]4580-the ward ; and how [she]4641-the young woman ran to the wrong bed , before [the nurse]3820-the nurse could stop [her]4641-the young woman . [The man whom [she]4641-the young woman thus mistook for [Turner]81-turner]4659-the man whom she thus mistook for turner , was suffering from fever which had not then specifically declared itself ; but which did so declare itself , as a Typhus fever , on the morning when [you]3163-my dear and [[your]3163-my dear brother]3328-your brother came to [the hospital]3549-the hospital . [This man]656-this man 's disorder must have been infectious when [the young woman]4641-the young woman stooped down close over [him]656-this man , under the impression that [he]656-this man was [the person [she]4641-the young woman had come to see]4664-the person she had come to see . Although [she]4641-the young woman started back at once , on discovering [her]4641-the young woman mistake , [she]4641-the young woman had breathed the infection into [her]4641-the young woman system - [her]4641-the young woman mental agitation at the time , accompanied as [I]0-i have since understood by some physical weakness , rendering [her]4641-the young woman specially liable to the danger to which [she]4641-the young woman had accidentally exposed [herself]4641-the young woman .[0-i]

" Since the first symptoms of [her]4641-the young woman disease appeared , on Saturday last , [I]0-i can not find that any error has been committed in the medical treatment , as reported to [me]0-i . [I]0-i remained some time by [her]4641-the young woman bedside to - day , observing [her]4641-the young woman . The delirium which is , more or less , an invariable result of Typhus , is particularly marked in [her]4641-the young woman case , and manifests itself both by speech and gesture . It has been found impossible to quiet [her]4641-the young woman , by any means hitherto tried . While [I]0-i was watching by [her]4641-the young woman , [she]4641-the young woman never ceased calling on [your]4665-you name , and entreating to see [you]4665-you . [I]0-i am informed by [[her]4641-the young woman medical attendant]4654-her medical attendant , that [her]4641-the young woman wanderings have almost invariably taken this direction for the last four - and - twenty hours . Occasionally [she]4641-the young woman mixes other names with [yours]4665-you , and mentions them in terms of abhorrence ; but [her]4641-the young woman persistency in calling for [your]4665-you presence , is so remarkable that [I]0-i am tempted , merely from what [I]0-i have heard [myself]0-i ; to suggest that [you]4665-you really should go to [her]4641-the young woman , on the bare chance that [you]4665-you might exercise some tranquillising influence . At the same time , if [you]4665-you fear infection , or for any private reasons into which [I]0-i have neither the right nor the wish to inquire feel unwilling to take the course [I]0-i have pointed out , do not by any means consider it [your]4665-you duty to accede to [my]0-i proposal . [I]0-i can conscientiously assure [you]4665-you that duty is not involved in it .[0-i]

" [I]0-i have , however , another suggestion to make , which is of a positive nature , and which [I]0-i am sure will meet with [your]4665-you approval . It is , that [[her]4641-the young woman parents]1231-her parents , or some of [[her]4641-the young woman other relations]4668-her other relations , if [[her]4641-the young woman parents]1231-her parents are not alive , should be informed of [her]4641-the young woman situation . Possibly , [you]4665-you may know something of [her]4641-the young woman connections , and can therefore do this good office . [She]4641-the young woman is dying in [a strange place]4670-a strange place , among people who avoid [her]4641-the young woman as [they]4671-they would avoid a pestilence . Even though it be only to bury [her]4641-the young woman , [some relation]4672-some relation ought to be immediately summoned to [her]4641-the young woman bed - side .[0-i]

" [I]0-i shall visit [her]4641-the young woman twice to - morrow , in the morning and at night . If [you]4665-you are not willing to risk seeing [her]4641-the young woman and [I]0-i repeat that it is in no sense imperative that [you]4665-you should combat such unwillingness , perhaps [you]4665-you will communicate with [me]0-i at [[my]0-i private address]4673-my private address .[0-i]

" [I]0-i remain , [dear Sir]3566-dear sir ,[0-i]

" Faithfully [yours]4665-you ,[0-i]

" [JOHN BERNARD]84-mr. bernard .[0-i]

" P. S. - [I]0-i open [my]0-i letter again , to inform [you]4665-you that [Turner]81-turner , acting against all advice , has left [the hospital]3549-the hospital to - day . [He]81-turner attempted to go on Tuesday last , when , [I]0-i believe , [he]81-turner first received information of [the young woman]4641-the young woman 's serious illness , but was seized with a violent attack of giddiness , on attempting to walk , and fell down just outside the door of [the ward]4580-the ward . On this second occasion , however , [he]81-turner has succeeded in getting away without any accident - as far , at least , as [the persons employed about [the hospital]3549-the hospital]4678-the persons employed about the hospital can tell . "[0-i]

When the letter fell from [my]0-i trembling hand , when [I]0-i first asked of [my]0-i own heart the fearful question : - " Have [I]0-i , to whom the mere thought of ever seeing [this woman]2035-this woman again has been as a pollution to shrink from , the strength to stand by [her]2444-her death - bed , the courage to see [her]2444-her die ? "[0-i] - then , and not till then , did [I]0-i really know how suffering had fortified , while it had humbled [me]0-i ; how affliction has the power to purify , as well as to pain .

All bitter memory of the ill that [she]2444-her had done [me]0-i , of the misery [I]0-i had suffered at [her]2444-her hands , lost its hold on [my]0-i mind . Once more , [[her]2444-her mother]319-her mother 's last words of earthly lament - " Oh , who will pray for [her]2444-her when [I]319-her mother am gone ! "[319-her mother] seemed to be murmuring in [my]0-i ear - murmuring in harmony with the divine words in which the Voice from [the Mount of Olives]24-the mount of olives taught forgiveness of injuries to [all mankind]2446-all mankind .

[She]2444-her was dying : dying among [strangers]300-strangers in the pining madness of fever - and [the one being of all who knew [her]2444-her , whose presence at [her]2444-her bedside might yet bring calmness to [her]2444-her last moments , and give [her]2444-her quietly and tenderly to death]2448-the one being of all who knew her , whose presence at her bedside might yet bring calmness to her last moments , and give her quietly and tenderly to death , was [the man whom [she]2444-her had pitilessly deceived and dishonoured , whose youth [she]2444-her had ruined , whose hopes [she]2444-her had wrecked for ever]2449-the man whom she had pitilessly deceived and dishonoured , whose youth she had ruined , whose hopes she had wrecked for ever . Strangely had destiny brought [us]2450-us together - terribly had it separated [us]2450-us - awfully would it now unite [us]2450-us again , at the end !

What were [my]0-i wrongs , heavy as they had been ; what [my]0-i sufferings , poignant as they still were , that they should stand between [this dying woman]2451-this dying woman , and the last hope of awakening [her]2444-her to the consciousness that [she]2444-her was going before the throne of [God]37-god ? The sole resource for [her]2444-her which human skill and human pity could now suggest , embraced the sole chance that [she]2444-her might still be recovered for repentance , before [she]2444-her was resigned to death . How did [I]0-i know , but that in those ceaseless cries which had uttered [my]0-i name , there spoke the last earthly anguish of the tortured spirit , calling upon [me]0-i for one drop of water to cool its burning guilt - one drop from the waters of Peace ?

[I]0-i took up [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard 's letter from the floor on which it had fallen , and re - directed it to [[my]0-i brother]154-my brother ; simply writing on a blank place in the inside , " [I]2444-her have gone to soothe [her]2444-her last moments . "[2444-her] Before [I]0-i departed , [I]0-i wrote to [[her]2444-her father]1224-her father , and summoned [him]1224-her father to [her]2444-her bedside . The guilt of [his]1224-her father absence - if [his]1224-her father heartless and hardened nature did not change towards [her]2444-her - would now rest with [him]1224-her father , and not with [me]0-i . [I]0-i forbore from thinking how [he]1224-her father would answer [my]0-i letter ; for [I]0-i remembered [his]1224-her father written words to [[my]0-i brother]154-my brother , declaring that [he]1224-her father would accuse [[his]1224-her father daughter]233-his daughter of having caused [[her]2444-her mother]319-her mother 's death ; and [I]0-i suspected [him]1224-her father even then , of wishing to shift the shame of [his]1224-her father conduct towards [[his]1224-her father unhappy wife]2457-his unhappy wife from [himself]1224-her father to [[his]1224-her father child]322-his child .

After writing this second letter , [I]0-i set forth instantly for [the house to which [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard had directed [me]0-i]2459-the house to which mr. bernard had directed me . No thought of [myself]0-i ; no thought , even , of the peril suggested by the ominous disclosure about [Mannion]73-mannion , in the postscript to [the surgeon]3550-the surgeon 's letter , ever crossed [my]0-i mind . In the great stillness , in the heavenly serenity that had come to [my]0-i spirit , the wasting fire of every sensation which was only of [this world]195-this world , seemed quenched for ever .

It was eleven o'clock when [I]0-i arrived at [the house]244-the house . [A slatternly , sulky woman]2463-a slatternly , sulky woman opened the door to [me]0-i . " Oh ! " [I]2463-a slatternly , sulky woman wish [you]0-i were [the undertaker]4682-the undertaker , to get [her]2463-a slatternly , sulky woman out of [[my]2463-a slatternly , sulky woman house]3400-my house before [we]4684-we all catch [our]4684-we deaths of [her]2463-a slatternly , sulky woman ! "[2463-a slatternly , sulky woman]

As [I]0-i took the candle from [her]2463-a slatternly , sulky woman hand , [I]0-i saw that [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard was approaching [me]0-i from the stairs .

" There is no hope , then ? "[84-mr. bernard]

" In [my]84-mr. bernard opinion , none . " Yes , as incessantly as ever . "[84-mr. bernard]

" Then [I]84-mr. bernard am ready to go to [her]2463-a slatternly , sulky woman bedside . "[84-mr. bernard]

" Pray believe that [I]2464-i feel deeply what a sacrifice [you]0-i are making . "[2464-i] [He]2464-i paused , and took [my]0-i hand very kindly ; then added : " [I]2464-i am sure [you]0-i will think [yourself]0-i rewarded for any trial to [your]0-i feelings to - night , if [you]0-i can only remember in years to come , that [your]0-i presence quieted [her]4693-a near and dear relative of one of my oldest friends in [her]4693-a near and dear relative of one of my oldest friends last moments ! "[2464-i]

[I]0-i felt [his]2464-i sympathy and delicacy too strongly to thank [him]2464-i in words ; [I]0-i could only look [my]0-i gratitude as [he]2464-i asked [me]0-i to follow [him]2464-i up [stairs]1197-stairs .

[We]2466-we entered [the room]263-the room softly . Once more , and for the last time in [this world]195-this world , [I]0-i stood in the presence of [Margaret Sherwin]44-margaret .

Not even to see [her]44-margaret , as [I]0-i had last seen [her]44-margaret , was such a sight of misery as to behold [her]44-margaret now , forsaken on [her]44-margaret deathbed , to look at [her]44-margaret , as [she]44-margaret lay with [her]44-margaret head turned from [me]0-i , fretfully covering and uncovering [her]44-margaret face with the loose tresses of [her]44-margaret long black hair , and muttering [my]0-i name incessantly in [her]44-margaret fever - dream : " [Basil]46-basil ! Oh , where , where , where ! "[44-margaret]

" [He]46-basil is here , "[3241-the doctor] said [the doctor]3241-the doctor , taking the candle from [my]0-i hand , and holding it , so that the light fell full on [my]0-i face . Still [she]44-margaret never moved ; still those hoarse , fierce , quick tones - that voice , once the music that [my]0-i heart beat to ; now the discord that it writhed under - muttered faster and faster : " [Basil]46-basil ! " [He]46-basil is here , "[84-mr. bernard] repeated [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard loudly . " Look ! look up at [him]46-basil ! "[84-mr. bernard]

[She]44-margaret turned in an instant , and tore the hair back from [her]44-margaret face . For a moment , [I]0-i forced [myself]0-i to look at [her]44-margaret ; for a moment , [I]0-i confronted the smouldering fever in [her]44-margaret cheeks ; the glare of the bloodshot eyes ; the distortion of the parched lips ; the hideous clutching of the outstretched fingers at the empty air - but the agony of that sight was more than [I]0-i could endure : [I]0-i turned away [my]0-i head , and hid [my]0-i face in horror .

" Compose [yourself]0-i , "[3241-the doctor] whispered [the doctor]3241-the doctor . " Now [she]44-margaret is quiet , speak to [her]44-margaret ; speak to [her]44-margaret before [she]44-margaret begins again ; call [her]44-margaret by [her]44-margaret name . "[3241-the doctor]

[Her]44-margaret name ! Could [my]0-i lips utter it at such a moment as this ?

" Quick ! quick ! "[84-mr. bernard] cried [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard . " Try [her]44-margaret while [you]0-i have the chance . "[84-mr. bernard]

[I]0-i struggled against the memories of the past , and spoke to [her]44-margaret - [God]37-god knows as gently , if not as happily , as in the bygone time !

" [Margaret]44-margaret , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [Margaret]44-margaret , [you]44-margaret asked for [me]0-i , and [I]0-i have come . "[0-i]

[She]44-margaret tossed [her]44-margaret arms above [her]44-margaret head with a shrill scream , frightfully prolonged till it ended in low moanings and murmurings ; then turned [her]44-margaret face from [us]2471-us again , and pulled [her]44-margaret hair over it once more .

" [I]3241-the doctor am afraid [she]44-margaret is too far gone , "[3241-the doctor] said [the doctor]3241-the doctor ; " but make another trial . "[3241-the doctor]

" [Margaret]44-margaret , "[0-i] [I]0-i said again , " have [you]44-margaret forgotten [me]0-i ? [Margaret]44-margaret ! "[0-i]

[She]44-margaret looked at [me]0-i once more . This time , [her]44-margaret dry , dull eyes seemed to soften , and [her]44-margaret fingers twined themselves less passionately in [her]44-margaret hair . [She]44-margaret began to laugh - a low , vacant , terrible laugh .

" Yes , yes , "[44-margaret] [she]44-margaret said , " [I]44-margaret know [he]4695-he 's come at last ; [I]44-margaret can make [him]4695-he do anything . [We]4696-we do n't care about [each other]102-each other . Come ! [I]44-margaret 'll tell [the clergyman]1242-the clergyman to read the service backwards ; that makes a marriage no marriage at all , [everybody]361-everybody knows . "[44-margaret]

As the last wild words escaped [her]2473-her , [some one below stairs]2474-some one below stairs called to [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard . [He]84-mr. bernard went out for a minute , then returned again , telling [me]0-i that [he]84-mr. bernard was summoned to a case of sudden illness which [he]84-mr. bernard must attend without a moment 's delay .

" [The medical man whom [I]84-mr. bernard found here when [I]84-mr. bernard first came]4704-the medical man whom i found here when i first came , "[84-mr. bernard] [he]84-mr. bernard said , " was sent for this evening into [the country]370-the country , to be consulted about an operation , [I]84-mr. bernard believe . [I]84-mr. bernard will get back , however , as soon as possible , and see [her]4707-her again ; [she]4707-her seems to be a little quieter already , and may become quieter still , if [you]0-i stay longer . [The night - nurse]4708-the night - nurse is below - [I]84-mr. bernard will send [her]4707-her up as [I]84-mr. bernard go [downstairs]3774-downstairs . Keep [the room]263-the room well ventilated , the windows open as they are now . Do n't breathe too close to [her]4707-her , and [you]0-i need fear no infection . Look ! [her]4707-her eyes are still fixed on [you]0-i . This is the first time [I]84-mr. bernard have seen [her]4707-her look in the same direction for two minutes together ; [one]1904-one would think [she]4707-her really recognised [you]0-i . [He]2475-he hastily left [the room]263-the room . [I]0-i turned to the bed , and saw that [she]2477-i was still looking at [me]0-i . [She]2477-i had never ceased murmuring to [herself]2477-i while [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard was speaking ; and [she]2477-i did not stop when [the nurse]3820-the nurse came in .

The first sight of [this woman]2035-this woman , on [her]2477-i entrance , sickened and shocked [me]0-i . All that was naturally repulsive in [her]2477-i , was made doubly revolting by the characteristics of [the habitual drunkard]2480-the habitual drunkard , lowering and glaring at [me]0-i in [her]2477-i purple , bloated face . To see [her]2477-i heavy hands shaking at the pillow , as [they]2481-they tried mechanically to arrange it ; to see [her]2477-i stand , alternately leering and scowling by the bedside , an incarnate blasphemy in the sacred chamber of death , was to behold the most horrible of all mockeries , the most impious of all profanations . No loneliness in the presence of mortal agony could try [me]0-i to the quick , as the sight of that foul old age of degradation and debauchery , defiling [the sick room]2264-the sick room , now tried [me]0-i . [I]0-i determined to wait alone by the bedside till [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard returned .

With some difficulty , [I]0-i made [the wretched drunkard]2483-the wretched drunkard understand that [she]2477-i might go [downstairs]3774-downstairs again ; and that [I]0-i would call [her]2477-i if [she]2477-i was wanted . At last , [she]2477-i comprehended [my]0-i meaning , and slowly quitted [the room]263-the room . The door closed on [her]2477-i ; and [I]0-i was left alone to watch the last moments of [the woman who had ruined [me]0-i]2486-the woman who had ruined me !

As [I]0-i sat down near the open window , the sounds outside in [the street]163-the street told of the waning of the night . There was an echo of many footsteps , a hoarse murmur of conflicting voices , now near , now afar off . [The public houses]2488-the public houses were dispersing [[their]2488-the public houses drunken crowds]2489-their drunken crowds - the crowds of a Saturday night : it was twelve o'clock .

Through [those street]2490-those street - sounds of fierce ribaldry and ghastly mirth , the voice of [the dying woman]2491-the dying woman penetrated , speaking more slowly , more distinctly , more terribly than it had spoken yet .

" [I]2477-i see [him]4712-him , "[2477-i] [she]2477-i said , staring vacantly at [me]0-i , and moving [her]2477-i hands slowly to and fro in the air . " [I]2477-i see [him]4712-him ! But [he]4712-him 's a long way off ; [he]4712-him ca n't hear [our]4713-us secrets , and [he]4712-him does not suspect [you]0-i as [mother]1225-mother does . Do n't tell [me]2477-i that about [him]4712-him any more ; [my]2477-i flesh creeps at it ! What are [you]0-i looking at [me]2477-i in that way for ? [You]0-i make [me]2477-i feel on fire . [You]0-i know [I]2477-i like [you]0-i , because [I]2477-i must like [you]0-i ; because [I]2477-i ca n't help it . It 's no use saying hush : [I]2477-i tell [you]0-i [he]4712-him ca n't hear [us]4713-us , and ca n't see [us]4713-us . [He]4712-him can see nothing ; [you]0-i make a fool of [him]4712-him , and [I]2477-i make a fool of [him]4712-him . But mind ! [I]2477-i will ride in [[my]2477-i own carriage]4715-my own carriage : [you]0-i must keep things secret enough to let [me]2477-i do that . [I]2477-i say [I]2477-i will ride in [[my]2477-i carriage]3457-my carriage : and [I]2477-i 'll go where [father]477-father walks to business : [I]2477-i do n't care if [I]2477-i splash [him]4712-him with [my]2477-i carriage wheels ! [I]2477-i 'll be even with [him]4712-him for some of the passions [he]4712-him 's been in with [me]2477-i . [You]0-i see how [I]2477-i 'll go into [[our]4718-us shop]4719-our shop and order dresses ! be quiet ! [I]2477-i say [he]4712-him ca n't hear [us]4718-us . [I]2477-i 'll have velvet where [[his]4712-him sister]3454-his sister has silk , and silk where [she]3454-his sister has muslin : [I]2477-i 'm [a finer girl]4721-a finer girl than [she]3454-his sister is , and [I]2477-i 'll be better dressed . Tell [him]4712-him anything , indeed ! What have [I]2477-i ever let out ? It 's not so easy always to make believe [I]2477-i 'm in love with [him]4712-him , after what [you]0-i have told [me]2477-i . Suppose [he]4712-him found [us]4718-us out ? - Rash ? [I]2477-i 'm no more rash than [you]0-i are ! Why did n't [you]0-i come back from [France]2-france in time , and stop it all ? Why did [you]0-i let [me]2477-i marry [him]4712-him ? [A nice wife]4722-a nice wife [I]2477-i 've been to [him]4712-him , and [a nice husband]4723-a nice husband [he]4712-him has been to [me]2477-i - [a husband who waits a year]4724-a husband who waits a year ! Ha ! ha ! [he]4712-him calls [himself]4712-him [a man]3101-a man , does n't [he]4712-him ? [A husband who waits a year]4724-a husband who waits a year ! "[2477-i]

[I]0-i approached nearer to the bedside , and spoke to [her]2492-you again , in the hope to win [her]2492-you tenderly towards dreaming of better things . [I]0-i know not whether [she]2492-you heard [me]0-i , but [her]2492-you wild thoughts changed - changed darkly to later events .

" Beds ! beds ! "[2492-you] [she]2492-you cried , " beds everywhere , with [dying men]4727-dying men on them ! And one bed the most terrible of all - look at it ! The deformed face , with the white of the pillow all round it ! [His]4712-him face ? [his]4712-him face , that had n't a fault in it ? Never ! It 's the face of [a devil]4728-a devil ; the finger - nails of [the devil]4488-the devil are on it ! Take [me]2492-you away ! drag [me]2492-you out ! [I]2492-you ca n't move for that face : it 's always before [me]2492-you : it 's walling [me]2492-you up among the beds : it 's burning [me]2492-you all over . Water ! water ! drown [me]2492-you in [the sea]498-the sea ; drown [me]2492-you deep , away from the burning face ! "[2492-you]

" Hush , [Margaret]44-margaret ! hush ! drink this , and [you]2492-you will be cool again . "[0-i] [I]0-i gave [her]2492-you some lemonade , which stood by the bedside .

" Yes , yes ; hush , as [you]2492-you say . Where 's [Robert]73-mannion ? [Robert Mannion]73-mannion ? Not here ! then [I]2493-i 've got a secret for [you]2492-you . When [you]2492-you go [home]176-home to - night , [Basil]46-basil , and say [your]2492-you prayers , pray for a storm of thunder and lightning ; and pray that [I]2493-i may be struck dead in it , and [Robert]73-mannion too . It 's a fortnight to [[my]2493-i aunt]3062-my aunt 's party ; and in a fortnight [you]2492-you 'll wish [us]4733-us both dead , so [you]2492-you had better pray for what [I]2493-i tell [you]2492-you in time . [We]4733-us shall make [handsome corpses]4734-handsome corpses .
