Put roses into [my]2493-i coffin - scarlet roses , if [you]2492-you can find any , because that stands for [Scarlet Woman]88-scarlet woman - in the Bible , [you]2492-you know . Scarlet ? What do [I]2493-i care ! It 's the boldest colour in [the world]158-the world . [Robert]73-mannion will tell [you]2492-you , and all [[your]2492-you family]953-your family , how many [women]326-women are as scarlet as [I]2493-i am - [virtue]4738-virtue wears it at [home]176-home , in secret ; and [vice]4740-vice wears it abroad , in public : that 's the only difference , [he]73-mannion says . Scarlet roses ! scarlet roses ! throw them into the coffin by hundreds ; smother [me]2493-i up in them ; bury [me]2493-i down deep ; in [the dark , quiet street]4741-the dark , quiet street - where there 's a broad door - step in front of [a house]1982-a house , and a white , wild face , something like [Basil]46-basil 's , that 's always staring on the doorstep awfully . Oh , why did [I]2493-i meet [him]73-mannion ! why did [I]2493-i marry [him]73-mannion ! oh , why ! why ! "[2493-i]

[She]2493-i uttered the last words in slow , measured cadence - the horrible mockery of a chaunt which [she]2493-i used to play to [us]2494-us at [North Villa]11-north villa , on Sunday evenings . Then [her]2493-i voice sank again ; [her]2493-i articulation thickened , and grew indistinct . It was like the change from darkness to daylight , in the sight of sleepless eyes , to hear [her]2493-i only murmuring now , after hearing [her]2493-i last terrible words .

The weary night - time passed on . Longer and longer grew the intervals of silence between the scattered noises from [the streets]241-the streets ; less and less frequent were the sounds of [distant carriage - wheels]2496-distant carriage - wheels , and the echoing rapid footsteps of [late pleasure - seekers]2497-late pleasure - seekers hurrying [home]176-home . At last , the heavy tramp of [the policeman]3540-the policeman going [his]3540-the policeman rounds , alone disturbed the silence of the early morning hours . Still , the voice from the bed muttered incessantly ; but now , in drowsy , languid tones : still , [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard did not return : still [the father of [the dying girl]2501-the dying girl]2500-the father of the dying girl never came , never obeyed the letter which summoned [him]2500-the father of the dying girl for the last time to [her]2501-the dying girl side .

There was yet one more among [the absent - one from whose approach the death - bed must be kept sacred]2502-the absent - one from whose approach the death - bed must be kept sacred ; [one , whose evil presence was to be dreaded as a pestilence and a scourge]2503-one , whose evil presence was to be dreaded as a pestilence and a scourge . [Mannion]73-mannion ! - where was [Mannion]73-mannion ?

[I]0-i sat by the window , resigned to wait in loneliness till the end came , watching mechanically the vacant eyes that ever watched [me]0-i - when , suddenly , the face of [Margaret]44-margaret seemed to fade out of [my]0-i sight . [I]0-i started and looked round . The candle , which [I]0-i had placed at the opposite end of [the room]263-the room , had burnt down without [my]0-i noticing it , and was now expiring in the socket . [I]0-i ran to light the fresh candle which lay on the table by its side , but was too late . The wick flickered its last ; [the room]263-the room was left in darkness .

While [I]0-i felt among the different objects under [my]0-i hands for a box of matches : [Margaret]44-margaret 's voice strengthened again .

" Innocent ! innocent ! "[44-margaret] [I]0-i heard [her]44-margaret cry mournfully through the darkness . " [I]44-margaret 'll swear [I]44-margaret 'm innocent , and [father]477-father is sure to swear it too . [Innocent Margaret]44-margaret ! Oh , [me]44-margaret ! what innocence ! "[44-margaret]

[She]44-margaret repeated these words over and over again , till the hearing them seemed to bewilder all [my]0-i senses . [I]0-i hardly knew what [I]0-i touched . Suddenly , [my]0-i searching hands stopped of themselves , [I]0-i could not tell why . Was there some change in [the room]263-the room ? Was there more air in it , as if a door had been opened ? Was there something moving over the floor ? Had [Margaret]44-margaret left [her]44-margaret bed ? - No ! the mournful voice was speaking unintermittingly , and speaking from the same distance .

[I]0-i moved to search for the matches on a chest of drawers , which stood near the window . Though the morning was at its darkest , and [the house]244-the house stood midway between two gas - lamps , there was a glimmering of light in [this place]3077-this place . [I]0-i looked back into [the room]263-the room from the window , and thought [I]0-i saw something shadowy moving near the bed . " Take [him]4744-him away ! "[0-i] [I]0-i heard [Margaret]44-margaret scream in [her]44-margaret wildest tones . " [His]4744-him hands are on [me]44-margaret : [he]4744-him 's feeling [my]44-margaret face , to feel if [I]44-margaret 'm dead ! "[44-margaret]

[I]0-i ran to [her]44-margaret , striking against some piece of furniture in the darkness . Something passed swiftly between [me]0-i and the bed , as [I]0-i got near it . [I]0-i thought [I]0-i heard a door close . Then there was silence for a moment ; and then , as [I]0-i stretched out [my]0-i hands , [my]0-i right hand encountered the little table placed by [Margaret]44-margaret 's side , and the next moment [I]0-i felt the match - box that had been left on it .

As [I]0-i struck a light , [her]44-margaret voice repeated close at [my]0-i ear :

" [His]4745-his hands are on [me]44-margaret : [he]4745-his 's feeling [my]44-margaret face to feel if [I]44-margaret 'm dead ! "[44-margaret]

The match flared up . As [I]0-i carried it to the candle , [I]0-i looked round , and noticed for the first time that there was a second door , at the further corner of [the room]263-the room , which lighted [some inner apartment]2511-some inner apartment through glass panes at the top . When [I]0-i tried this door , it was locked on the inside , and [the room beyond]2512-the room beyond was dark .

Dark and silent . But was [no one there , hidden in that darkness and silence]2513-no one there , hidden in that darkness and silence ? Was there any doubt now , that stealthy feet had approached [Margaret]44-margaret , that stealthy hands had touched [her]44-margaret , while [the room]263-the room was in obscurity ? - Doubt ? There was none on that point , none on any other . Suspicion shaped itself into conviction in an instant , and identified [the stranger who had passed in the darkness between [me]0-i and the bedside]2515-the stranger who had passed in the darkness between me and the bedside , with [the man whose presence [I]0-i had dreaded , as the presence of [an evil spirit in the chamber of death]2517-an evil spirit in the chamber of death]2516-the man whose presence i had dreaded , as the presence of an evil spirit in the chamber of death .

[He]2516-the man whose presence i had dreaded , as the presence of an evil spirit in the chamber of death was waiting secretly in [the house]244-the house - waiting for [her]44-margaret last moments ; listening for [her]44-margaret last words ; watching [his]2516-the man whose presence i had dreaded , as the presence of an evil spirit in the chamber of death opportunity , perhaps , to enter [the room]263-the room again , and openly profane it by [his]2516-the man whose presence i had dreaded , as the presence of an evil spirit in the chamber of death presence ! [I]0-i placed [myself]0-i by the door , resolved , if [he]2516-the man whose presence i had dreaded , as the presence of an evil spirit in the chamber of death approached , to thrust [him]2516-the man whose presence i had dreaded , as the presence of an evil spirit in the chamber of death back , at any hazard , from the bedside . How long [I]0-i remained absorbed in watching before the darkness of [the inner room]2520-the inner room , [I]0-i know not - but some time must have elapsed before the silence around [me]0-i forced itself suddenly on [my]0-i attention . [I]0-i turned towards [Margaret]44-margaret ; and , in an instant , all previous thoughts were suspended in [my]0-i mind , by the sight that now met [my]0-i eyes .

[She]44-margaret had altered completely . [Her]44-margaret hands , so restless hitherto , lay quite still over the coverlid ; [her]44-margaret lips never moved ; the whole expression of [her]44-margaret face had changed - the fever - traces remained on every feature , and yet the fever - look was gone . [Her]44-margaret eyes were almost closed ; [her]44-margaret quick breathing had grown calm and slow . [I]0-i touched [her]44-margaret pulse ; it was beating with a wayward , fluttering gentleness . What did this striking alteration indicate ? [Recovery]89-recovery ? Was it possible ? As the idea crossed [my]0-i mind , every one of [my]0-i faculties became absorbed in the sole occupation of watching [her]44-margaret face ; [I]0-i could not have stirred an instant from the bed , for worlds .

The earliest dawn of day was glimmering faintly at the window , before another change appeared - before [she]44-margaret drew a long , sighing breath , and slowly opened [her]44-margaret eyes on [mine]0-i . [Their]2521-their first look was very strange and startling to behold ; for it was the look that was natural to [her]44-margaret ; the calm look of consciousness , restored to what it had always been in the past time . It lasted only for a moment . [She]44-margaret recognised [me]0-i ; and , instantly , an expression of anguish and shame flew over the first terror and surprise of [her]44-margaret face . [She]44-margaret struggled vainly to lift [her]44-margaret hands - so busy all through the night ; so idle now ! A faint moan of supplication breathed from [her]44-margaret lips ; and [she]44-margaret slowly turned [her]44-margaret head on the pillow , so as to hide [her]44-margaret face from [my]0-i sight .

" Oh , [[my]44-margaret God]3522-my god ! [[my]44-margaret God]3522-my god ! "[44-margaret] [she]44-margaret murmured , in low , wailing tones , " [I]44-margaret 've broken [his]4748-his heart , and [he]4748-his still comes here to be kind to [me]44-margaret ! This is worse than death ! [I]44-margaret 'm too bad to be forgiven - leave [me]44-margaret ! leave [me]44-margaret ! - oh , [Basil]46-basil , leave [me]44-margaret to die ! "[44-margaret]

[I]0-i spoke to [her]44-margaret ; but desisted almost immediately - desisted even from uttering [her]44-margaret name . At the mere sound of [my]0-i voice , [her]44-margaret suffering rose to agony ; the wild despair of the soul wrestling awfully with the writhing weakness of the body , uttered itself in words and cries horrible , beyond all imagination , to hear . [I]0-i sank down on [my]0-i knees by the bedside ; the strength which had sustained [me]0-i for hours , gave way in an instant , and [I]0-i burst into a passion of tears , as [my]0-i spirit poured from [my]0-i lips in supplication for [hers]44-margaret - tears that did not humiliate [me]0-i ; for [I]0-i knew , while [I]0-i shed them , that [I]0-i had forgiven [her]44-margaret !

The dawn brightened . Gradually , as the fair light of the new day flowed in lovely upon [her]44-margaret bed ; as the fresh morning breeze lifted tenderly and playfully the scattered locks of [her]44-margaret hair that lay over the pillow - so , the calmness began to come back to [her]44-margaret voice and the stillness of repose to [her]44-margaret limbs . But [she]44-margaret never turned [her]44-margaret face to [me]0-i again ; never , when the wild words of [her]44-margaret despair grew fewer and fainter ; never , when the last faint supplication to [me]0-i , to leave [her]44-margaret to die forsaken as [she]44-margaret deserved , ended mournfully in a long , moaning gasp for breath . [I]0-i waited after this - waited a long time - then spoke to [her]44-margaret softly - then waited once more ; hearing [her]44-margaret still breathe , but slowly and more slowly with every minute - then spoke to [her]44-margaret for the second time , louder than before . [She]44-margaret never answered , and never moved . Was [she]44-margaret sleeping ? [I]0-i could not tell . Some influence seemed to hold [me]0-i back from going to the other side of the bed , to look at [her]44-margaret face , as it lay away from [me]0-i , almost hidden in the pillow .

The light strengthened faster , and grew mellow with the clear beauty of the morning sunshine . [I]0-i heard the sound of rapid footsteps advancing along [the street]163-the street ; [they]2523-they stopped under the window : and a voice which [I]0-i recognized , called [me]0-i by [my]0-i name . [I]0-i looked out : [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard had returned at last .

" [I]84-mr. bernard could not get back sooner , "[84-mr. bernard] [he]84-mr. bernard said ; " the case was desperate , and [I]84-mr. bernard was afraid to leave it . [You]0-i will find a key on the chimney - piece - throw it out to [me]84-mr. bernard , and [I]84-mr. bernard can let [myself]84-mr. bernard in ; [I]84-mr. bernard told [them]4749-them not to bolt the door before [I]84-mr. bernard went out . "[84-mr. bernard]

[I]0-i obeyed [his]84-mr. bernard directions . When [he]84-mr. bernard entered [the room]263-the room , [I]0-i thought [Margaret]44-margaret moved a little , and signed to [him]84-mr. bernard with [my]0-i hand to make no noise . [He]84-mr. bernard looked towards the bed without any appearance of surprise , and asked [me]0-i in a whisper when the change had come over [her]44-margaret , and how . [I]0-i told [him]84-mr. bernard very briefly , and inquired whether [he]84-mr. bernard had known of such changes in other cases , like [hers]44-margaret .

" Many , "[84-mr. bernard] [he]84-mr. bernard answered , " many changes just as extraordinary , which have raised hopes that [I]84-mr. bernard never knew realised . Expect the worst from the change [you]0-i have witnessed ; it is a fatal sign . "[84-mr. bernard]

Still , in spite of what [he]84-mr. bernard said , it seemed as if [he]84-mr. bernard feared to wake [her]44-margaret ; for [he]84-mr. bernard spoke in [his]84-mr. bernard lowest tones , and walked very softly when [he]84-mr. bernard went close to the bedside .

[He]84-mr. bernard stopped suddenly , just as [he]84-mr. bernard was about to feel [her]44-margaret pulse , and looked in the direction of the glass door - listened attentively - and said , as if to [himself]84-mr. bernard - " [I]84-mr. bernard thought [I]84-mr. bernard heard [some one]4750-some one moving in [that room]3524-that room , but [I]84-mr. bernard suppose [I]84-mr. bernard am mistaken ; [nobody]120-nobody can be up in [the house]244-the house yet . "[84-mr. bernard] With those words [he]84-mr. bernard looked down at [Margaret]44-margaret , and gently parted back [her]44-margaret hair from [her]44-margaret forehead .

" Do n't disturb [her]44-margaret , "[0-i] [I]0-i whispered , ' [she]44-margaret is asleep ; surely [she]44-margaret is asleep ! "[0-i]

[He]84-mr. bernard paused before [he]84-mr. bernard answered [me]0-i , and placed [his]84-mr. bernard hand on [her]44-margaret heart . Then softly drew up the bed - linen , till it hid [her]44-margaret face .

" Yes , [she]44-margaret is asleep , "[84-mr. bernard] [he]84-mr. bernard said gravely ; " asleep , never to wake again . [She]44-margaret is dead . "[84-mr. bernard]

[I]0-i turned aside [my]0-i head in silence , for [my]0-i thoughts , at that moment , were not the thoughts which can be spoken by [man]191-man to [man]191-man .

" This has been a sad scene for [any one at [your]0-i age]4754-any one at your age , "[84-mr. bernard] [he]84-mr. bernard resumed kindly , as [he]84-mr. bernard left the bedside , " but [you]0-i have borne it well . [I]84-mr. bernard am glad to see that [you]0-i can behave so calmly under so hard a trial . "[84-mr. bernard]

Calmly ?

Yes ! at that moment it was fit that [I]0-i should be calm ; for [I]0-i could remember that [I]0-i had forgiven [her]44-margaret .

VIII .

On the fourth day from the morning when [she]44-margaret had died , [I]0-i stood alone in [the churchyard]2527-the churchyard by [the grave of [Margaret Sherwin]44-margaret]2528-the grave of margaret sherwin .

It had been left for [me]0-i to watch [her]44-margaret dying moments ; it was left for [me]0-i to bestow on [her]44-margaret remains the last human charity which the living can extend to the dead . If [I]0-i could have looked into the future on [our]2529-our fatal marriage - day , and could have known that [the only home of [my]0-i giving]2530-the only home of my giving which [she]44-margaret would ever inhabit , would be [the home of [the grave]2226-the grave]2531-the home of the grave ! -

[[Her]44-margaret father]1224-her father had written [me]0-i a letter , which [I]0-i destroyed at the time ; and which , if [I]0-i had it now , [I]0-i should forbear from copying into these pages . Let it be enough for [me]0-i to relate here , that [he]1224-her father never forgave the action by which [she]44-margaret thwarted [him]1224-her father in [his]1224-her father mercenary designs upon [me]0-i and upon [[my]0-i family]197-my family ; that [he]1224-her father diverted from [himself]1224-her father the suspicion and disgust of [[[his]1224-her father wife]997-his wife 's surviving relatives whose hostility [he]1224-her father had some pecuniary reasons to fear , by accusing [[his]1224-her father daughter]233-his daughter , as [he]1224-her father had declared [he]1224-her father would accuse [her]233-his daughter , of having been the real cause of [[her]233-his daughter mother]319-her mother 's death]2536-his wife 's surviving relatives whose hostility he had some pecuniary reasons to fear , by accusing his daughter , as he had declared he would accuse her , of having been the real cause of her mother 's death ; and that [he]1224-her father took care to give the appearance of sincerity to the indignation which [he]1224-her father professed to feel against [her]233-his daughter , by refusing to follow [her]233-his daughter remains to the place of burial .

[Ralph]39-ralph had returned to [London]10-london , as soon as [he]1224-her father received the letter from [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard which [I]0-i had forwarded to [him]84-mr. bernard . [He]84-mr. bernard offered [me]0-i [his]84-mr. bernard assistance in performing the last duties left to [my]0-i care , with an affectionate earnestness that [I]0-i had never seen [him]84-mr. bernard display towards [me]0-i before . But [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard had generously undertaken to relieve [me]0-i of every responsibility which could be assumed by [others]98-others ; and on this occasion , therefore , [I]0-i had no need to put [[my]0-i brother]154-my brother 's ready kindness in helping [me]0-i to the test .

[I]0-i stood alone by [the grave]2226-the grave . [Mr. Bernard]84-mr. bernard had taken leave of [me]0-i ; [the workers]2542-the workers and [the idlers in [the churchyard]2527-the churchyard]2543-the idlers in the churchyard had alike departed . There was no reason why [I]0-i should not follow [them]2545-them ; and yet [I]0-i remained , with [my]0-i eyes fixed upon the freshly - turned earth at [my]0-i feet , thinking of [the dead]2546-the dead .

Some time had passed thus , when the sound of approaching footsteps attracted [my]0-i attention . [I]0-i looked up , and saw [a man]3101-a man , clothed in a long cloak drawn loosely around [his]3101-a man neck , and wearing a shade over [his]3101-a man eyes , which hid the whole upper part of [his]3101-a man face , advancing slowly towards [me]0-i , walking with the help of a stick . [He]3101-a man came on straight to [the grave]2226-the grave , and stopped at the foot of [it]2226-the grave - stopped opposite [me]0-i , as [I]0-i stood at the head .

" Do [you]0-i know [me]3101-a man again ? "[3101-a man] [he]3101-a man said . " Do [you]0-i know [me]3101-a man for [Robert Mannion]73-mannion ? "[3101-a man] As [he]3101-a man pronounced [his]3101-a man name , [he]3101-a man raised the shade and looked at [me]0-i .

The first sight of that appalling face , with its ghastly discolouration of sickness , its hideous deformity of feature , its fierce and changeless malignity of expression glaring full on [me]0-i in the piercing noonday sunshine - glaring with the same unearthly look of fury and triumph which [I]0-i had seen flashing through the flashing lightning , when [I]0-i parted from [him]3101-a man on the night of the storm - struck [me]0-i speechless where [I]0-i stood , and has never left [me]0-i since . [I]0-i must not , [I]0-i dare not , describe that frightful sight ; though it now rises before [my]0-i imagination , vivid in its horror as on the first day when [I]0-i saw it - though it moves hither and thither before [me]0-i fearfully , while [I]0-i write ; though it lowers at [my]0-i window , a noisome shadow on the radiant prospect of [earth]1969-earth , and [sea]2550-sea , and sky , whenever [I]0-i look up from the page [I]0-i am now writing towards the beauties of [my]0-i cottage view .

" Do [you]0-i know [me]3101-a man for [Robert Mannion]73-mannion ? "[3101-a man] [he]3101-a man repeated . " Do [you]0-i know the work of [your]0-i own hands , now [you]0-i see it ? Or , am [I]3101-a man changed to [you]0-i past recognition , as [[your]0-i father]302-your father might have found [[my]3101-a man father]147-my father changed , if [he]302-your father had seen [him]147-my father on the morning of [his]147-my father execution , standing under the gallows , with the cap over [his]147-my father face ? "[3101-a man]

Still [I]0-i could neither speak nor move . [I]0-i could only look away from [him]3101-a man in horror , and fix [my]0-i eyes on the ground .

[He]3101-a man lowered the shade to its former position on [his]3101-a man face , then spoke again .

" Under [this earth]4757-this earth that [we]4758-we stand on , "[3101-a man] [he]3101-a man said , setting [his]3101-a man foot on [the grave]2226-the grave ; " down here , where [you]0-i are now looking , lies buried with the buried dead , the last influence which might one day have gained [you]0-i respite and mercy at [my]3101-a man hands . Did [you]0-i think of the one , last chance that [you]0-i were losing , when [you]0-i came to see [her]4759-her die ? [I]3101-a man watched [you]0-i , and [I]3101-a man watched [her]4759-her . [I]3101-a man heard as much as [you]0-i heard ; [I]3101-a man saw as much as [you]0-i saw ; [I]3101-a man know when [she]4759-her died , and how , as [you]0-i know it ; [I]3101-a man shared [her]4759-her last moments with [you]0-i , to the very end . It was [my]3101-a man fancy not to give [her]4759-her up , as [your]0-i sole possession , even on [her]4759-her death - bed : it is [my]3101-a man fancy , now , not to let [you]0-i stand alone - as if [her]4759-her corpse was [[your]0-i property]4760-your property - over [her]4759-her grave ! "[3101-a man]

While [he]2552-i uttered the last words , [I]0-i felt [my]0-i self - possession returning . [I]0-i could not force [myself]0-i to speak , as [I]0-i would fain have spoken - [I]0-i could only move away , to leave [him]2552-i .

" Stop , "[2552-i] [he]2552-i said , " what [I]2552-i have still to say concerns [you]0-i . [I]2552-i have to tell [you]0-i , face to face , standing with [you]0-i here , over [her]4759-her dead body , that what [I]2552-i wrote from [the hospital]3549-the hospital , is what [I]2552-i will do ; that [I]2552-i will make [your]0-i whole life to come , one long expiation of this deformity ; "[2552-i] [he]2552-i pointed to [his]2552-i face , " and of that death "[2552-i] [he]2552-i set [his]2552-i foot once more on [the grave]2226-the grave . " Go where [you]0-i will , this face of [mine]2552-i shall never be turned away from [you]0-i ; this tongue , which [you]0-i can never silence but by a crime , shall awaken against [you]0-i the sleeping superstitions and cruelties of [all mankind]2446-all mankind . The noisome secret of that night when [you]0-i followed [us]4763-us , shall reek up like a pestilence in the nostrils of [[your]0-i fellow - beings]4764-your fellow - beings , be [they]4764-your fellow - beings whom [they]4764-your fellow - beings may . [You]0-i may shield [yourself]0-i behind [[your]0-i family]953-your family and [[your]0-i friends]4766-your friends - [I]2552-i will strike at [you]0-i through the dearest and the bravest of [them]4764-your fellow - beings ! Now [you]0-i have heard [me]2552-i , go ! The next time [we]4763-us meet , [you]0-i shall acknowledge with [your]0-i own lips that [I]2552-i can act as [I]2552-i speak . Live the free life which [Margaret Sherwin]44-margaret has restored to [you]0-i by [her]44-margaret death - [you]0-i will know it soon for the life of [Cain]76-cain ! "[2552-i]

[He]2554-i turned from [the grave]2226-the grave , and left [me]0-i by the way that [he]2554-i had come ; but the hideous image of [him]2554-i , and the remembrance of the words [he]2554-i had spoken , never left [me]0-i . Never for a moment , while [I]0-i lingered alone in [the churchyard]2527-the churchyard ; never , when [I]0-i quitted it , and walked through [the crowded streets]2557-the crowded streets . The horror of [the fiend - face]2558-the fiend - face was still before [my]0-i eyes , the poison of the fiend - words was still in [my]0-i ears , when [I]0-i returned to [[my]0-i lodging]2419-my lodging , and found [Ralph]39-ralph waiting to see [me]0-i as soon as [I]0-i entered [[my]0-i room]136-my room .

" At last [you]0-i have come back ! "[2554-i] [he]2554-i said ; " [I]2554-i was determined to stop till [you]0-i did , if [I]2554-i stayed all day . Is anything the matter ? Have [you]0-i got into some worse difficulty than ever ? "[2554-i]

" No , [Ralph]39-ralph - no . What have [you]39-ralph to tell [me]39-ralph ? "[39-ralph]

" Something that will rather surprise [you]0-i , [Basil]46-basil : [I]2554-i have to tell [you]0-i to leave [London]10-london at once ! Leave it for [your]0-i own interests and for [everybody else]4767-everybody else 's . [[My]2554-i father]147-my father has found out that [Clara]57-clara has been to see [you]0-i . "[2554-i]

" Good heavens ! how ? "[39-ralph]

" [He]147-my father wo n't tell [me]2554-i . But [he]147-my father has found it out . [You]0-i know how [you]0-i stand in [his]147-my father opinion - [I]2554-i leave [you]0-i to imagine what [he]147-my father thinks of [Clara]57-clara 's conduct in coming [here]3265-here . "[2554-i]

" No ! no ! tell [me]39-ralph [yourself]0-i , [Ralph]39-ralph - tell [me]39-ralph how [she]57-clara bears [his]147-my father displeasure ! "[39-ralph]

" As badly as possible . After having forbidden [her]57-clara ever to enter [this house]3137-this house again , [he]147-my father now only shows how [he]147-my father is offended , by [his]147-my father silence ; and it is exactly that , of course , which distresses [her]57-clara . Between [her]57-clara notions of implicit obedience to [him]147-my father , and [her]57-clara opposite notions , just as strong , of [her]57-clara sisterly duties to [you]0-i , [she]57-clara is made miserable from morning to night . What [she]57-clara will end in , if things go on like this , [I]2554-i am really afraid to think ; and [I]2554-i 'm not easily frightened , as [you]0-i know . Now , [Basil]46-basil , listen to [me]2554-i : it is [your]46-basil business to stop this , and [my]2554-i business to tell [you]46-basil how . "[2554-i]

" [I]39-ralph will do anything [you]46-basil wish - anything for [Clara]57-clara 's sake ! "[39-ralph]

" Then leave [London]10-london ; and so cut short the struggle between [her]57-clara duty and [her]57-clara inclination . If [you]46-basil do n't , [[my]2554-i father]147-my father is quite capable of taking [her]57-clara at once into [the country]370-the country , though [I]2554-i know [he]147-my father has important business to keep [him]147-my father in [London]10-london . Write a letter to [her]57-clara , saying that [you]46-basil have gone away for [your]46-basil health , for change of scene and peace of mind - gone away , in short , to come back better some day . Do n't say where [you]46-basil 're going , and do n't tell [me]2554-i , for [she]57-clara is sure to ask , and sure to get it out of [me]2554-i if [I]2554-i know . Then [she]57-clara might be writing to [you]46-basil , and that might be found out , too . [She]57-clara ca n't distress [herself]57-clara about [your]46-basil absence , if [you]46-basil account for it properly , as [she]57-clara distresses [herself]57-clara now - that is one consideration . And [you]46-basil will serve [your]46-basil own interests , as well as [Clara]57-clara 's , by going away - that is another . "[2554-i]

" Never mind [my]39-ralph interests . [Clara]57-clara ! [I]39-ralph can only think of [Clara]57-clara ! "[39-ralph]

" But [you]46-basil have interests , and [you]46-basil must think of them . [I]2554-i told [[my]2554-i father]147-my father of the death of [that unhappy woman]4774-that unhappy woman , and of [your]46-basil noble behaviour when [she]4774-that unhappy woman was dying . Do n't interrupt [me]2554-i , [Basil]46-basil - it was noble ; [I]2554-i could n't have done what [you]46-basil did , [I]2554-i can tell [you]46-basil ! [I]2554-i saw [he]147-my father was more struck by it than [he]147-my father was willing to confess . An impression has been made on [him]147-my father by the turn circumstances have taken . Only leave that impression to strengthen , and [you]46-basil 're safe . But if [you]46-basil destroy it by staying [here]3265-here , after what has happened , and keeping [Clara]57-clara in this new dilemma - [[my]2554-i dear fellow]4373-my dear fellow , [you]46-basil destroy [your]46-basil best chance ! There is a sort of defiance of [him]147-my father in stopping ; there is a downright concession to [him]147-my father in going away . "[2554-i]

" [I]39-ralph will go , [Ralph]39-ralph ; [you]39-ralph have more than convinced [me]39-ralph that [I]39-ralph ought ! [I]39-ralph will go to - morrow , though where - "[39-ralph]

" [You]46-basil have the rest of the day to think where . [I]2554-i should go abroad and amuse [myself]2554-i ; but [your]46-basil ideas of amusement are , most likely , not mine . At any rate , wherever [you]46-basil go , [I]2554-i can always supply [you]46-basil with money , when [you]46-basil want it ; [you]46-basil can write to [me]2554-i , after [you]46-basil have been away some little time , and [I]2554-i can write back , as soon as [I]2554-i have good news to tell [you]46-basil . Only stick to [your]46-basil present determination , [Basil]46-basil , and , [I]2554-i 'll answer for it , [you]46-basil will be back in [[your]46-basil own study]4777-your own study at [home]176-home , before [you]46-basil are many months older ! "[2554-i]

" [I]39-ralph will put it out of [my]39-ralph power to fail in [my]39-ralph resolution , by writing to [Clara]57-clara at once , and giving [you]46-basil the letter to place in [her]57-clara hands to - morrow evening , when [I]39-ralph shall have left [London]10-london some hours . "[39-ralph]

" That 's right , [Basil]46-basil ! that 's acting and speaking like [a man]3101-a man ! "[2554-i]

[I]0-i wrote immediately , accounting for [my]0-i sudden absence as [Ralph]39-ralph had advised [me]0-i - wrote , with a heavy heart , all that [I]0-i thought would be most reassuring and cheering to [Clara]57-clara ; and then , without allowing [myself]0-i time to hesitate or to think , gave the letter to [[my]0-i brother]154-my brother .

" [She]57-clara shall have it to - morrow night , "[154-my brother] [he]154-my brother said , " and [[my]154-my brother father]147-my father shall know why [you]46-basil have left [town]340-town , at the same time . Depend on [me]154-my brother in this , as in everything else . And now , [Basil]46-basil , [I]154-my brother must say good bye - unless [you]46-basil 're in the humour for coming to look at [[my]154-my brother new house]4782-my new house this evening . Ah ! [I]154-my brother see that wo n't suit [you]46-basil just now , so , good bye , [old fellow]4783-old fellow ! Write when [you]46-basil are in any necessity - get back [your]46-basil spirits and [your]46-basil health - and never doubt that the step [you]46-basil are now taking will be the best for [Clara]57-clara , and the best for [yourself]46-basil ! "[154-my brother]

[He]154-my brother hurried out of [the room]263-the room , evidently feeling more at saying farewell than [he]154-my brother was willing to let [me]0-i discover . [I]0-i was left alone for the rest of the day , to think whither [I]0-i should turn [my]0-i steps on the morrow .

[I]0-i knew that it would be best that [I]0-i should leave [England]1-england ; but there seemed to have grown within [me]0-i , suddenly , a yearning towards [[my]0-i own country that [I]0-i had never felt before]2563-my own country that i had never felt before - a home - sickness for the land in which [[my]0-i sister]296-my sister lived . Not once did [my]0-i thoughts wander away to [foreign places]2565-foreign places , while [I]0-i now tried to consider calmly in what direction [I]0-i should depart when [I]0-i left [London]10-london .

While [I]0-i was still in doubt , [my]0-i earliest impressions of childhood came back to [my]0-i memory ; and influenced by them , [I]0-i thought of [Cornwall]25-cornwall . [[My]0-i nurse]2566-my nurse had been [a Cornish woman]2567-a cornish woman ; [my]0-i first fancies and first feelings of curiosity had been excited by [her]2566-my nurse Cornish stories , by the descriptions of the scenery , the customs , and the people of [[her]2566-my nurse native land]2568-her native land , with which [she]2566-my nurse was ever ready to amuse [me]0-i . As [I]0-i grew older , it had always been one of [my]0-i favourite projects to go to [Cornwall]25-cornwall , to explore [the wild western land]2569-the wild western land , on foot , from hill to hill throughout . And now , when no motive of pleasure could influence [my]0-i choice - now , when [I]0-i was going forth homeless and alone , in uncertainty , in grief , in peril - the old fancy of long - past days still kept its influence , and pointed out [my]0-i new path to [me]0-i among [the rocky boundaries of [the Cornish shore]2571-the cornish shore]2570-the rocky boundaries of the cornish shore .

[My]0-i last night in [London]10-london was a night made terrible by [Mannion]73-mannion 's fearful image in all [my]0-i dreams - made mournful , in [my]0-i waking moments , by thoughts of the morrow which was to separate [me]0-i from [Clara]57-clara . But [I]0-i never faltered in [my]0-i resolution to leave [London]10-london for [her]57-clara sake . When the morning came , [I]0-i collected [my]0-i few necessaries , added to them one or two books , and was ready to depart .

[My]0-i way through [the streets]241-the streets took [me]0-i near [[[my]0-i father]147-my father 's house]2193-my father 's house . As [I]0-i passed by [the well - remembered neighbourhood]2575-the well - remembered neighbourhood , [my]0-i self - control so far deserted [me]0-i , that [I]0-i stopped and turned aside into [the Square]26-the square , in the hope of seeing [Clara]57-clara once more before [I]0-i went away . Cautiously and doubtfully , as if [I]0-i was [a trespasser even on the public pavement]2576-a trespasser even on the public pavement , [I]0-i looked up at [the house which was no more [[my]0-i home]2199-my home]2577-the house which was no more my home - at the windows , side by side , of [[[my]0-i sister]296-my sister 's sitting - room and [bed - room]2581-bed - room]2580-my sister 's sitting - room and bed - room . [She]57-clara was neither standing near [them]2580-my sister 's sitting - room and bed - room , nor passing accidentally from [one room]2582-one room to another at that moment . Still [I]0-i could not persuade [myself]0-i to go on . [I]0-i thought of many and many an act of kindness that [she]57-clara had done for [me]0-i , which [I]0-i seemed never to have appreciated until now - [I]0-i thought of what [she]57-clara had suffered , and might yet suffer , for [my]0-i sake - and the longing to see [her]57-clara once more , though only for an instant , still kept [me]0-i lingering near [the house]244-the house and looking up vainly at the lonely windows .

It was a bright , cool , autumnal morning ; perhaps [she]57-clara might have gone out into [the garden of the square]3614-the garden of the square : it used often to be [her]57-clara habit , when [I]0-i was at [home]176-home , to go [there]161-there and read at this hour . [I]0-i walked round , outside the railings , searching for [her]57-clara between gaps in the foliage ; and had nearly made the circuit of [the garden]998-the garden thus , before the figure of [a lady sitting alone under one of the trees]2588-a lady sitting alone under one of the trees , attracted [my]0-i attention . [I]0-i stopped - looked intently towards [her]57-clara - and saw that it was [Clara]57-clara .

[Her]57-clara face was almost entirely turned from [me]0-i ; but [I]0-i knew [her]57-clara by [her]57-clara dress , by [her]57-clara figure - even by [her]57-clara position , simple as it was . [She]57-clara was sitting with [her]57-clara hands on a closed book which rested on [her]57-clara knee . A little spaniel that [I]0-i had given [her]57-clara lay asleep at [her]57-clara feet : [she]57-clara seemed to be looking down at the animal , as far as [I]0-i could tell by the position of [her]57-clara head . When [I]0-i moved aside , to try if [I]0-i could see [her]57-clara face , the trees hid [her]57-clara from sight . [I]0-i was obliged to be satisfied with the little [I]0-i could discern of [her]57-clara , through the one gap in the foliage which gave [me]0-i a clear view of the place where [she]57-clara was sitting . To speak to [her]57-clara , to risk the misery to both of [us]2589-us of saying farewell , was more than [I]0-i dared trust [myself]0-i to do . [I]0-i could only stand silent , and look at [her]57-clara - it might be for the last time ! - until the tears gathered in [my]0-i eyes , so that [I]0-i could see nothing more . [I]0-i resisted the temptation to dash them away . While [they]2590-they still hid [her]57-clara from [me]0-i - while [I]0-i could not see [her]57-clara again , if [I]0-i would - [I]0-i turned from [the garden]998-the garden view , and left [the Square]717-the square .

Amid all the thoughts which thronged on [me]0-i , as [I]0-i walked farther and farther away from [the neighbourhood of what was once [my]0-i home]2593-the neighbourhood of what was once my home ; amid all the remembrances of past events - from the first day when [I]0-i met [Margaret]44-margaret [Sherwin]44-margaret to the day when [I]0-i stood by [[her]44-margaret grave]2594-her grave - which were recalled by the mere act of leaving [London]10-london , there now arose in [my]0-i mind , for the first time , a doubt , which from that day to this has never left it ; a doubt whether [Mannion]73-mannion might not be tracking [me]0-i in secret along every step of [my]0-i way .

[I]0-i stopped instinctively , and looked behind [me]0-i . [Many figures]2595-many figures were moving in the distance ; but the figure that [I]0-i had seen in [the churchyard]2527-the churchyard was nowhere visible among [them]2595-many figures . A little further on , [I]0-i looked back again , and still with the same result . After this , [I]0-i let a longer interval elapse before [I]0-i stopped ; and then , for the third time , [I]0-i turned round , and scanned [the busy street]2597-the busy street - scene behind [me]0-i , with eager , suspicious eyes . Some little distance back , on the opposite side of the way , [I]0-i caught sight of [a man who was standing still as [I]0-i was standing]2598-a man who was standing still as i was standing , amid [the moving throng]2599-the moving throng . [His]2598-a man who was standing still as i was standing height was like [Mannion]73-mannion 's height ; and [he]2598-a man who was standing still as i was standing wore a cloak like the cloak [I]0-i had seen on [Mannion]73-mannion , when [he]2598-a man who was standing still as i was standing approached [me]0-i at [[Margaret]44-margaret 's grave]2600-margaret 's grave . More than this [I]0-i could not detect , without crossing over . [The passing vehicles]2601-the passing vehicles and [foot - passengers]2602-foot - passengers constantly intercepted [my]0-i view , from the position in which [I]0-i stood .

Was [this figure]2603-this figure , thus visible only by intervals , the figure of [Mannion]73-mannion ? and was [he]2598-a man who was standing still as i was standing really tracking [my]0-i steps ? As the suspicion strengthened in [my]0-i mind that it was so , the remembrance of [his]2598-a man who was standing still as i was standing threat in [the churchyard]2527-the churchyard : " [You]0-i may shield [yourself]0-i behind [[your]0-i family]953-your family and [[your]0-i friends]4766-your friends : [I]2598-a man who was standing still as i was standing will strike at [you]0-i through [the dearest and the bravest of [them]4786-the dearest and the bravest of them]4786-the dearest and the bravest of them - "[2598-a man who was standing still as i was standing] suddenly recurred to [me]0-i ; and brought with it a thought which urged [me]0-i instantly to proceed on [my]0-i way . [I]0-i never looked behind [me]0-i again , as [I]0-i now walked on ; for [I]0-i said within [myself]0-i : - " If [he]2598-a man who was standing still as i was standing is following [me]0-i , [I]0-i must not , and will not avoid [him]2598-a man who was standing still as i was standing : it will be the best result of [my]0-i departure , that [I]0-i shall draw after [me]0-i that destroying presence ; and thus at least remove it far and safely away from [[my]0-i family]197-my family and [[my]0-i home]2199-my home ! "[0-i]

So , [I]0-i neither turned aside from the straight direction , nor hurried [my]0-i steps , nor looked back any more . At the time [I]0-i had resolved on , [I]0-i left [London]10-london for [Cornwall]25-cornwall , without making any attempt to conceal [my]0-i departure . And though [I]0-i knew that [he]2605-he must surely be following [me]0-i , still [I]0-i never saw [him]2605-he again : never discovered how close or how far off [he]2605-he was on [my]0-i track .

Two months have passed since that period ; and [I]0-i know no more about [him]2605-he now than [I]0-i knew then .

JOURNAL .

October 19th - [My]0-i retrospect is finished . [I]0-i have traced the history of [my]0-i errors and misfortunes , of the wrong [I]0-i have done and the punishment [I]0-i have suffered for it , from the past to the present time .

The pages of [my]0-i manuscript many more than [I]0-i thought to write at first lie piled together on the table before [me]0-i . [I]0-i dare not look them over : [I]0-i dare not read the lines which [my]0-i own hand has traced . There may be much in [my]0-i manner of writing that wants alteration ; but [I]0-i have no heart to return to [my]0-i task , and revise and reconsider as [I]0-i might if [I]0-i were intent on producing a book which was to be published during [my]0-i lifetime . Others will be found , when [I]0-i am no more , to carve , and smooth , and polish to the popular taste of the day this rugged material of Truth which [I]0-i shall leave behind [me]0-i .

But now , while [I]0-i collect these leaves , and seal them up , never to be opened again by [my]0-i hands , can [I]0-i feel that [I]0-i have related all which it is necessary to tell ? No ! While [Mannion]73-mannion lives - while [I]0-i am ignorant of the changes that may yet be wrought in [the home from which [I]0-i am exiled]2606-the home from which i am exiled - there remains for [me]0-i a future which must be recorded , as the necessary sequel to the narrative of the past . What may yet happen worthy of record , [I]0-i know not : what sufferings [I]0-i may yet undergo , which may unfit [me]0-i for continuing the labour now terminated for a time , [I]0-i can not foresee . [I]0-i have not hope enough in the future , or in [myself]0-i ; to believe that [I]0-i shall have the time or the energy to write hereafter , as [I]0-i have written already , from recollection . It is best , then , that [I]0-i should note down events daily as they occur ; and so ensure , as far as may be , a continuation of [my]0-i narrative , fragment by fragment , to the very last .

But , first , as a fit beginning to the Journal [I]0-i now propose to keep , let [me]0-i briefly reveal something , in this place , of the life that [I]0-i am leading in [my]0-i retirement on [the Cornish coast]134-the cornish coast .

[The fishing hamlet in which [I]0-i have written the preceding pages]2608-the fishing hamlet in which i have written the preceding pages , is on [the southern shore of [Cornwall]25-cornwall]2609-the southern shore of cornwall , not more than [a few miles distant from [the Land 's End]27-the land 's end]2610-a few miles distant from the land 's end . [The cottage [I]0-i inhabit]2611-the cottage i inhabit is built of rough granite , rudely thatched , and has but [two rooms]2612-two rooms . [I]0-i possess no furniture but [my]0-i bed , [my]0-i table , and [my]0-i chair ; and [some half - dozen fishermen]2613-some half - dozen fishermen and [[their]2613-some half - dozen fishermen families]2614-their families are [[my]0-i only neighbours]2615-my only neighbours . But [I]0-i feel neither the want of luxuries , nor the want of society : all that [I]0-i wished for in coming [here]3265-here , [I]0-i have - the completest seclusion .

[My]0-i arrival produced , at first , both astonishment and suspicion . [The fishermen of [Cornwall]25-cornwall]2617-the fishermen of cornwall still preserve almost all the superstitions , even to the grossest , which were held dear by [[their]2617-the fishermen of cornwall humble ancestors]2618-their humble ancestors , centuries back . [[My]0-i simple neighbours]2619-my simple neighbours could not understand why [I]0-i had no business to occupy [me]0-i ; could not reconcile [my]0-i worn , melancholy face with [my]0-i youthful years . Such loneliness as [mine]0-i looked unnatural - especially to [the women]2620-the women . [They]2619-my simple neighbours questioned [me]0-i curiously ; and the very simplicity of [my]0-i answer , that [I]0-i had only come to [Cornwall]25-cornwall to live in quiet , and regain [my]0-i health , perplexed [them]2619-my simple neighbours afresh . [They]2619-my simple neighbours waited , day after day , when [I]0-i was first installed in [the cottage]1701-the cottage , to see letters sent to [me]0-i - and no letters arrived : to see [[my]0-i friends]1271-my friends join [me]0-i - and [no friends]2623-no friends came . This deepened the mystery to [their]2619-my simple neighbours eyes . [They]2619-my simple neighbours began to recall to memory old Cornish legends of [solitary , secret people who had lived , years and years ago , in [certain parts of [the county]2626-the county]2625-certain parts of the county]2624-solitary , secret people who had lived , years and years ago , in certain parts of the county - coming , none knew whence ; existing , none knew by what means ; dying and disappearing , [none]2627-none knew when . [They]2619-my simple neighbours felt half inclined to identify [me]0-i with [these mysterious visitors]2628-these mysterious visitors - to consider [me]0-i as [some being]2629-some being , [a stranger to [the whole human family , who had come to waste away under a curse , and die ominously and secretly among]2631-the whole human family , who had come to waste away under a curse , and die ominously and secretly among [them]2631-the whole human family , who had come to waste away under a curse , and die ominously and secretly among]2630-a stranger to the whole human family , who had come to waste away under a curse , and die ominously and secretly among them . Even [the person to whom [I]0-i first paid money for [my]0-i necessaries]2632-the person to whom i first paid money for my necessaries , questioned , for a moment , the lawfulness and safety of receiving it !

But these doubts gradually died away ; this superstitious curiosity insensibly wore off , among [[my]0-i poor neighbours]2633-my poor neighbours . [They]2619-my simple neighbours became used to [my]0-i solitary , thoughtful , and to [them]2619-my simple neighbours inexplicable mode of existence . One or two little services of kindness which [I]0-i rendered , soon after [my]0-i arrival , to [[their]2619-my simple neighbours children]2634-their children , worked wonders in [my]0-i favour ; and [I]0-i am pitied now , rather than distrusted . When the results of the fishing are abundant , a little present has been often made to [me]0-i , out of the nets . Some weeks ago , after [I]0-i had gone out in the morning , [I]0-i found on [my]0-i return , two or three gulls ' eggs placed in a basket before [my]0-i door . They had been left there by [the children]2635-the children , as ornaments for [[my]0-i cottage window]2636-my cottage window - the only ornaments [they]2635-the children had to give ; the only ornaments [they]2635-the children had ever heard of .

[I]0-i can now go out unnoticed , directing [my]0-i steps up the ravine in which [[our]2637-our hamlet]2638-our hamlet is situated , towards [the old grey stone church which stands solitary on [the hill - top]2640-the hill - top , surrounded by [the lonesome moor]2641-the lonesome moor]2639-the old grey stone church which stands solitary on the hill - top , surrounded by the lonesome moor . If [any children]2642-any children happen to be playing among [the scattered tombs]2643-the scattered tombs , [they]2642-any children do not start and run away , when [they]2642-any children see [me]0-i sitting on the coffin stone at the entrance of [the churchyard]2527-the churchyard , or wandering round the sturdy granite tower , reared by hands which have mouldered into dust centuries ago . [My]0-i approach has ceased to be of evil omen for [[my]0-i little neighbours]2645-my little neighbours . [They]2645-my little neighbours just look up at [me]0-i , for a moment , with bright smiles , and then go on with [their]2645-my little neighbours game .

From [the churchyard]2527-the churchyard , [I]0-i look down [the ravine]2647-the ravine , on fine days , towards [the sea]498-the sea . Mighty piles of granite soar above [[the fishermen]2649-the fishermen 's cottages on each side]2650-the fishermen 's cottages on each side ; [the little strip of white beach which [the cliffs shut]2652-the cliffs shut in]2651-the little strip of white beach which the cliffs shut in , glows pure in the sunlight ; [the inland stream that trickles down the bed of [the rocks]138-the rocks]2653-the inland stream that trickles down the bed of the rocks , sparkles , at places , like a rivulet of silver - fire ; the round white clouds , with their violet shadows and bright wavy edges , roll on majestically above [me]0-i ; the cries of the sea - birds , the endless , dirging murmur of the surf , and the far music of the wind among [the ocean caverns]2655-the ocean caverns , fall , now together , now separately on [my]0-i ear . [Nature]47-nature 's voice and [Nature]47-nature 's beauty - [God]37-god 's soothing and purifying angels of the soul - speak to [me]0-i most tenderly and most happily , at such times as these .

It is when the rain falls , and wind and [sea]2550-sea arise together - when , sheltered among [the caverns in the side of the precipice]2657-the caverns in the side of the precipice , [I]0-i look out upon the dreary waves and the leaping spray - that [I]0-i feel the unknown dangers which hang over [my]0-i head in all the horror of their uncertainty . Then , the threats of [[my]0-i deadly enemy]2658-my deadly enemy strengthen their hold fearfully on all [my]0-i senses . [I]0-i see the dim and ghastly personification of a fatality that is lying in wait for [me]0-i , in the strange shapes of the mist which shrouds the sky , and moves , and whirls , and brightens , and darkens in a weird glory of its own over the heaving waters . Then , the crash of the breakers on [the reef]2659-the reef howls upon [me]0-i with a sound of judgment ; and the voice of the wind , growling and battling behind [me]0-i in the hollows of [the cave]2660-the cave , is , ever and ever , the same thunder - voice of doom and warning in [my]0-i ear .

Does this foreboding that [Mannion]73-mannion 's eye is always on [me]0-i , that [his]73-mannion footsteps are always secretly following [mine]0-i , proceed only from the weakness of [my]0-i worn - out energies ? Could others in [my]0-i situation restrain [themselves]2661-themselves from fearing , as [I]0-i do , that [he]73-mannion is still incessantly watching [me]0-i in secret ? It is possible . It may be , that [his]73-mannion terrible connection with all [my]0-i sufferings of the past , makes [me]0-i attach credit too easily to the destroying power which [he]73-mannion arrogates to [himself]73-mannion in the future . Or it may be , that all resolution to resist [him]73-mannion is paralysed in [me]0-i , not so much by [my]0-i fear of [his]73-mannion appearance , as by [my]0-i uncertainty of the time when it will take place - not so much by [his]73-mannion menaces [themselves]2661-themselves , as by the delay in [their]2661-themselves execution . Still , though [I]0-i can estimate fairly the value of these considerations , [they]2661-themselves exercise over [me]0-i no lasting influence of tranquillity . [I]0-i remember what [this man]656-this man has done ; and in spite of all reasoning , [I]0-i believe in what [he]656-this man has told [me]0-i [he]656-this man will yet do . Madman though [he]656-this man may be , [I]0-i have no hope of defence or escape from [him]656-this man in any direction , look where [I]0-i will .

But for the occupation which the foregoing narrative has given to [my]0-i mind ; but for the relief which [my]0-i heart can derive from its thoughts of [Clara]57-clara , [I]0-i must have sunk under the torment of suspense and suspicion in which [my]0-i life is now passed . [[My]0-i sister]296-my sister ! Even in this self - imposed absence from [her]296-my sister , [I]0-i have still found a means of connecting [myself]0-i remotely with something that [she]296-my sister loves . [I]0-i have taken , as the assumed name under which [I]0-i live , and shall continue to live until [[my]0-i father]147-my father has given [me]0-i back [his]147-my father confidence and [his]147-my father affection , the name of [a little estate that once belonged to [[my]0-i mother]148-my mother , and that now belongs to [[her]148-my mother daughter]1101-her daughter]2665-a little estate that once belonged to my mother , and that now belongs to her daughter . [Even the most wretched]2668-even the most wretched have [their]2668-even the most wretched caprice , [their]2668-even the most wretched last favourite fancy . [I]0-i possess no memorial of [Clara]57-clara , not even a letter . The name that [I]0-i have taken from [the place which [she]57-clara was always fondest and proudest of]2669-the place which she was always fondest and proudest of , is , to [me]0-i , what a lock of hair , a ring , any little loveable keepsake , is to others happier than [I]0-i am .

[I]0-i have wandered away from the simple details of [my]0-i life in [this place]3077-this place . Shall [I]0-i now return to [them]2671-them ? Not to - day ; [my]0-i head burns , [my]0-i hand is weary . If the morrow should bring with it no event to write of , on the morrow [I]0-i can resume the subject from which [I]0-i now break off .

October 20th . - After laying aside [my]0-i pen , [I]0-i went out yesterday for the purpose of renewing that former friendly intercourse with [[my]0-i poor neighbours]2633-my poor neighbours , which has been interrupted for the last three weeks by unintermitting labour at the latter portions of [my]0-i narrative .

In the course of [my]0-i walk among [the cottages]2673-the cottages and up to [the old church]2674-the old church on [the moor]2675-the moor , [I]0-i saw [fewer of [the people of [the district]1857-the district]2677-the people of the district than usual]2676-fewer of the people of the district than usual . The behaviour of those whom [I]0-i did chance to meet , seemed unaccountably altered ; perhaps it was mere fancy , but [I]0-i thought [they]2671-them avoided [me]0-i . [One woman]2679-one woman abruptly shut [her]2679-one woman cottage door as [I]0-i approached . [A fisherman]2680-a fisherman , when [I]0-i wished [him]2680-a fisherman good day , hardly answered ; and walked on without stopping to gossip with [me]0-i as usual . [Some children]2150-some children , too , whom [I]0-i overtook on [the road]1783-the road to [the church]185-the church , ran away from [me]0-i , making gestures to [each other]102-each other which [I]0-i could not understand . Is the first superstitious distrust of [me]0-i returning after [I]0-i thought it had been entirely overcome ? Or are [[my]0-i neighbours]2685-my neighbours only showing [their]2685-my neighbours resentment at [my]0-i involuntary neglect of [them]2685-my neighbours for the last three weeks ? [I]0-i must try to find out to - morrow .

21st - [I]0-i have discovered all ! The truth , which [I]0-i was strangely slow to suspect yesterday , has forced itself on [me]0-i to - day .

[I]0-i went out this morning , as [I]0-i had purposed , to discover whether [[my]0-i neighbours]2685-my neighbours had really changed towards [me]0-i , or not , since the interval of [my]0-i three weeks ' seclusion . At [the cottage - door nearest to [mine]0-i]2687-the cottage - door nearest to mine , [two young children]2688-two young children were playing , whom [I]0-i knew [I]0-i had succeeded in attaching to [me]0-i soon after [my]0-i arrival . [I]0-i walked up to speak to [them]2688-two young children ; but , as [I]0-i approached , [[their]2688-two young children mother]2689-their mother came out , and snatched [them]2688-two young children from [me]0-i with a look of anger and alarm . Before [I]0-i could question [her]2689-their mother , [she]2689-their mother had taken [them]2688-two young children inside [the cottage]1701-the cottage , and had closed the door .

Almost at the same moment , as if by a preconcerted signal , [three or four other women]2691-three or four other women came out from [their]2691-three or four other women abodes at a little distance , warned [me]0-i in loud , angry voices not to come near [them]2691-three or four other women , or [[their]2691-three or four other women children]2634-their children ; and disappeared , shutting [their]2691-three or four other women doors . Still not suspecting the truth , [I]0-i turned back , and walked towards [the beach]140-the beach . [The lad whom [I]0-i employ to serve [me]0-i with provisions]2694-the lad whom i employ to serve me with provisions , was lounging there against the side of [an old boat]2695-an old boat . At seeing [me]0-i , [he]2694-the lad whom i employ to serve me with provisions started up , and walked away a few steps - then stopped , and called out -

" [I]2694-the lad whom i employ to serve me with provisions 'm not to bring [you]0-i anything more ; [father]477-father says [he]477-father wo n't sell to [you]0-i again , whatever [you]0-i pay [him]477-father . "[2694-the lad whom i employ to serve me with provisions]

[I]0-i asked [the boy]777-the boy why [[his]777-the boy father]3694-his father had said that ; but [he]777-the boy ran back towards [the village]2698-the village without answering [me]0-i .

" [You]0-i had best leave [us]4790-we , "[2699-the man who said these words] muttered a voice behind [me]0-i . " If [you]0-i do n't go of [your]0-i own accord , [[our]4790-we people]4791-our people will starve [you]0-i out of [the place]435-the place . "[2699-the man who said these words]

[The man who said these words]2699-the man who said these words , had been one of the first to set the example of friendliness towards [me]0-i , after [my]0-i arrival ; and to [him]2699-the man who said these words [I]0-i now turned for the explanation which [no one else]554-no one else would give [me]0-i .

" [You]0-i know what [we]4790-we mean , and why [we]4790-we want [you]0-i to go , well enough , "[2699-the man who said these words] was [his]2699-the man who said these words reply .

[I]0-i assured [him]2699-the man who said these words that [I]0-i did not ; and begged [him]2699-the man who said these words so earnestly to enlighten [me]0-i , that [he]2699-the man who said these words stopped as [he]2699-the man who said these words was walking away .

" [I]2699-the man who said these words 'll tell [you]0-i about it , "[2699-the man who said these words] [he]2699-the man who said these words said ; " but not now ; [I]2699-the man who said these words do n't want to be seen with [you]0-i . "[2699-the man who said these words] As [he]2699-the man who said these words spoke [he]2699-the man who said these words looked back at [the women , who were appearing once more in front of [[their]2701-the women , who were appearing once more in front of their cottages cottages]2702-their cottages]2701-the women , who were appearing once more in front of their cottages . " Go [home]176-home again , and shut [yourself]0-i up ; [I]2699-the man who said these words 'll come at dusk . "[2699-the man who said these words]

And [he]2699-the man who said these words came as [he]2699-the man who said these words had promised . But when [I]0-i asked [him]2699-the man who said these words to enter [[my]0-i cottage]2703-my cottage , [he]2699-the man who said these words declined , and said [he]2699-the man who said these words would talk to [me]0-i outside , at [my]0-i window . This disinclination to be under [my]0-i roof , reminded [me]0-i that [my]0-i supplies of food had , for the last week , been left on the window - ledge , instead of being brought into [[my]0-i room]136-my room as usual . [I]0-i had been too constantly occupied to pay much attention to the circumstance at the time ; but [I]0-i thought it very strange now .

" Do [you]0-i mean to tell [me]696-the man [you]0-i do n't suspect why [we]4794-we want to get [you]0-i out of [[our]4794-we place]4795-our place here ? "[696-the man] said [the man]696-the man , looking in distrustfully at [me]0-i through the window .

[I]0-i repeated that [I]0-i could not imagine why [they]2706-they had all changed towards [me]0-i , or what wrong [they]2706-they thought [I]0-i had done [them]2706-they .

" Then [I]696-the man 'll soon let [you]0-i know it , "[696-the man] [he]696-the man continued . " [We]4794-we want [you]696-the man gone from [here]3265-here , because - "[696-the man]

" Because , "[696-the man] interrupted another voice behind [him]696-the man , which [I]0-i recognised as [[his]696-the man wife]997-his wife 's , " because [you]0-i 're bringing a blight on [us]4794-we , and [[our]4794-we houses]4797-our houses - because [we]4794-we want [[our]4794-we children]4798-our children 's faces left as [God]37-god made [them]4798-our children - "[696-the man]

" Because , "[2708-a second woman] interposed [a second woman]2708-a second woman , who had joined [her]2708-a second woman , " [you]0-i 're bringing devil 's vengeances among [Christian people]4799-christian people ! Come back , [John]84-mr. bernard ! [he]2710-the fisherman 's not safe for [a true man]4800-a true man to speak to . "[2708-a second woman]

[They]2709-they dragged [the fisherman]2710-the fisherman away with [them]2709-they before [he]2710-the fisherman could say another word . [I]0-i had heard enough . The fatal truth burst at once on [my]0-i mind . [Mannion]73-mannion had followed [me]0-i to [Cornwall]25-cornwall : [his]73-mannion threats were executed to the very letter !

10 o'clock . - [I]0-i have lit [my]0-i candle for the last time in [this cottage]2711-this cottage , to add a few lines to [my]0-i journal . [The hamlet]2712-the hamlet is quiet ; [I]0-i hear no footstep outside - and yet , can [I]0-i be certain that [Mannion]73-mannion is not lurking near [my]0-i door at this moment ?

[I]0-i must go when the morning comes ; [I]0-i must leave this quiet retreat , in which [I]0-i have lived so calmly until now . There is no hope that [I]0-i can reinstate [myself]0-i in the opinions of [[my]0-i poor neighbours]2633-my poor neighbours . [He]73-mannion has arrayed against [me]0-i the pitiless hostility of [their]2633-my poor neighbours superstition . [He]73-mannion has found out the dormant cruelties , even in the hearts of [these simple people]2714-these simple people ; and has awakened [them]2633-my poor neighbours against [me]0-i , as [he]73-mannion said [he]73-mannion would . The evil work must have been begun within the last three weeks , while [I]0-i was much within doors , and there was little chance of meeting [me]0-i in [my]0-i usual walks . How that work was accomplished it is useless to inquire ; [my]0-i only object now , must be to prepare [myself]0-i at once for departure .

11 o'clock . - While [I]0-i was putting up [my]0-i few books , a minute ago , a little embroidered marker fell out of one of them , which [I]0-i had not observed in the pages before ; and which [I]0-i recognised as having been worked for [me]0-i by [Clara]57-clara . [I]0-i have a memorial of [[my]0-i sister]296-my sister in [my]0-i possession , after all ! Trifling as it is , [I]0-i shall preserve it about [me]0-i , as [a messenger of consolation in the time of adversity and peril]2716-a messenger of consolation in the time of adversity and peril .

1 o'clock . - The wind sweeps down on [us]2717-us , from off [the moorland]2718-the moorland , in fiercer and fiercer gusts ; the waves dash heavily against [our]2717-us rock promontory ; the rain drifts wildly past [my]0-i windows ; and the densest darkness overspreads the whole sky . The storm which has been threatening for some days , is gathering fast .

[Village of Treen]2719-village of treen , October 22nd . - The events of this one day have changed the whole future of [my]0-i life . [I]0-i must force [myself]0-i to write of them at once . Something warns [me]0-i that if [I]0-i delay , though only till to - morrow , [I]0-i shall be incapable of relating them at all .

It was still early in the morning - [I]0-i think about seven o'clock - when [I]0-i closed [[my]0-i cottage]2703-my cottage door behind [me]0-i , never to open it again . [I]0-i met only [one or two of [[my]0-i neighbours]2685-my neighbours]2721-one or two of my neighbours as [I]0-i left [the hamlet]2712-the hamlet . [They]2721-one or two of my neighbours drew aside to let [me]0-i advance , without saying a word . With a heavy heart , grieved more than [I]0-i could have imagined possible at departing as [an enemy from among [the people with whom [I]0-i had lived as [a friend]512-a friend]2725-the people with whom i had lived as a friend]2724-an enemy from among the people with whom i had lived as a friend , [I]0-i passed slowly by [the last cottages]2727-the last cottages , and ascended the cliff path which led to [the moor]2675-the moor .

The storm had raged at its fiercest some hours back . Soon after daylight the wind sank ; but the majesty of [the mighty sea]2729-the mighty sea had lost none of its terror and grandeur as yet . The huge Atlantic waves still hurled themselves , foaming and furious , against the massive granite of [the Cornish cliffs]2730-the cornish cliffs . Overhead , the sky was hidden in a thick white mist , now hanging , still and dripping , down to the ground ; now rolling in shapes like vast smoke - wreaths before the light wind which still blew at intervals . At a distance of more than a few yards , the largest objects were totally invisible . [I]0-i had nothing to guide [me]0-i , as [I]0-i advanced , but the ceaseless roaring of [the sea]498-the sea on [my]0-i right hand .

It was [my]0-i purpose to get to [Penzance]28-penzance by night . Beyond that , [I]0-i had no project , no thought of what refuge [I]0-i should seek next . Any hope [I]0-i might have formerly felt of escaping from [Mannion]73-mannion , had now deserted [me]0-i for ever . [I]0-i could not discover by any outward indications , that [he]73-mannion was still following [my]0-i footsteps . The mist obscured all objects behind [me]0-i from view ; the ceaseless crashing of the shore - waves overwhelmed all landward sounds , but [I]0-i never doubted for a moment that [he]73-mannion was watching [me]0-i , as [I]0-i proceeded along [my]0-i onward way .

[I]0-i walked slowly , keeping from the edge of [the precipices]2732-the precipices only by keeping the sound of [the sea]498-the sea always at the same distance from [my]0-i ear ; knowing that [I]0-i was advancing in the proper direction , though very circuitously , as long as [I]0-i heard the waves on [my]0-i right hand . To have ventured on the shorter way , by [the moor]2675-the moor and [the cross - roads beyond [it]2675-the moor]2735-the cross - roads beyond it , would have been only to have lost [myself]0-i past all chance of extrication , in the mist .

In this tedious manner [I]0-i had gone on for some time , before it struck [me]0-i that the noise of [the sea]498-the sea was altering completely to [my]0-i sense of hearing . It seemed to be sounding very strangely on each side of [me]0-i - both on [my]0-i right hand and on [my]0-i left . [I]0-i stopped and strained [my]0-i eyes to look through the mist , but it was useless . Crags only a few yards off , seemed like shadows in the thick white vapour . Again , [I]0-i went on a little ; and , ere long , [I]0-i heard rolling towards [me]0-i , as it were , under [my]0-i own feet , and under the roaring of [the sea]498-the sea , a howling , hollow , intermittent sound - like thunder at a distance . [I]0-i stopped again , and rested against a rock . After some time , the mist began to part to seaward , but remained still as thick as ever on each side of [me]0-i . [I]0-i went on towards the lighter sky in front - the thunder - sound booming louder and louder , in the very heart , as it seemed , of [the great cliff]2738-the great cliff .

The mist brightened yet a little more , and showed [me]0-i a landmark to ships , standing on [the highest point of the surrounding rocks]2739-the highest point of the surrounding rocks . [I]0-i climbed to [it]2740-it , recognised the glaring red and white pattern in which it was painted , and knew that [I]0-i had wandered , in the mist , away from the regular line of coast , out on one of the great granite promontories which project into [the sea]498-the sea , as natural breakwaters , on [the southern shore of [Cornwall]25-cornwall]2609-the southern shore of cornwall .

[I]0-i had twice penetrated as far as [this place]3077-this place , at the earlier period of [my]0-i sojourn in [the fishing - hamlet]2744-the fishing - hamlet , and while [I]0-i now listened to the thunder - sound , [I]0-i knew from what cause it proceeded .

Beyond the spot where [I]0-i stood , the rocks descended suddenly , and almost perpendicularly , to [the range below [them]2746-them]2745-the range below them . In [one of the highest parts of [the wall - side of granite thus formed]2748-the wall - side of granite thus formed]2747-one of the highest parts of the wall - side of granite thus formed , there opened a black , yawning hole that slanted nearly straight downwards , like [a tunnel]2749-a tunnel , to [unknown and unfathomable depths below]2750-unknown and unfathomable depths below , into which the waves found entrance through [some subterranean channel]2751-some subterranean channel . Even at calm times [the sea]498-the sea was never silent in [this frightful abyss]2753-this frightful abyss , but on stormy days its fury was terrific . The wild waves boiled and thundered in their imprisonment , till they seemed to convulse the solid cliff about [them]2754-they , like an earthquake . But , high as [they]2754-they leapt up in the rocky walls of [the chasm]2755-the chasm , [they]2754-they never leapt into sight from above . Nothing but clouds of spray indicated to the eye , what must be the horrible tumult of the raging waters below .

With [my]0-i recognition of the place to which [I]0-i had now wandered , came remembrance of the dangers [I]0-i had left behind [me]0-i on the rock - track that led from [the mainland]2756-the mainland to [the promontory]2757-the promontory - dangers of narrow ledges and treacherous precipices , which [I]0-i had passed safely , while unconscious of them in the mist , but which [I]0-i shrank from tempting again , now that [I]0-i recollected them , until the sky had cleared , and [I]0-i could see [my]0-i way well before [me]0-i . The atmosphere was still brightening slowly over the tossing , distant waves : [I]0-i determined to wait until it had lost all its obscurity , before [I]0-i ventured to retrace [my]0-i steps .

[I]0-i moved down towards [the lower range of rocks]2758-the lower range of rocks , to seek a less exposed position than that which [I]0-i now occupied . As [I]0-i neared [the chasm]2755-the chasm , the terrific howling of the waves inside [it]2755-the chasm was violent enough to drown , not only the crashing sound of the surf on [the outward crags of [the promontory]2757-the promontory]2760-the outward crags of the promontory , but even the shrill cries of the hundreds on hundreds of sea - birds that whirled around [me]0-i , except when their flight was immediately over [my]0-i head . At each side of [the abyss]2762-the abyss , the rocks , though very precipitous , afforded firm hold for hand and foot . As [I]0-i descended them , the morbid longing to look on danger , which has led [many a man]2763-many a man to the very brink of a precipice , even while [he]2763-many a man dreaded it , led [me]0-i to advance as near as [I]0-i durst to [the side of [the great hole]2765-the great hole]2764-the side of the great hole , and to gaze down into [it]2765-the great hole . [I]0-i could see but little of [its]2765-the great hole black , shining , interior walls , or of the fragments of rock which here and there jutted out from them , crowned with patches of long , lank , sea - weed waving slowly to and fro in empty space - [I]0-i could see but little of these things , for the spray from the bellowing water in the invisible depths below , steamed up almost incessantly , like smoke , and shot , hissing in clouds out of [the mouth of [the chasm]2755-the chasm]2766-the mouth of the chasm , on to [a huge flat rock , covered with sea - weed , that lay beneath and in front of [it]2765-the great hole]2768-a huge flat rock , covered with sea - weed , that lay beneath and in front of it . The very sight of [this smooth , slippery plane of granite]2769-this smooth , slippery plane of granite , shelving steeply downward , right into the gaping depths of [the hole]2770-the hole , made [my]0-i head swim ; the thundering of the water bewildered and deafened [me]0-i - [I]0-i moved away while [I]0-i had the power : away , some thirty or forty yards in a lateral direction , towards the edges of [the promontory]2757-the promontory which looked down on [the sea]498-the sea . Here , the rocks rose again in wild shapes , forming natural caverns and penthouses . Towards one of these [I]0-i now advanced , to shelter [myself]0-i till the sky had cleared .

[I]0-i had just entered [the place]435-the place , close to [the edge of [the cliff]2775-the cliff]2774-the edge of the cliff , when a hand was laid suddenly and firmly on [my]0-i arm ; and , through the crashing of the waves below , the thundering of the water in [the abyss]2762-the abyss behind , and the shrieking of the seabirds overhead , [I]0-i heard these words , spoken close to [my]0-i ear : -

" Take care of [your]4801-your life . It is not [your]4801-your 's to throw away - it is [mine]0-i ! "[0-i]

[I]0-i turned , and saw [Mannion]73-mannion standing by [me]0-i . No shade concealed the hideous distortion of [his]73-mannion face . [His]73-mannion eye was on [me]0-i , as [he]73-mannion pointed significantly down to the surf foaming two hundred feet beneath [us]2777-us .

" Suicide ! "[73-mannion] [he]73-mannion said slowly - " [I]73-mannion suspected it , and , this time , [I]73-mannion followed close : followed , to fight with death , which should have [you]0-i . "[73-mannion]

As [I]0-i moved back from the edge of [the precipice]2778-the precipice , and shook [him]73-mannion from [me]0-i , [I]0-i marked the vacancy that glared even through the glaring triumph of [his]73-mannion eye , and remembered how [I]0-i had been warned against [him]73-mannion at [the hospital]3549-the hospital .

The mist was thickening again , but thickening now in clouds that parted and changed minute by minute , under the influence of the light behind [them]2780-them . [I]0-i had noticed these sudden transitions before , and knew them to be the signs which preceded the speedy clearing of the atmosphere .

When [I]0-i looked up at the sky , [Mannion]73-mannion stepped back a few paces , and pointed in the direction of [the fishing - hamlet from which [I]0-i had departed]2781-the fishing - hamlet from which i had departed .

" Even in [that remote place]4802-that remote place , "[73-mannion] [he]73-mannion said , " and among [those ignorant people]4803-those ignorant people , [my]73-mannion deformed face has borne witness against [you]0-i , and [Margaret]44-margaret 's death has been avenged , as [I]73-mannion said it should . [You]0-i have been expelled as [a pest and a curse]4804-a pest and a curse , by [a community of [poor fishermen]4806-poor fishermen]4805-a community of poor fishermen ; [you]0-i have begun to live [your]0-i life of excommunication , as [I]73-mannion lived [mine]73-mannion . Superstition ! - barbarous , monstrous superstition , which [I]73-mannion found ready made to [my]73-mannion use , is the scourge with which [I]73-mannion have driven [you]0-i from that hiding - place . Look at [me]73-mannion now ! [I]73-mannion have got back [my]73-mannion strength ; [I]73-mannion am no longer [the sick refuse of [the hospital]3549-the hospital]4807-the sick refuse of the hospital . Where [you]0-i go , [I]73-mannion have the limbs and the endurance to go too ! [I]73-mannion tell [you]0-i again , [we]4809-we are linked together for life ; [I]73-mannion can not leave [you]0-i if [I]73-mannion would . The horrible joy of hunting [you]0-i through [the world]158-the world , leaps in [my]73-mannion blood like fire ! Look ! look out on those tossing waves . There is no rest for [them]4811-them ; there shall be no rest for [you]0-i ! "[73-mannion]

The sight of [him]2782-him , standing close by [me]0-i in that wild solitude ; the hoarse sound of [his]2782-him voice , as [he]2782-him raised it almost to raving in [his]2782-him exultation over [my]0-i helplessness ; the incessant crashing of the sea on [the outer rocks]2783-the outer rocks ; the roaring of the tortured waters imprisoned in the depths of [the abyss behind [us]2785-us]2784-the abyss behind us ; the obscurity of the mist , and the strange , wild shapes it began to take , as it now rolled almost over [our]2785-us heads - -all that [I]0-i saw , all that [I]0-i heard , seemed suddenly to madden [me]0-i , as [Mannion]73-mannion uttered [his]73-mannion last words .
