[My]0-i brain felt turned to fire ; [my]0-i heart to ice . A horrible temptation to rid [myself]0-i for ever of the wretch before [me]0-i , by hurling [him]2782-him over the precipice at [my]0-i feet , seized on [me]0-i . [I]0-i felt [my]0-i hands stretching themselves out towards [him]2782-him without [my]0-i willing it - if [I]0-i had waited another instant , [I]0-i should have dashed [him]2782-him or [myself]0-i to destruction . But [I]0-i turned back in time ; and , reckless of all danger , fled from the sight of [him]2782-him , over [the rugged and perilous surface of [the cliff]2775-the cliff]2786-the rugged and perilous surface of the cliff .

The shock of a fall among the rocks , before [I]0-i had advanced more than a few yards , partly restored [my]0-i self - possession . Still , [I]0-i dared not look back to see if [Mannion]73-mannion was following [me]0-i , so long as the precipice behind [him]73-mannion was within view .

[I]0-i began to climb to the higher range of rocks almost at the same spot by which [I]0-i had descended from [them]2788-them - judging by the close thunder of the water in [the chasm]2755-the chasm . Halfway up , [I]0-i stopped at a broad resting - place ; and found that [I]0-i must proceed a little , either to the right or to the left , in a horizontal direction , before [I]0-i could easily get higher . At that moment , the mist was slowly brightening again . [I]0-i looked first to the left , to see where [I]0-i could get good foothold - then to the right , towards the outer sides of the riven rocks close at hand .

At the same instant , [I]0-i caught sight dimly of the figure of [Mannion]73-mannion , moving shadow - like below and beyond [me]0-i , skirting the farther edge of the slippery plane of granite that shelved into [the gaping mouth of [the hole]2770-the hole]2790-the gaping mouth of the hole . The brightening atmosphere showed [him]73-mannion that [he]73-mannion had risked [himself]73-mannion , in [the mist]2792-the mist , too near to [a dangerous place]2793-a dangerous place . [He]73-mannion stopped - looked up and saw [me]0-i watching [him]73-mannion - raised [his]73-mannion hand - and shook it threateningly in the air . The ill - calculated violence of [his]73-mannion action , in making that menacing gesture , destroyed [his]73-mannion equilibrium - [he]73-mannion staggered - tried to recover [himself]73-mannion - swayed half round where [he]73-mannion stood - then fell heavily backward , right on to the steep shelving rock .

The wet sea - weed slipped through [his]73-mannion fingers , as they madly clutched at it . [He]73-mannion struggled frantically to throw [himself]73-mannion towards the side of the declivity ; slipping further and further down it at every effort . Close to [the mouth of [the abyss]2762-the abyss]2794-the mouth of the abyss , [he]73-mannion sprang up as if [he]73-mannion had been shot . A tremendous jet of spray hissed out upon [him]73-mannion at the same moment . [I]0-i heard a scream , so shrill , so horribly unlike any human cry , that it seemed to silence the very thundering of the water . The spray fell . For one instant , [I]0-i saw two livid and bloody hands tossed up against the black walls of the hole , as [he]73-mannion dropped into it . Then , the waves roared again fiercely in their hidden depths ; the spray flew out once more ; and when it cleared off ; nothing was to be seen at [the yawning mouth of [the chasm]2755-the chasm]2796-the yawning mouth of the chasm - nothing moved over [the shelving granite]2798-the shelving granite , but some torn particles of sea - weed sliding slowly downwards in the running ooze .

The shock of that sight must have paralysed within [me]0-i the power of remembering what followed it ; for [I]0-i can recall nothing , after looking on the emptiness of the rock below , except that [I]0-i crouched on the ledge under [my]0-i feet , to save [myself]0-i from falling off it - that there was an interval of oblivion - and that [I]0-i seemed to awaken again , as it were , to the thundering of the water in [the abyss]2762-the abyss . When [I]0-i rose and looked around [me]0-i , the seaward sky was lovely in its clearness ; the foam of the leaping waves flashed gloriously in the sunlight : and all that remained of the mist was one great cloud of purple shadow , hanging afar off over the whole inland view .

[I]0-i traced [my]0-i way back along [the promontory]2757-the promontory feebly and slowly . [My]0-i weakness was so great , that [I]0-i trembled in every limb . A strange uncertainty about directing [myself]0-i in the simplest actions , overcame [my]0-i mind . Sometimes , [I]0-i stopped short , hesitating in spite of [myself]0-i at the slightest obstacles in [my]0-i path . Sometimes , [I]0-i grew confused without any cause , about the direction in which [I]0-i was proceeding , and fancied [I]0-i was going back to [the fishing village]2801-the fishing village .. The sight that [I]0-i had witnessed , seemed to be affecting [me]0-i physically , far more than mentally . As [I]0-i dragged [myself]0-i on [my]0-i weary way along [the coast]2802-the coast , there was always the same painful vacancy in [my]0-i thoughts : there seemed to be no power in them yet , of realising [Mannion]73-mannion 's appalling death .

By the time [I]0-i arrived at [this village]2803-this village , [my]0-i strength was so utterly exhausted , that [the people at [the inn]2805-the inn]2804-the people at the inn were obliged to help [me]0-i [upstairs]3063-upstairs . Even now , after some hours ' rest , the mere exertion of dipping [my]0-i pen in the ink begins to be a labour and a pain to [me]0-i . There is a strange fluttering at [my]0-i heart ; [my]0-i recollections are growing confused again - [I]0-i can write no more .

23rd . - The frightful scene that [I]0-i witnessed yesterday still holds the same disastrous influence over [me]0-i . [I]0-i have vainly endeavoured to think , not of [Mannion]73-mannion 's death , but of the free prospect which that death has opened to [my]0-i view . Waking or sleeping , it is as if some fatality kept all [my]0-i faculties imprisoned within the black walls of [the chasm]2755-the chasm . [I]0-i saw the livid , bleeding hands flying past them again , in [my]0-i dreams , last night . And now , while the morning is clear and the breeze is fresh , no repose , no change comes to [my]0-i thoughts . Time bright beauty of unclouded daylight seems to have lost the happy influence over [me]0-i which it used formerly to possess .

25th . - All yesterday [I]0-i had not energy enough even to add a line to this journal . The strength to control [myself]0-i seems to have gone from [me]0-i . The slightest accidental noise in [the house]244-the house , throws [me]0-i into a fit of trembling which [I]0-i can not subdue . Surely , if ever the death of [one human being]668-one human being brought release and salvation to another , the death of [Mannion]73-mannion has brought [them]2810-them to [me]0-i ; and yet , the effect left on [my]0-i mind by the horror of having seen it , is still not lessened - not even by the knowledge of all that [I]0-i have gained by being freed from [the deadliest and most determined enemy [that man]212-that man ever had]2811-the deadliest and most determined enemy that man ever had .

26th . - Visions - half waking , half dreaming - all through the night . Visions of [my]0-i last lonely evening in [the fishing - hamlet]2744-the fishing - hamlet - of [Mannion]73-mannion again - the livid hands whirling to and fro over [my]0-i head in the darkness - then , glimpses of [home]176-home ; of [Clara]57-clara reading to [me]0-i in [[my]0-i study]609-my study - then , a change to [the room where [Margaret]44-margaret died]2816-the room where margaret died - the sight of [her]57-clara again , with [her]57-clara long black hair streaming over [her]57-clara face - then , oblivion for a little while - then , [Mannion]73-mannion once more ; walking backwards and forwards by [my]0-i bedside - [his]73-mannion death , seeming like a dream ; [his]73-mannion watching [me]0-i through the night like a reality to which [I]0-i had just awakened - [Clara]57-clara walking opposite to [him]73-mannion on the other side - [Ralph]39-ralph between [them]2817-them , pointing at [me]0-i .

27th . - [I]0-i am afraid [my]0-i mind is seriously affected ; it must have been fatally weakened before [I]0-i passed through the terrible scenes among [the rocks of [the promontory]2757-the promontory]2818-the rocks of the promontory . [My]0-i nerves must have suffered far more than [I]0-i suspected at the time , under the constant suspense in which [I]0-i have been living since [I]0-i left [London]10-london , and under the incessant strain and agitation of writing the narrative of all that has happened to [me]0-i . Shall [I]0-i send a letter to [Ralph]39-ralph ? No - not yet . It might look like impatience , like not being able to bear [my]0-i necessary absence as calmly and resolutely as [I]0-i ought .

28th . - A wakeful night - tormented by morbid apprehensions that the reports about [me]0-i in [the fishing - village]2820-the fishing - village may spread to [this place]3077-this place ; that inquiries may be made after [Mannion]73-mannion ; and that [I]0-i may be suspected of having caused [his]73-mannion death .

29th . - [The people at [the inn]2805-the inn]2804-the people at the inn have sent to get [me]0-i medical advice . [The doctor]3241-the doctor came to - day . [He]73-mannion was kindness [itself]73-mannion ; but [I]0-i fell into a fit of trembling , the moment [he]73-mannion entered [the room]263-the room - grew confused in attempting to tell [him]73-mannion what was the matter with [me]0-i - and , at last , could not articulate a single word distinctly . [He]73-mannion looked very grave as [he]73-mannion examined [me]0-i and questioned [the landlady]625-the landlady . [I]0-i thought [I]0-i heard [him]73-mannion say something about sending for [[my]0-i friends]1271-my friends , but could not be certain .

31st . - Weaker and weaker . [I]0-i tried in despair , to - day , to write to [Ralph]39-ralph ; but knew not how to word the letter . The simplest forms of expression confused themselves inextricably in [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i was obliged to give it up . It is a surprise to [me]0-i to find that [I]0-i can still add with [my]0-i pencil to the entries in this Journal ! When [I]0-i am no longer able to continue , in some sort , the employment to which [I]0-i have been used for so many weeks past , what will become of [me]0-i ? Shall [I]0-i have lost the only safeguard that keeps [me]0-i in [my]0-i senses ?

Worse ! worse ! [I]0-i have forgotten what day of the month it is ; and can not remember it for a moment together , when [they]2828-they tell [me]0-i - can not even recollect how long [I]0-i have been confined to [my]0-i bed . [I]0-i feel as if [my]0-i heart was wasting away . Oh ! if [I]0-i could only see [Clara]57-clara again .

[The doctor]3241-the doctor and [a strange man]2830-a strange man have been looking among [my]0-i papers .

[[My]0-i God]3522-my god ! am [I]0-i dying ? dying at the very time when there is a chance of happiness for [my]0-i future life ?

[Clara]57-clara ! - far from [her]57-clara - nothing but the little book - marker [she]57-clara worked for [me]0-i - leave it round [my]0-i neck when [I]0-i -

[I]0-i ca n't move , or breathe , or think - if [I]0-i could only be taken back - if [[my]0-i father]147-my father could see [me]0-i as [I]0-i am now ! Night again - the dreams that will come - always of [home]176-home ; sometimes , [the untried home in [heaven]3526-heaven]2834-the untried home in heaven , as well as [the familiar home on [earth]1969-earth]2836-the familiar home on earth -

[Clara]57-clara ! [I]0-i shall die out of [my]0-i senses , unless [Clara]57-clara - break the news gently - it may kill [her]57-clara -

[Her]57-clara face so bright and calm ! [her]57-clara watchful , weeping eyes always looking at [me]0-i , with a light in them that shines steady through the quivering tears . While the light lasts , [I]0-i shall live ; when it begins to die out -

NOTE BY [THE EDITOR]2838-the editor .

There are some lines of writing beyond this point ; but they are illegible .

LETTERS IN [CONCLUSION]29-conclusion .

LETTER [I.]0-i

FROM [WILLIAM PENHALE]91-william , [MINER]2839-miner , AT [BARTALLOCK]30-bartallock , IN [CORNWALL]25-cornwall , TO [[HIS]91-william WIFE]997-his wife IN [LONDON]10-london .

[MY]0-i DEAR [MARY]92-mary ,

[I]0-i received [your]92-mary letter yesterday , and was more glad than [I]0-i can say , at hearing that [our]2841-our darling girl [Susan]64-susan has got such a good place in [London]10-london , and likes [[her]64-susan new mistress]2842-her new mistress so well . [My]0-i kind respects to [[your]92-mary sister]3308-your sister and [[her]3308-your sister husband]480-her husband , and say [I]0-i do n't grumble about the money that 's been spent in sending [you]92-mary with [Susan]64-susan to take care of [her]64-susan . [She]64-susan was too young , [poor child]2845-poor child , to be trusted to make the journey alone ; and , as [I]0-i was obliged to stop at [home]176-home and work to keep [the other children]2847-the other children , and pay back what [we]2841-our borrowed for the trip , of course [you]92-mary were the proper person , after [me]0-i , to go with [Susan]64-susan - whose welfare is a more precious possession to [us]2841-our than any money , [I]0-i am sure . Besides , when [I]0-i married [you]92-mary , and took [you]92-mary away to [Cornwall]25-cornwall , [I]0-i always promised [you]92-mary a trip to [London]10-london to see [[your]92-mary friends]4766-your friends again ; and now that promise is performed . So , once again , do n't fret about the money that 's been spent : [I]0-i shall soon pay it back .

[I]0-i 've got some very strange news for [you]92-mary , [Mary]92-mary . [You]92-mary know how bad work was getting at [the mine]2849-the mine , before [you]92-mary went away - so bad , that [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i after [you]92-mary had gone , " Had n't [I]0-i better try what [I]0-i can do in the fishing at [Treen]31-treen ? "[0-i] And [I]0-i went [there]161-there ; and , thank [God]37-god , have got on well by it . [I]0-i can turn [my]0-i hand to most things ; and the fishing has been very good this year . So [I]0-i have stuck to [my]0-i work . And now [I]0-i come to [my]0-i news .

[The landlady at [the inn]2805-the inn here]2851-the landlady at the inn here , is , as [you]92-mary know , a sort of relation of [mine]0-i . Well , the third afternoon after [you]92-mary had gone , [I]0-i was stopping to say a word to [her]2851-the landlady at the inn here at [her]2851-the landlady at the inn here own door , on [my]0-i way to [the beach]140-the beach , when [we]2854-we saw [a young gentleman]2855-a young gentleman , quite [a stranger]842-a stranger , coming up to [us]2854-we . [He]2855-a young gentleman looked very pale and wild - like , [I]0-i thought , when [he]2855-a young gentleman asked for a bed ; and then got faint all of a sudden - so faint and ill , that [I]0-i was obliged to lend a hand in getting [him]2855-a young gentleman [upstairs]3063-upstairs . The next morning [I]0-i heard [he]2855-a young gentleman was worse : and it was just the same story the morning after . [He]2855-a young gentleman quite frightened [the landlady]625-the landlady , [he]2855-a young gentleman was so restless , and talked to [himself]2855-a young gentleman in such a strange way ; specially at night . [He]2855-a young gentleman would n't say what was the matter with [him]2855-a young gentleman , or who [he]2855-a young gentleman was : [we]2854-we could only find out that [he]2855-a young gentleman had been stopping among [the fishing people further west]2859-the fishing people further west : and that [they]2859-the fishing people further west had not behaved very well to [him]2855-a young gentleman at last - more shame for [them]2859-the fishing people further west ! [I]0-i 'm sure [they]2859-the fishing people further west could take no hurt from [the poor young fellow]2860-the poor young fellow , let [him]2860-the poor young fellow be whom [he]2860-the poor young fellow may . Well , the end of it was that [I]0-i went and fetched [the doctor]3241-the doctor for [him]2855-a young gentleman [myself]0-i , and when [we]2854-we got into [[his]2855-a young gentleman room]4404-his room , [we]2854-we found [him]2855-a young gentleman all pale and trembling , and looking at [us]2854-we , [poor soul]2863-poor soul , as if [he]2855-a young gentleman thought [we]2854-we meant to murder [him]2855-a young gentleman . [The doctor]3241-the doctor gave [his]2855-a young gentleman complaint some hard names which [I]0-i do n't know how to write down ; but it seems there 's more the matter with [his]2855-a young gentleman mind than [his]2855-a young gentleman body , and that [he]2855-a young gentleman must have had some great fright which has shaken [his]2855-a young gentleman nerves all to pieces . The only way to do [him]2855-a young gentleman good , as [the doctor]3241-the doctor said , was to have [him]2855-a young gentleman carefully nursed by [[his]2855-a young gentleman relations]2866-his relations , and kept quiet among [[people]106-people [he]2855-a young gentleman knew]2868-people he knew ; strange faces about [him]2855-a young gentleman being likely to make [him]2855-a young gentleman worse . [The doctor]3241-the doctor asked where [[his]2855-a young gentleman friends]4129-his friends lived ; but [he]2855-a young gentleman would n't say , and , lately , [he]2855-a young gentleman 's got so much worse that [he]2855-a young gentleman ca n't speak clearly to [us]2871-us at all .

Yesterday evening , [he]2855-a young gentleman gave [us]2871-us all a fright . [The doctor]3241-the doctor hearing [me]0-i below , asking after [him]2855-a young gentleman , said [I]0-i was to come up [stairs]1197-stairs and help to move [him]2855-a young gentleman to have [his]2855-a young gentleman bed made . As soon as [I]0-i raised [him]2855-a young gentleman up though [I]0-i 'm sure [I]0-i touched [him]2855-a young gentleman as gently as [I]0-i could , [he]2855-a young gentleman fainted dead away . While [he]2855-a young gentleman was being brought to , a little piece of something that looked like card - board , prettily embroidered with beads and silk , came away from a string that held it round [his]2855-a young gentleman neck , and dropped off the bedside . [I]0-i picked it up ; for [I]0-i remembered the time , [Mary]92-mary , when [you]92-mary and [I]0-i were courting , and how precious the least thing was to [me]0-i that belonged to [you]92-mary . So [I]0-i took care of it for [him]2855-a young gentleman , thinking it might be a keepsake from [[his]2855-a young gentleman sweetheart]2874-his sweetheart . And sure enough , when [he]2855-a young gentleman came to , [he]2855-a young gentleman put up [his]2855-a young gentleman thin white hands to [his]2855-a young gentleman neck , and looked so thankful at [me]0-i when [I]0-i tied the little thing again to the string ! Just as [I]0-i had done that , [the doctor]3241-the doctor beckons [me]0-i to the other end of [the room]263-the room .

" This wo n't do , "[3241-the doctor] says [he]3241-the doctor to [me]0-i in a whisper . " If [he]2855-a young gentleman goes on like this , [he]2855-a young gentleman 'll lose [his]2855-a young gentleman reason , if not [his]2855-a young gentleman life . [I]3241-the doctor must search [his]2855-a young gentleman papers , to find out what [friends]440-friends [he]2855-a young gentleman has ; and [you]0-i must be [[my]3241-the doctor witness]4813-my witness . "[3241-the doctor]

So [the doctor]3241-the doctor opens [his]3241-the doctor little bag , and takes out a square sealed packet first ; then two or three letters tied together ; [the poor soul]2878-the poor soul looking all the while as if [he]2878-the poor soul longed to prevent [us]2879-us from touching them . Well , [the doctor]3241-the doctor said there was no occasion to open the packet , for the direction was the same on all the letters , and the name corresponded with [his]3241-the doctor initials marked on [his]3241-the doctor linen .

" [I]3241-the doctor 'm next to certain this is where [he]2855-a young gentleman lives , or did live ; so this is where [I]3241-the doctor 'll write , "[3241-the doctor] says [the doctor]3241-the doctor .

" Shall [[my]2882-my wife]864-my wife take the letter , [Sir]3046-sir ? "[2882-my] says [I.]2882-my " [She]864-my wife 's in [London]10-london with [[our]2879-us girl]4816-our girl , [Susan]64-susan ; and , if [[his]2855-a young gentleman friends]4129-his friends should be gone away from where [you]3046-sir are writing to , [she]864-my wife may be able to trace [them]4129-his friends . "[2882-my]

" Quite right , [Penhale]92-mary ! "[3241-the doctor] says [he]3241-the doctor ; " [we]2879-us 'll do that . Write to [[your]92-mary wife]3287-your wife , and put [my]3241-the doctor letter inside [yours]92-mary . "[3241-the doctor]

[I]0-i did as [he]3241-the doctor told [me]0-i , at once ; and [his]3241-the doctor letter is inside this , with the direction of [the house]244-the house and [the street]163-the street .

Now , [Mary]92-mary , [dear]3113-dear , go at once , and see what [you]3113-dear can find out . The direction on [the doctor]3241-the doctor 's letter may be [[his]3241-the doctor home]3740-his home ; and if it is n't , there may be [people there]4063-people there who can tell [you]3113-dear where it is . So go at once , and let [us]2889-us know directly what luck [you]3113-dear have had , for there is no time to be lost ; and if [you]3113-dear saw [the young gentleman]2890-the young gentleman , [you]3113-dear would pity [him]2890-the young gentleman as much as [we]2889-us do .

This has got to be such a long letter , that [I]0-i have no room left to write any more . God bless [you]3113-dear , [Mary]92-mary , and God bless [[my]0-i darling]2891-my darling [Susan]64-susan ! Give [her]64-susan a kiss for [father]477-father 's sake , and believe [me]0-i , [[Your]3113-dear loving husband]2893-your loving husband ,

[WILLIAM PENHALE]91-william .

LETTER II .

FROM [MARY PENHALE]92-mary TO [[HER]92-mary HUSBAND]480-her husband

DEAREST [WILLIAM]91-william ,

[Susan]64-susan sends a hundred kisses , and best loves to [you]91-william and [[her]64-susan brothers]2895-her brothers and [sisters]2896-sisters . [She]64-susan 's getting on nicely ; and [[her]64-susan mistress]2266-her mistress is as kind and fond of [her]64-susan as can be . Best respects , too , from [[my]0-i sister]296-my sister [Martha]80-old martha , and [[her]80-old martha husband]480-her husband . And now [I]0-i 've done giving [you]91-william all [my]0-i messages , [I]0-i 'll tell [you]91-william some good news for [the poor young gentleman who is so bad at [Treen]31-treen]2900-the poor young gentleman who is so bad at treen .

As soon as [I]0-i had seen [Susan]64-susan , and read [your]91-william letter to [her]64-susan , [I]0-i went to the place where [the doctor]3241-the doctor 's letter directed [me]0-i . Such [a grand house]2902-a grand house , [William]91-william ! [I]0-i was really afraid to knock at the door . So [I]0-i plucked up courage , and gave a pull at the bell ; and [a very fat , big man]2903-a very fat , big man , with [his]2903-a very fat , big man head all plastered over with powder , opened the door , almost before [I]0-i had done ringing . " If [you]2903-a very fat , big man please , [Sir]3046-sir , "[0-i] says [I]0-i , showing [him]2903-a very fat , big man the name on [the doctor]3241-the doctor 's letter , " do [any friends of [this gentleman]3237-this gentleman]4820-any friends of this gentleman live [here]3265-here ? "[0-i] " To be sure [they]4820-any friends of this gentleman do , "[2903-a very fat , big man] says [he]2903-a very fat , big man ; " [[his]3237-this gentleman father]3694-his father and [sister]155-sister live [here]3265-here : but what do [you]0-i want to know for ? "[2903-a very fat , big man] " [I]0-i want [them]4820-any friends of this gentleman to read this letter , "[0-i] says [I.]0-i " It 's to tell [them]4820-any friends of this gentleman that [the young gentleman]2890-the young gentleman is very bad in health down in [[our]4827-our country]4828-our country . "[0-i] " [You]0-i ca n't see [[my]2903-a very fat , big man master]3047-my master , "[2903-a very fat , big man] says [he]2903-a very fat , big man , " for [he]3047-my master 's confined to [his]3047-my master bed by illness : and [Miss Clara]57-clara is very poorly too - [you]0-i had better leave the letter with [me]2903-a very fat , big man . "[2903-a very fat , big man] Just as [he]2903-a very fat , big man said this , [an elderly lady]677-an elderly lady crossed [the hall]1423-the hall [I]0-i found out [she]677-an elderly lady was [the housekeeper]2907-the housekeeper , afterwards , and asked what [I]0-i wanted . When [I]0-i told [her]677-an elderly lady , [she]677-an elderly lady looked quite startled . " Step this way , [ma'am]4830-ma'am , "[677-an elderly lady] says [she]677-an elderly lady ; " [you]4830-ma'am will do [Miss Clara]57-clara more good than all [the doctors]1997-the doctors put together . But [you]4830-ma'am must break the news to [her]57-clara carefully , before [she]57-clara sees the letter . Please to make it out better news than it is , for [the young lady]774-the young lady is in very delicate health . "[677-an elderly lady] [We]2908-we went [upstairs]3063-upstairs - such [stair - carpets]2910-stair - carpets ! [I]0-i was almost frightened to step on them , after walking through [the dirty streets]2911-the dirty streets . [The housekeeper]2907-the housekeeper opened a door , and said a few words inside , which [I]0-i could not hear , and then let [me]0-i in where [the young lady]774-the young lady was .

Oh , [William]91-william ! [she]774-the young lady had the sweetest , kindest face [I]0-i ever saw in [my]0-i life . But it was so pale , and there was such a sad look in [her]774-the young lady eyes when [she]774-the young lady asked [me]0-i to sit down , that it went to [my]0-i heart , when [I]0-i thought of the news [I]0-i had to tell [her]774-the young lady . [I]0-i could n't speak just at first ; and [I]0-i suppose [she]774-the young lady thought [I]0-i was in some trouble - for [she]774-the young lady begged [me]0-i not to tell [her]774-the young lady what [I]0-i wanted , till [I]0-i was better . [She]774-the young lady said it with such a voice and such a look , that , like [a great fool]2914-a great fool , [I]0-i burst out crying , instead of answering as [I]0-i ought . But it did [me]0-i good , though , and made [me]0-i able to tell [her]774-the young lady about [[her]774-the young lady brother]1536-her brother breaking it as gently as [I]0-i could before [I]0-i gave [her]774-the young lady [the doctor]3241-the doctor 's letter . [She]774-the young lady never opened it ; but stood up before [me]0-i as if [she]774-the young lady was turned to stone - not able to cry , or speak , or move . It frightened [me]0-i so , to see [her]774-the young lady in such a dreadful state , that [I]0-i forgot all about [the grand house]2917-the grand house , and the difference there was between [us]2918-us ; and took [her]774-the young lady in [my]0-i arms , making [her]774-the young lady sit down on the sofa by [me]0-i - just as [I]0-i should do , if [I]0-i was consoling [our]2918-us own [Susan]64-susan under some great trouble . Well ! [I]0-i soon made [her]774-the young lady look more like [herself]774-the young lady , comforting [her]774-the young lady in every way [I]0-i could think of : and [she]774-the young lady laid [her]774-the young lady poor head on [my]0-i shoulder , and [I]0-i took and kissed [her]774-the young lady , not remembering a bit about its being [a born lady]2919-a born lady and [a stranger]842-a stranger that [I]0-i was kissing ; and the tears came at last , and did [her]774-the young lady good . As soon as [she]774-the young lady could speak , [she]774-the young lady thanked [God]37-god [[her]774-the young lady brother]1536-her brother was found , and had fallen into kind hands . [She]774-the young lady had n't courage to read [the doctor]3241-the doctor 's letter [herself]774-the young lady , and asked [me]0-i to do it . Though [he]3241-the doctor gave a very bad account of [the young gentleman]2890-the young gentleman , [he]3241-the doctor said that care and nursing , and getting [him]2890-the young gentleman away from a strange place to [[his]2890-the young gentleman own home]2924-his own home and among [[his]2890-the young gentleman friends]4129-his friends , might do wonders for [him]2890-the young gentleman yet . When [I]0-i came to this part of the letter , [she]774-the young lady started up , and asked [me]0-i to give it to [her]774-the young lady . Then [she]774-the young lady inquired when [I]0-i was going back to [Cornwall]25-cornwall ; and [I]0-i said , " as soon as possible , "[774-the young lady] for indeed , it 's time [I]0-i was [home]176-home , [William]91-william . " Wait ; pray wait till [I]774-the young lady have shown this letter to [[my]774-the young lady father]147-my father ! "[774-the young lady] says [she]774-the young lady . And [she]774-the young lady ran out of [the room]263-the room with it in [her]774-the young lady hand .

After some time , [she]774-the young lady came back with [her]774-the young lady face all of a flush , like ; looking quite different to what [she]774-the young lady did before , and saying that [I]0-i had done more to make [the family]179-the family happy by coming with that letter , than [she]774-the young lady could ever thank [me]0-i for as [she]774-the young lady ought . [A gentleman]3111-a gentleman followed [her]774-the young lady in , who was [[her]774-the young lady eldest brother]2930-her eldest brother [she]774-the young lady said ; [the pleasantest , liveliest gentleman [I]0-i ever saw]2931-the pleasantest , liveliest gentleman i ever saw . [He]3111-a gentleman shook hands as if [he]3111-a gentleman had known [me]0-i all [his]3111-a gentleman life ; and told [me]0-i [I]0-i was [the first person [he]3111-a gentleman had ever met with who had done good in [a family]330-a family]2932-the first person he had ever met with who had done good in a family by bringing [them]330-a family bad news . Then [he]3111-a gentleman asked [me]0-i whether [I]0-i was ready to go to [Cornwall]25-cornwall the next morning with [him]3111-a gentleman , and [the young lady]774-the young lady , and [a friend of [his]3111-a gentleman who was [a doctor]2936-a doctor]2935-a friend of his who was a doctor . [I]0-i had thought already of getting the parting over with poor [Susan]64-susan , that very day : so [I]0-i said , " Yes . "[0-i] After that , [they]2937-they would n't let [me]0-i go away till [I]0-i had had something to eat and drink ; and [the dear , kind young lady]2938-the dear , kind young lady asked [me]0-i all about [Susan]64-susan , and where [she]64-susan was living , and about [you]2939-you and [the children]2635-the children , just as if [she]64-susan had known [us]2941-us like [neighbours]441-neighbours . Poor thing ! [she]64-susan was so flurried , and so anxious for the next morning , that it was all [the gentleman]1118-the gentleman could do to keep [her]64-susan quiet , and prevent [her]64-susan falling into a sort of laughing and crying fit , which it seems [she]64-susan had been liable to lately . At last [they]2937-they let [me]0-i go away : and [I]0-i went and stayed with [Susan]64-susan as long as [I]0-i could before [I]0-i bid [her]64-susan good - bye . [She]64-susan bore the parting bravely - poor , [dear child]2944-dear child ! [God in heaven]2945-god in heaven bless [her]64-susan ; and [I]0-i 'm sure [he]1118-the gentleman will ; for [a better daughter]2946-a better daughter [no mother]2947-no mother ever had .

[[My]0-i dear husband]2948-my dear husband , [I]0-i am afraid this letter is very badly written ; but the tears are in [my]0-i eyes , thinking of [Susan]64-susan ; and [I]0-i feel so wearied and flurried after what has happened . [We]2949-we are to go off very early to - morrow morning in [a carriage]3210-a carriage , which is to be put on [the railway]2951-the railway . Only think of [my]0-i riding [home]176-home in [a fine carriage]2953-a fine carriage , with [gentlefolks]2954-gentlefolks ! - how surprised [Willie]45-minnie , and [Nancy]93-nancy , and [the other children]2847-the other children will be ! [I]0-i shall get to [Treen]31-treen almost as soon as [my]0-i letter ; but [I]0-i thought [I]0-i would write , so that [you]2956-you might have the good news , the first moment it could get to [you]2956-you , to tell [the poor young gentleman]2957-the poor young gentleman . [I]0-i 'm sure it must make [him]2957-the poor young gentleman better , only to hear that [[his]2957-the poor young gentleman brother]3693-his brother and [sister]155-sister are coming to fetch [him]2957-the poor young gentleman [home]176-home .

[I]0-i ca n't write any more , [dear William]91-william , [I]0-i 'm so very tired ; except that [I]0-i long to see [you]2956-you and [the little ones]2961-the little ones again ; and that [I]0-i am ,

[[Your]2956-you loving and dutiful wife]2962-your loving and dutiful wife ,

[MARY PENHALE]92-mary .

LETTER III .

TO [MR . JOHN BERNARD]84-mr. bernard , FROM [THE WRITER]495-the writer OF THE FORE - GOING AUTOBIOGRAPHY .

This letter is nearly nine years later in date than the letters which precede it .

[Lanreath Cottage]32-lanreath cottage , [Breconshire]33-breconshire .

[[MY]0-i DEAR FRIEND]2964-my dear friend ,

[I]0-i find , by [your]2956-you last letter , that [you]2956-you doubt whether [I]0-i still remember the circumstances under which [I]0-i made a certain promise to [you]2956-you , more than eight years ago . [You]2956-you are mistaken : not one of those circumstances has escaped [my]0-i memory . To satisfy [you]2956-you of this , [I]0-i will now recapitulate them . [You]2956-you will own , [I]0-i think , that [I]0-i have forgotten nothing .

After [my]0-i removal from [Cornwall]25-cornwall shall [I]0-i ever forget the first sight of [Clara]57-clara and [Ralph]39-ralph at [my]0-i bedside ! , when the nervous malady from which [I]0-i suffered so long , had yielded to the affectionate devotion of [[my]0-i family]197-my family - aided by the untiring exercise of [your]2956-you skill - one of [my]0-i first anxieties was to show that [I]0-i could gratefully appreciate [your]2956-you exertions for [my]0-i good , by reposing the same confidence in [you]2956-you , which [I]0-i should place in [[my]0-i nearest and dearest relatives]1055-my nearest and dearest relatives . From the time when [we]2967-we first met at [the hospital]3549-the hospital , [your]2956-you services were devoted to [me]0-i , through much misery of mind and body , with the delicacy and the self - denial of [a true friend]2969-a true friend . [I]0-i felt that it was only [your]2956-you due that [you]2956-you should know by what trials [I]0-i had been reduced to the situation in which [you]2956-you found [me]0-i , when [you]2956-you accompanied [[my]0-i brother]154-my brother and [sister]155-sister to [Cornwall]25-cornwall - [I]0-i felt this ; and placed in [your]2956-you hands , for [your]2956-you own private perusal , the narrative which [I]0-i had written of [my]0-i error and of its terrible consequences . To tell [you]2956-you all that had happened to [me]0-i , with [my]0-i own lips , was more than [I]0-i could do then - and even after this lapse of years , would be more than [I]0-i could do now .

After [you]2956-you had read the narrative , [you]2956-you urged [me]0-i , on returning it into [my]0-i possession , to permit its publication during [my]0-i lifetime . [I]0-i granted the justness of the reasons which led [you]2956-you to counsel [me]0-i thus ; but [I]0-i told [you]2956-you , at the same time , that an obstacle , which [I]0-i was bound to respect , would prevent [me]0-i from following [your]2956-you advice . While [[my]0-i father]147-my father lived , [I]0-i could not suffer a manuscript in which [he]147-my father was represented no matter under what excess of provocation as separating [himself]147-my father in the bitterest hostility from [[his]147-my father own son]1601-his own son , to be made public property . [I]0-i could not suffer events of which [we]2974-we never afterwards spoke [ourselves]2974-we , to be given to [others]98-others in the form of a printed narrative which might perhaps fall under [his]147-my father own eye . [You]2956-you acknowledged , [I]0-i remember , the justice of these considerations and promised , in case [I]0-i died before [him]147-my father , to keep back [my]0-i manuscript from publication as long as [[my]0-i father]147-my father lived . In binding [yourself]2956-you to that engagement , however , [you]2956-you stipulated , and [I]0-i agreed , that [I]0-i should reconsider [your]2956-you arguments in case [I]0-i outlived [him]147-my father . This was [my]0-i promise , and these were the circumstances under which it was made . [You]2956-you will allow , [I]0-i think , that [my]0-i memory is more accurate than [you]2956-you had imagined it to be .

And now , [you]2956-you write to remind [me]0-i of [my]0-i part of [our]2977-our agreement - forbearing , with [your]2956-you accustomed delicacy , to introduce the subject , until more than six months have elapsed since [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's death . [You]2956-you have done well . [I]0-i have had time to feel all the consolation afforded to [me]0-i by the remembrance that , for years past , [my]0-i life was of some use in sweetening [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's ; that [his]147-my father death has occurred in the ordinary course of Nature ; and that [I]0-i never , to [my]0-i own knowledge , gave [him]147-my father any cause to repent the full and loving reconciliation which took place between [us]2977-our , as soon as [we]2977-our could speak together freely after [my]0-i return to [home]176-home .

Still [I]0-i am not answering [your]2956-you question : - Am [I]0-i now willing to permit the publication of [my]0-i narrative , provided all names and places mentioned in it remained concealed , and [I]0-i am known to [no one]743-no one but [yourself]2956-you , [Ralph]39-ralph , and [Clara]57-clara , as [the writer of [my]0-i own story]2982-the writer of my own story ? [I]0-i reply that [I]0-i am willing . In a few days , [you]2956-you will receive the manuscript by a safe hand . Neither [[my]0-i brother]154-my brother nor [[my]0-i sister]296-my sister object to its being made public on the terms [I]0-i have mentioned ; and [I]0-i feel no hesitation in accepting the permission thus accorded to [me]0-i . [I]0-i have not glossed over the flightiness of [Ralph]39-ralph 's character ; but the brotherly kindness and manly generosity which lie beneath it , are as apparent , [I]0-i hope , in [my]0-i narrative as they are in fact . And [Clara]57-clara , dear [Clara]57-clara ! - all that [I]0-i have said of [her]57-clara is only to be regretted as unworthy of the noblest subject that [my]0-i pen , or any other pen , can have to write on .

One difficulty , however , still remains : - How are the pages which [I]0-i am about to send [you]2956-you to be concluded ? In the novel - reading sense of the word , [my]0-i story has no real conclusion . The repose that comes to all of [us]2985-us after trouble - to [me]0-i , a repose in life : to [others]98-others , how often a repose only in the grave ! - is the end which must close this autobiography : an end , calm , natural , and uneventful ; yet not , perhaps , devoid of all lesson and value . Is it fit that [I]0-i should set [myself]0-i , for the sake of effect , to make a conclusion , and terminate by fiction what has begun , and thus far , has proceeded in truth ? In the interests of Art , as well as in the interests of Reality , surely not !

Whatever remains to be related after the last entry in [my]0-i journal , will be found expressed in the simplest , and therefore , the best form , by the letters from [William]91-william and [Mary Penhale]92-mary , which [I]0-i send [you]2956-you with this . When [I]0-i revisited [Cornwall]25-cornwall , to see [the good miner]2987-the good miner and [[his]2987-the good miner wife]997-his wife , [I]0-i found , in the course of the inquiries which [I]0-i made as to the past , that [they]2989-they still preserved the letters [they]2989-they had written about [me]0-i , while [I]0-i lay ill at [Treen]31-treen . [I]0-i asked permission to take copies of these two documents , as containing materials , which [I]0-i could but ill supply from [my]0-i own resources , for filling up a gap in [my]0-i story . [They]2989-they at once consented ; telling [me]0-i that [they]2989-they had always kept [each other]102-each other 's letters after marriage , as carefully as [they]2989-they kept them before , in token that [their]2989-they first affection remained to the last unchanged . At the same time [they]2989-they entreated [me]0-i , with the most earnest simplicity , to polish [their]2989-they own homely expressions ; and turn them , as [they]2989-they phrased , it , into proper reading . [You]2991-you may easily imagine that [I]0-i knew better than to do this ; and [you]2991-you will , [I]0-i am sure , agree with [me]0-i that both the letters [I]0-i send should be printed as literally as they were copied by [my]0-i hand .

Having now provided for the continuation of [my]0-i story to the period of [my]0-i return [home]176-home , [I]0-i have a word or two to say on the subject of preparing the autobiography for press . Failing in the resolution , even now , to look over [my]0-i manuscript again , [I]0-i leave the corrections it requires to [others]98-others - but on one condition . Let none of the passages in which [I]0-i have related events , or described characters , be either softened or suppressed . [I]0-i am well aware of the tendency , in [some readers]2994-some readers , to denounce truth itself as improbable , unless [their]2994-some readers own personal experience has borne witness to it ; and it is on this very account that [I]0-i am firm in [my]0-i determination to allow of no cringing beforehand to anticipated incredulities . What [I]0-i have written is Truth ; and it shall go into [the world]158-the world as [Truth]94-truth should - entirely uncompromised . Let [my]0-i style be corrected as completely as [you]2996-you will ; but leave characters and events which are taken from realities , real as they are .

In regard to [the surviving persons with whom this narrative associates [me]0-i]2997-the surviving persons with whom this narrative associates me , [I]0-i have little to say which it can concern [the reader]107-the reader to know . [The man whom [I]0-i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of [Sherwin]3000-sherwin]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin is , [I]0-i believe , still alive , and still residing in [France]2-france - whither [he]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin retreated soon after the date of the last events mentioned in [my]0-i autobiography . A new system had been introduced into [his]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin business by [[his]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin assistant]3001-his assistant , which , when left to [his]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin own unaided resources , [he]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin failed to carry out . [His]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin affairs became involved ; a commercial crisis occurred , which [he]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin was wholly unable to meet ; and [he]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin was made [a bankrupt]3002-a bankrupt , having first dishonestly secured to [himself]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin a subsistence for life , out of the wreck of [[his]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin property]3003-his property . [I]0-i accidentally heard of [him]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin , a few years since , as maintaining among [the English residents of [the town]356-the town [he]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin then inhabited]3004-the english residents of the town he then inhabited , the character of [a man who had undeservedly suffered from severe family misfortunes , and who bore [his]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin afflictions with the most exemplary piety and resignation]3006-a man who had undeservedly suffered from severe family misfortunes , and who bore his afflictions with the most exemplary piety and resignation .

To those once connected with [him]2999-the man whom i have presented in the preceding pages under the name of sherwin , who are now no more , [I]0-i need not and can not refer again . That part of the dreary Past with which [they]3007-they are associated , is the part which [I]0-i still shrink in terror from thinking on . There are two names which [my]0-i lips have not uttered for years ; which , in this life , [I]0-i shall never pronounce again . The night of Death is over them : a night to look away from for evermore .

To look away from - but , towards what object ? [The Future]34-the future ? That way , [I]0-i see but dimly even yet . It is on the Present that [my]0-i thoughts are fixed , in the contentment which desires no change .

For the last five months [I]0-i have lived here with [Clara]57-clara - here , on [the little estate which was once [[her]57-clara mother]319-her mother 's , which is now [hers]57-clara]3008-the little estate which was once her mother 's , which is now hers . Long before [[my]0-i father]147-my father 's death [we]3011-we often talked , in [the great country house]3012-the great country house , of future days which [we]3011-we might pass together , as [we]3011-we pass them now , in [this place]3077-this place . Though [we]3011-we may often leave [it]3012-the great country house for a time , [we]3011-we shall always look back to [Lanreath Cottage]32-lanreath cottage as to [[our]3011-we home]3754-our home . The years of retirement which [I]0-i spent at [the Hall]1423-the hall , after [my]0-i recovery , have not awakened in [me]0-i a single longing to return to [the busy world]3016-the busy world . [Ralph]39-ralph - now [the head of [[our]3011-we family]145-our family ; now aroused by [his]3017-the head of our family ; now aroused by his new duties to a sense of his new position new duties to a sense of [his]3017-the head of our family ; now aroused by his new duties to a sense of his new position new position]3017-the head of our family ; now aroused by his new duties to a sense of his new position - [Ralph]39-ralph , already emancipated from many of the habits which once enthralled and degraded [him]3017-the head of our family ; now aroused by his new duties to a sense of his new position , has written , bidding [me]0-i employ to the utmost the resources which [his]3017-the head of our family ; now aroused by his new duties to a sense of his new position position enables [him]3017-the head of our family ; now aroused by his new duties to a sense of his new position to offer [me]0-i , if [I]0-i decide on entering into public life . But [I]0-i have no such purpose ; [I]0-i am still resolved to live on in obscurity , in retirement , in peace . [I]0-i have suffered too much ; [I]0-i have been wounded too sadly , to range [myself]0-i with [the heroes of Ambition]3019-the heroes of ambition , and fight [my]0-i way upward from the ranks . The glory and the glitter which [I]0-i once longed to look on as [my]0-i own , would dazzle and destroy [me]0-i , now . Such shocks as [I]0-i have endured , leave that behind them which changes the character and the purpose of a life . [The mountain - path of Action]3020-the mountain - path of action is no longer a path for [me]0-i ; [my]0-i future hope pauses with [my]0-i present happiness in [the shadowed valley of Repose]3021-the shadowed valley of repose .

Not a repose which owns no duty , and is good for no use ; not a repose which Thought can not ennoble , and Affection can not sanctify . To serve the cause of [the poor]3022-the poor and [the ignorant]3023-the ignorant , in the little sphere which now surrounds [me]0-i ; to smooth the way for pleasure and plenty , where pain and want have made it rugged too long ; to live more and more worthy , with every day , of the sisterly love which , never tiring , never changing , watches over [me]0-i in this last retreat , [this dearest home]3024-this dearest home - these are the purposes , the only purposes left , which [I]0-i may still cherish . Let [me]0-i but live to fulfil them , and life will have given to [me]0-i all that [I]0-i can ask !

[I]0-i may now close [my]0-i letter . [I]0-i have communicated to [you]3025-you all the materials [I]0-i can supply for the conclusion of [my]0-i autobiography , and have furnished [you]3025-you with the only directions [I]0-i wish to give in reference to its publication . Present it to [the reader]107-the reader in any form , and at any time , that [you]3025-you think fit . On its reception by [the public]4028-the public [I]0-i have no wish to speculate . It is enough for [me]0-i to know that , with all its faults , it has been written in sincerity and in truth . [I]0-i shall not feel false shame at [its]3028-its failure , or false pride at its success .

If there be any further information which [you]3025-you think it necessary to possess , and which [I]0-i have forgotten to communicate , write to [me]0-i on the subject - or , far better , come here [yourself]3025-you , and ask of [me]0-i with [your]3025-you own lips all that [you]3025-you desire to know . Come , and judge of the life [I]0-i am now leading , by seeing it as it really is . Though it be only for a few days , pause long enough in [your]3025-you career of activity and usefulness , of fame and honour , to find leisure time for a visit to [the cottage where [we]3030-we live]3029-the cottage where we live . This is as much [Clara]57-clara 's invitation as [mine]0-i . [She]57-clara will never forget even if [I]0-i could ! all that [I]0-i have owed to [your]3025-you friendship - will never weary even if [I]0-i should tire ! of showing [you]3025-you that [we]3030-we are capable of deserving it . Come , then , and see [her]57-clara as well as [me]0-i - see [her]57-clara , once more , [[my]0-i sister of old times]3031-my sister of old times ! [I]0-i remember what [you]3025-you said of [Clara]57-clara , when [we]3030-we last met , and last talked of [her]57-clara ; and [I]0-i believe [you]3025-you will be almost as happy to see [her]57-clara again in [her]57-clara old character as [I]0-i am .

Till then , farewell ! Do not judge [hastily]3032-hastily of [my]0-i motives for persisting in the life of retirement which [I]0-i have led for so many years past . Do not think that calamity has chilled [my]0-i heart , or enervated [my]0-i mind . Past suffering may have changed , but it has not deteriorated [me]0-i . It has fortified [my]0-i spirit with an abiding strength ; it has told [me]0-i plainly , much that was but dimly revealed to [me]0-i before ; it has shown [me]0-i uses to which [I]0-i may put [my]0-i existence , that have their sanction from other voices than the voices of fame ; it has taught [me]0-i to feel that bravest ambition which is vigorous enough to overleap the little life here ! Is there no aspiration in the purposes for which [I]0-i would now live ? - [Bernard]84-mr. bernard ! whatever [we]3033-our can do of good , in [this world]195-this world , with [our]3033-our affections or [our]3033-our faculties , rises to [the Eternal World above [us]3033-our]3035-the eternal world above us , as a song of praise from [Humanity]95-humanity to [God]37-god . Amid the thousand , thousand tones ever joining to swell the music of that song , are those which sound loudest and grandest here , the tones which travel sweetest and purest to the Imperishable Throne ; which mingle in the perfectest harmony with the anthem of the angel - choir ! Ask [your]3036-your own heart that question - and then say , may not the obscurest life - even a life like [mine]0-i - be dignified by a lasting aspiration , and dedicated to a noble aim ?

[I]0-i have done . The calm summer evening has stolen on [me]0-i while [I]0-i have been writing to [you]3036-your ; and [Clara]57-clara 's voice - now the happy voice of the happy old times - calls to [me]0-i from [[our]3033-our garden seat]3037-our garden seat to come out and look at the sunset over [the distant sea]3038-the distant sea . Once more - farewell !
